2508  /* Handle "unset LINENO" et al even if did not find the variable to unset */
2509  handle_changed_special_names(name, name_len);
2510 
2511  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
2512 }
2513 
2514 static int unset_local_var(const char *name)
2515 {
2516  return unset_local_var_len(name, strlen(name));
2517 }
2518 #endif
2519 
2520 
2521 /*
2522  * Helpers for "var1=val1 var2=val2 cmd" feature
2523  */
2524 static void add_vars(struct variable *var)
2525 {
2526  struct variable *next;
2527 
2528  while (var) {
2529  next = var->next;
2530  var->next = G.top_var;
2531  G.top_var = var;
2532  if (var->flg_export) {
2533  debug_printf_env("%s: restoring exported '%s'/%u\n", __func__, var->varstr, var->var_nest_level);
2534  putenv(var->varstr);
2535  } else {
2536  debug_printf_env("%s: restoring variable '%s'/%u\n", __func__, var->varstr, var->var_nest_level);
2537  }
2538  var = next;
2539  }
2540 }
2541 
2542 /* We put strings[i] into variable table and possibly putenv them.
2543  * If variable is read only, we can free the strings[i]
2544  * which attempts to overwrite it.
2545  * The strings[] vector itself is freed.
2546  */
2547 static void set_vars_and_save_old(char **strings)
2548 {
2549  char **s;
2550 
2551  if (!strings)
2552  return;
2553 
2554  s = strings;
2555  while (*s) {
2556  struct variable *var_p;
2557  struct variable **var_pp;
2558  char *eq;
2559 
2560  eq = strchr(*s, '=');
2561  if (HUSH_DEBUG && !eq)
2562  bb_simple_error_msg_and_die("BUG in varexp4");
2563  var_pp = get_ptr_to_local_var(*s, eq - *s);
2564  if (var_pp) {
2565  var_p = *var_pp;
2566  if (var_p->flg_read_only) {
2567  char **p;
2568  bb_error_msg("%s: readonly variable", *s);
2569  /*
2570  * "VAR=V BLTIN" unsets VARs after BLTIN completes.
2571  * If VAR is readonly, leaving it in the list
2572  * after asssignment error (msg above)
2573  * causes doubled error message later, on unset.
2574  */
2575  debug_printf_env("removing/freeing '%s' element\n", *s);
2576  free(*s);
2577  p = s;
2578  do { *p = p[1]; p++; } while (*p);
2579  goto next;
2580  }
2581  /* below, set_local_var() with nest level will
2582  * "shadow" (remove) this variable from
2583  * global linked list.
2584  */
2585  }
2586  debug_printf_env("%s: env override '%s'/%u\n", __func__, *s, G.var_nest_level);
2587  set_local_var(*s, (G.var_nest_level << SETFLAG_VARLVL_SHIFT) | SETFLAG_EXPORT);
2588  s++;
2589  next: ;
2590  }
2591  free(strings);
2592 }
2593 
2594 
2595 /*
2596  * Unicode helper
2597  */
2598 static void reinit_unicode_for_hush(void)
2599 {
2600  /* Unicode support should be activated even if LANG is set
2601  * _during_ shell execution, not only if it was set when
2602  * shell was started. Therefore, re-check LANG every time:
2603  */
2604  if (ENABLE_FEATURE_CHECK_UNICODE_IN_ENV
2605  || ENABLE_UNICODE_USING_LOCALE
2606  ) {
2607  const char *s = get_local_var_value("LC_ALL");
2608  if (!s) s = get_local_var_value("LC_CTYPE");
2609  if (!s) s = get_local_var_value("LANG");
2610  reinit_unicode(s);
2611  }
2612 }
2613 
2614 /*
2615  * in_str support (strings, and "strings" read from files).
2616  */
2617 
2618 #if ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
2619 /* To test correct lineedit/interactive behavior, type from command line:
2620  * echo $P\
2621  * \
2622  * AT\
2623  * H\
2624  * \
2625  * It exercises a lot of corner cases.
2626  */
2627 static const char *setup_prompt_string(void)
2628 {
2629  const char *prompt_str;
2630 
2631  debug_printf_prompt("%s promptmode:%d\n", __func__, G.promptmode);
2632 
2633 # if ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING_FANCY_PROMPT
2634  prompt_str = get_local_var_value(G.promptmode == 0 ? "PS1" : "PS2");
2635  if (!prompt_str)
2636  prompt_str = "";
2637 # else
2638  prompt_str = "> "; /* if PS2, else... */
2639  if (G.promptmode == 0) { /* PS1 */
2640  /* No fancy prompts supported, (re)generate "CURDIR $ " by hand */
2641  free(G.PS1);
2642  /* bash uses $PWD value, even if it is set by user.
2643  * It uses current dir only if PWD is unset.
2644  * We always use current dir. */
2645  prompt_str = G.PS1 = xasprintf("%s %c ", get_cwd(0), (geteuid() != 0) ? '$' : '#');
2646  }
2647 # endif
2648  debug_printf("prompt_str '%s'\n", prompt_str);
2649  return prompt_str;
2650 }
2651 static int get_user_input(struct in_str *i)
2652 {
2653 # if ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING
2654  /* In EDITING case, this function reads next input line,
2655  * saves it in i->p, then returns 1st char of it.
2656  */
2657  int r;
2658  const char *prompt_str;
2659 
2660  prompt_str = setup_prompt_string();
2661  for (;;) {
2662  reinit_unicode_for_hush();
2663  G.flag_SIGINT = 0;
2664 
2665  bb_got_signal = 0;
2666  if (!sigisemptyset(&G.pending_set)) {
2667  /* Whoops, already got a signal, do not call read_line_input */
2668  bb_got_signal = r = -1;
2669  } else {
2670  /* For shell, LI_INTERRUPTIBLE is set:
2671  * read_line_input will abort on either
2672  * getting EINTR in poll(), or if it sees bb_got_signal != 0
2673  * (IOW: if signal arrives before poll() is reached).
2674  * Interactive testcases:
2675  * (while kill -INT $$; do sleep 1; done) &
2676  * #^^^ prints ^C, prints prompt, repeats
2677  * trap 'echo I' int; (while kill -INT $$; do sleep 1; done) &
2678  * #^^^ prints ^C, prints "I", prints prompt, repeats
2679  * trap 'echo T' term; (while kill $$; do sleep 1; done) &
2680  * #^^^ prints "T", prints prompt, repeats
2681  * #(bash 5.0.17 exits after first "T", looks like a bug)
2682  */
2683  r = read_line_input(G.line_input_state, prompt_str,
2684  G.user_input_buf, CONFIG_FEATURE_EDITING_MAX_LEN-1
2685  );
2686  /* read_line_input intercepts ^C, "convert" it to SIGINT */
2687  if (r == 0)
2688  raise(SIGINT);
2689  }
2690  /* bash prints ^C (before running a trap, if any)
2691  * both on keyboard ^C and on real SIGINT (non-kbd generated).
2692  */
2693  if (sigismember(&G.pending_set, SIGINT)) {
2694  write(STDOUT_FILENO, "^C\n", 3);
2695  G.last_exitcode = 128 | SIGINT;
2696  }
2697  check_and_run_traps();
2698  if (r == 0) /* keyboard ^C? */
2699  continue; /* go back, read another input line */
2700  if (r > 0) /* normal input? (no ^C, no ^D, no signals) */
2701  break;
2702  if (!bb_got_signal) {
2703  /* r < 0: ^D/EOF/error detected (but not signal) */
2704  /* ^D on interactive input goes to next line before exiting: */
2705  write(STDOUT_FILENO, "\n", 1);
2706  i->p = NULL;
2707  i->peek_buf[0] = r = EOF;
2708  return r;
2709  }
2710  /* it was a signal: go back, read another input line */
2711  }
2712  i->p = G.user_input_buf;
2713  return (unsigned char)*i->p++;
2714 # else
2715  /* In !EDITING case, this function gets called for every char.
2716  * Buffering happens deeper in the call chain, in hfgetc(i->file).
2717  */
2718  int r;
2719 
2720  for (;;) {
2721  G.flag_SIGINT = 0;
2722  if (i->last_char == '\0' || i->last_char == '\n') {
2723  const char *prompt_str = setup_prompt_string();
2724  /* Why check_and_run_traps here? Try this interactively:
2725  * $ trap 'echo INT' INT; (sleep 2; kill -INT $$) &
2726  * $ <[enter], repeatedly...>
2727  * Without check_and_run_traps, handler never runs.
2728  */
2729  check_and_run_traps();
2730  fputs_stdout(prompt_str);
2731  fflush_all();
2732  }
2733  r = hfgetc(i->file);
2734  /* In !ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING we don't use read_line_input,
2735  * no ^C masking happens during fgetc, no special code for ^C:
2736  * it generates SIGINT as usual.
2737  */
2738  check_and_run_traps();
2739  if (r != '\0' && !G.flag_SIGINT)
2740  break;
2741  if (G.flag_SIGINT) {
2742  /* ^C or SIGINT: repeat */
2743  /* bash prints ^C even on real SIGINT (non-kbd generated) */
2744  /* kernel prints "^C" itself, just print newline: */
2745  write(STDOUT_FILENO, "\n", 1);
2746  G.last_exitcode = 128 | SIGINT;
2747  }
2748  }
2749  return r;
2750 # endif
2751 }
2752 /* This is the magic location that prints prompts
2753  * and gets data back from the user */
2754 static int fgetc_interactive(struct in_str *i)
2755 {
2756  int ch;
2757  /* If it's interactive stdin, get new line. */
2758  if (G_interactive_fd && i->file == G.HFILE_stdin) {
2759  /* Returns first char (or EOF), the rest is in i->p[] */
2760  ch = get_user_input(i);
2761  G.promptmode = 1; /* PS2 */
2762  debug_printf_prompt("%s promptmode=%d\n", __func__, G.promptmode);
2763  } else {
2764  /* Not stdin: script file, sourced file, etc */
2765  do ch = hfgetc(i->file); while (ch == '\0');
2766  }
2767  return ch;
2768 }
2769 #else /* !INTERACTIVE */
2770 static ALWAYS_INLINE int fgetc_interactive(struct in_str *i)
2771 {
2772  int ch;
2773  do ch = hfgetc(i->file); while (ch == '\0');
2774  return ch;
2775 }
2776 #endif /* !INTERACTIVE */
2777 
2778 static int i_getch(struct in_str *i)
2779 {
2780  int ch;
2781 
2782  if (!i->file) {
2783  /* string-based in_str */
2784  ch = (unsigned char)*i->p;
2785  if (ch != '\0') {
2786  i->p++;
2787  i->last_char = ch;
2788 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
2789  if (ch == '\n') {
2790  G.parse_lineno++;
2791  debug_printf_parse("G.parse_lineno++ = %u\n", G.parse_lineno);
2792  }
2793 #endif
2794  return ch;
2795  }
2796  return EOF;
2797  }
2798 
2799  /* FILE-based in_str */
2800 
2801 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING
2802  /* This can be stdin, check line editing char[] buffer */
2803  if (i->p && *i->p != '\0') {
2804  ch = (unsigned char)*i->p++;
2805  goto out;
2806  }
2807 #endif
2808  /* peek_buf[] is an int array, not char. Can contain EOF. */
2809  ch = i->peek_buf[0];
2810  if (ch != 0) {
2811  int ch2 = i->peek_buf[1];
2812  i->peek_buf[0] = ch2;
2813  if (ch2 == 0) /* very likely, avoid redundant write */
2814  goto out;
2815  i->peek_buf[1] = 0;
2816  goto out;
2817  }
2818 
2819  ch = fgetc_interactive(i);
2820  out:
2821  debug_printf("file_get: got '%c' %d\n", ch, ch);
2822  i->last_char = ch;
2823 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
2824  if (ch == '\n') {
2825  G.parse_lineno++;
2826  debug_printf_parse("G.parse_lineno++ = %u\n", G.parse_lineno);
2827  }
2828 #endif
2829  return ch;
2830 }
2831 
2832 static int i_peek(struct in_str *i)
2833 {
2834  int ch;
2835 
2836  if (!i->file) {
2837  /* string-based in_str */
2838  /* Doesn't report EOF on NUL. None of the callers care. */
2839  return (unsigned char)*i->p;
2840  }
2841 
2842  /* FILE-based in_str */
2843 
2844 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING && ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
2845  /* This can be stdin, check line editing char[] buffer */
2846  if (i->p && *i->p != '\0')
2847  return (unsigned char)*i->p;
2848 #endif
2849  /* peek_buf[] is an int array, not char. Can contain EOF. */
2850  ch = i->peek_buf[0];
2851  if (ch != 0)
2852  return ch;
2853 
2854  /* Need to get a new char */
2855  ch = fgetc_interactive(i);
2856  debug_printf("file_peek: got '%c' %d\n", ch, ch);
2857 
2858  /* Save it by either rolling back line editing buffer, or in i->peek_buf[0] */
2859 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING && ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
2860  if (i->p) {
2861  i->p -= 1;
2862  return ch;
2863  }
2864 #endif
2865  i->peek_buf[0] = ch;
2866  /*i->peek_buf[1] = 0; - already is */
2867  return ch;
2868 }
2869 
2870 /* Only ever called if i_peek() was called, and did not return EOF.
2871  * IOW: we know the previous peek saw an ordinary char, not EOF, not NUL,
2872  * not end-of-line. Therefore we never need to read a new editing line here.
2873  */
2874 static int i_peek2(struct in_str *i)
2875 {
2876  int ch;
2877 
2878  /* There are two cases when i->p[] buffer exists.
2879  * (1) it's a string in_str.
2880  * (2) It's a file, and we have a saved line editing buffer.
2881  * In both cases, we know that i->p[0] exists and not NUL, and
2882  * the peek2 result is in i->p[1].
2883  */
2884  if (i->p)
2885  return (unsigned char)i->p[1];
2886 
2887  /* Now we know it is a file-based in_str. */
2888 
2889  /* peek_buf[] is an int array, not char. Can contain EOF. */
2890  /* Is there 2nd char? */
2891  ch = i->peek_buf[1];
2892  if (ch == 0) {
2893  /* We did not read it yet, get it now */
2894  do ch = hfgetc(i->file); while (ch == '\0');
2895  i->peek_buf[1] = ch;
2896  }
2897 
2898  debug_printf("file_peek2: got '%c' %d\n", ch, ch);
2899  return ch;
2900 }
2901 
2902 static int i_getch_and_eat_bkslash_nl(struct in_str *input)
2903 {
2904  for (;;) {
2905  int ch, ch2;
2906 
2907  ch = i_getch(input);
2908  if (ch != '\\')
2909  return ch;
2910  ch2 = i_peek(input);
2911  if (ch2 != '\n')
2912  return ch;
2913  /* backslash+newline, skip it */
2914  i_getch(input);
2915  }
2916 }
2917 
2918 /* Note: this function _eats_ <newline> pairs, safe to use plain
2919  * i_getch() after it instead of i_getch_and_eat_bkslash_nl().
2920  */
2921 static int i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(struct in_str *input)
2922 {
2923  for (;;) {
2924  int ch, ch2;
2925 
2926  ch = i_peek(input);
2927  if (ch != '\\')
2928  return ch;
2929  ch2 = i_peek2(input);
2930  if (ch2 != '\n')
2931  return ch;
2932  /* backslash+newline, skip it */
2933  i_getch(input);
2934  i_getch(input);
2935  }
2936 }
2937 
2938 static void setup_file_in_str(struct in_str *i, HFILE *fp)
2939 {
2940  memset(i, 0, sizeof(*i));
2941  i->file = fp;
2942  /* i->p = NULL; */
2943 }
2944 
2945 static void setup_string_in_str(struct in_str *i, const char *s)
2946 {
2947  memset(i, 0, sizeof(*i));
2948  /*i->file = NULL */;
2949  i->p = s;
2950 }
2951 
2952 
2953 /*
2954  * o_string support
2955  */
2956 #define B_CHUNK (32 * sizeof(char*))
2957 
2958 static void o_reset_to_empty_unquoted(o_string *o)
2959 {
2960  o->length = 0;
2961  o->has_quoted_part = 0;
2962  if (o->data)
2963  o->data[0] = '\0';
2964 }
2965 
2966 static void o_free_and_set_NULL(o_string *o)
2967 {
2968  free(o->data);
2969  memset(o, 0, sizeof(*o));
2970 }
2971 
2972 static ALWAYS_INLINE void o_free(o_string *o)
2973 {
2974  free(o->data);
2975 }
2976 
2977 static void o_grow_by(o_string *o, int len)
2978 {
2979  if (o->length + len > o->maxlen) {
2980  o->maxlen += (2 * len) | (B_CHUNK-1);
2981  o->data = xrealloc(o->data, 1 + o->maxlen);
2982  }
2983 }
2984 
2985 static void o_addchr(o_string *o, int ch)
2986 {
2987  debug_printf("o_addchr: '%c' o->length=%d o=%p\n", ch, o->length, o);
2988  if (o->length < o->maxlen) {
2989  /* likely. avoid o_grow_by() call */
2990  add:
2991  o->data[o->length] = ch;
2992  o->length++;
2993  o->data[o->length] = '\0';
2994  return;
2995  }
2996  o_grow_by(o, 1);
2997  goto add;
2998 }
2999 
3000 #if 0
3001 /* Valid only if we know o_string is not empty */
3002 static void o_delchr(o_string *o)
3003 {
3004  o->length--;
3005  o->data[o->length] = '\0';
3006 }
3007 #endif
3008 
3009 static void o_addblock(o_string *o, const char *str, int len)
3010 {
3011  o_grow_by(o, len);
3012  ((char*)mempcpy(&o->data[o->length], str, len))[0] = '\0';
3013  o->length += len;
3014 }
3015 
3016 static void o_addstr(o_string *o, const char *str)
3017 {
3018  o_addblock(o, str, strlen(str));
3019 }
3020 
3021 static void o_addstr_with_NUL(o_string *o, const char *str)
3022 {
3023  o_addblock(o, str, strlen(str) + 1);
3024 }
3025 
3026 #if !BB_MMU
3027 static void nommu_addchr(o_string *o, int ch)
3028 {
3029  if (o)
3030  o_addchr(o, ch);
3031 }
3032 #else
3033 # define nommu_addchr(o, str) ((void)0)
3034 #endif
3035 
3036 #if ENABLE_HUSH_MODE_X
3037 static void x_mode_addchr(int ch)
3038 {
3039  o_addchr(&G.x_mode_buf, ch);
3040 }
3041 static void x_mode_addstr(const char *str)
3042 {
3043  o_addstr(&G.x_mode_buf, str);
3044 }
3045 static void x_mode_addblock(const char *str, int len)
3046 {
3047  o_addblock(&G.x_mode_buf, str, len);
3048 }
3049 static void x_mode_prefix(void)
3050 {
3051  int n = G.x_mode_depth;
3052  do x_mode_addchr('+'); while (--n >= 0);
3053 }
3054 static void x_mode_flush(void)
3055 {
3056  int len = G.x_mode_buf.length;
3057  if (len <= 0)
3058  return;
3059  if (G.x_mode_fd > 0) {
3060  G.x_mode_buf.data[len] = '\n';
3061  full_write(G.x_mode_fd, G.x_mode_buf.data, len + 1);
3062  }
3063  G.x_mode_buf.length = 0;
3064 }
3065 #endif
3066 
3067 /*
3068  * HUSH_BRACE_EXPANSION code needs corresponding quoting on variable expansion side.
3069  * Currently, "v='{q,w}'; echo $v" erroneously expands braces in $v.
3070  * Apparently, on unquoted $v bash still does globbing
3071  * ("v='*.txt'; echo $v" prints all .txt files),
3072  * but NOT brace expansion! Thus, there should be TWO independent
3073  * quoting mechanisms on $v expansion side: one protects
3074  * $v from brace expansion, and other additionally protects "$v" against globbing.
3075  * We have only second one.
3076  */
3077 
3078 #if ENABLE_HUSH_BRACE_EXPANSION
3079 # define MAYBE_BRACES "{}"
3080 #else
3081 # define MAYBE_BRACES ""
3082 #endif
3083 
3084 /* My analysis of quoting semantics tells me that state information
3085  * is associated with a destination, not a source.
3086  */
3087 static void o_addqchr(o_string *o, int ch)
3088 {
3089  int sz = 1;
3090  /* '-' is included because of this case:
3091  * >filename0 >filename1 >filename9; v='-'; echo filename[0"$v"9]
3092  */
3093  char *found = strchr("*?[-\\" MAYBE_BRACES, ch);
3094  if (found)
3095  sz++;
3096  o_grow_by(o, sz);
3097  if (found) {
3098  o->data[o->length] = '\\';
3099  o->length++;
3100  }
3101  o->data[o->length] = ch;
3102  o->length++;
3103  o->data[o->length] = '\0';
3104 }
3105 
3106 static void o_addQchr(o_string *o, int ch)
3107 {
3108  int sz = 1;
3109  if ((o->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS)
3110  && strchr("*?[-\\" MAYBE_BRACES, ch)
3111  ) {
3112  sz++;
3113  o->data[o->length] = '\\';
3114  o->length++;
3115  }
3116  o_grow_by(o, sz);
3117  o->data[o->length] = ch;
3118  o->length++;
3119  o->data[o->length] = '\0';
3120 }
3121 
3122 static void o_addqblock(o_string *o, const char *str, int len)
3123 {
3124  while (len) {
3125  char ch;
3126  int sz;
3127  int ordinary_cnt = strcspn(str, "*?[-\\" MAYBE_BRACES);
3128  if (ordinary_cnt > len) /* paranoia */
3129  ordinary_cnt = len;
3130  o_addblock(o, str, ordinary_cnt);
3131  if (ordinary_cnt == len)
3132  return; /* NUL is already added by o_addblock */
3133  str += ordinary_cnt;
3134  len -= ordinary_cnt + 1; /* we are processing + 1 char below */
3135 
3136  ch = *str++;
3137  sz = 1;
3138  if (ch) { /* it is necessarily one of "*?[-\\" MAYBE_BRACES */
3139  sz++;
3140  o->data[o->length] = '\\';
3141  o->length++;
3142  }
3143  o_grow_by(o, sz);
3144  o->data[o->length] = ch;
3145  o->length++;
3146  }
3147  o->data[o->length] = '\0';
3148 }
3149 
3150 static void o_addQblock(o_string *o, const char *str, int len)
3151 {
3152  if (!(o->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS)) {
3153  o_addblock(o, str, len);
3154  return;
3155  }
3156  o_addqblock(o, str, len);
3157 }
3158 
3159 static void o_addQstr(o_string *o, const char *str)
3160 {
3161  o_addQblock(o, str, strlen(str));
3162 }
3163 
3164 /* A special kind of o_string for $VAR and `cmd` expansion.
3165  * It contains char* list[] at the beginning, which is grown in 16 element
3166  * increments. Actual string data starts at the next multiple of 16 * (char*).
3167  * list[i] contains an INDEX (int!) into this string data.
3168  * It means that if list[] needs to grow, data needs to be moved higher up
3169  * but list[i]'s need not be modified.
3170  * NB: remembering how many list[i]'s you have there is crucial.
3171  * o_finalize_list() operation post-processes this structure - calculates
3172  * and stores actual char* ptrs in list[]. Oh, it NULL terminates it as well.
3173  */
3174 #if DEBUG_EXPAND || DEBUG_GLOB
3175 static void debug_print_list(const char *prefix, o_string *o, int n)
3176 {
3177  char **list = (char**)o->data;
3178  int string_start = ((n + 0xf) & ~0xf) * sizeof(list[0]);
3179  int i = 0;
3180 
3181  indent();
3182  fdprintf(2, "%s: list:%p n:%d string_start:%d length:%d maxlen:%d glob:%d quoted:%d escape:%d\n",
3183  prefix, list, n, string_start, o->length, o->maxlen,
3184  !!(o->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_GLOB),
3185  o->has_quoted_part,
3186  !!(o->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS));
3187  while (i < n) {
3188  indent();
3189  fdprintf(2, " list[%d]=%d '%s' %p\n", i, (int)(uintptr_t)list[i],
3190  o->data + (int)(uintptr_t)list[i] + string_start,
3191  o->data + (int)(uintptr_t)list[i] + string_start);
3192  i++;
3193  }
3194  if (n) {
3195  const char *p = o->data + (int)(uintptr_t)list[n - 1] + string_start;
3196  indent();
3197  fdprintf(2, " total_sz:%ld\n", (long)((p + strlen(p) + 1) - o->data));
3198  }
3199 }
3200 #else
3201 # define debug_print_list(prefix, o, n) ((void)0)
3202 #endif
3203 
3204 /* n = o_save_ptr_helper(str, n) "starts new string" by storing an index value
3205  * in list[n] so that it points past last stored byte so far.
3206  * It returns n+1. */
3207 static int o_save_ptr_helper(o_string *o, int n)
3208 {
3209  char **list = (char**)o->data;
3210  int string_start;
3211  int string_len;
3212 
3213  if (!o->has_empty_slot) {
3214  string_start = ((n + 0xf) & ~0xf) * sizeof(list[0]);
3215  string_len = o->length - string_start;
3216  if (!(n & 0xf)) { /* 0, 0x10, 0x20...? */
3217  debug_printf_list("list[%d]=%d string_start=%d (growing)\n", n, string_len, string_start);
3218  /* list[n] points to string_start, make space for 16 more pointers */
3219  o->maxlen += 0x10 * sizeof(list[0]);
3220  o->data = xrealloc(o->data, o->maxlen + 1);
3221  list = (char**)o->data;
3222  memmove(list + n + 0x10, list + n, string_len);
3223  /*
3224  * expand_on_ifs() has a "previous argv[] ends in IFS?"
3225  * check. (grep for -prev-ifs-check-).
3226  * Ensure that argv[-1][last] is not garbage
3227  * but zero bytes, to save index check there.
3228  */
3229  list[n + 0x10 - 1] = 0;
3230  o->length += 0x10 * sizeof(list[0]);
3231  } else {
3232  debug_printf_list("list[%d]=%d string_start=%d\n",
3233  n, string_len, string_start);
3234  }
3235  } else {
3236  /* We have empty slot at list[n], reuse without growth */
3237  string_start = ((n+1 + 0xf) & ~0xf) * sizeof(list[0]); /* NB: n+1! */
3238  string_len = o->length - string_start;
3239  debug_printf_list("list[%d]=%d string_start=%d (empty slot)\n",
3240  n, string_len, string_start);
3241  o->has_empty_slot = 0;
3242  }
3243  o->has_quoted_part = 0;
3244  list[n] = (char*)(uintptr_t)string_len;
3245  return n + 1;
3246 }
3247 
3248 /* "What was our last o_save_ptr'ed position (byte offset relative o->data)?" */
3249 static int o_get_last_ptr(o_string *o, int n)
3250 {
3251  char **list = (char**)o->data;
3252  int string_start = ((n + 0xf) & ~0xf) * sizeof(list[0]);
3253 
3254  return ((int)(uintptr_t)list[n-1]) + string_start;
3255 }
3256 
3257 /*
3258  * Globbing routines.
3259  *
3260  * Most words in commands need to be globbed, even ones which are
3261  * (single or double) quoted. This stems from the possiblity of
3262  * constructs like "abc"* and 'abc'* - these should be globbed.
3263  * Having a different code path for fully-quoted strings ("abc",
3264  * 'abc') would only help performance-wise, but we still need
3265  * code for partially-quoted strings.
3266  *
3267  * Unfortunately, if we want to match bash and ash behavior in all cases,
3268  * the logic can't be "shell-syntax argument is first transformed
3269  * to a string, then globbed, and if globbing does not match anything,
3270  * it is used verbatim". Here are two examples where it fails:
3271  *
3272  * echo 'b\*'?
3273  *
3274  * The globbing can't be avoided (because of '?' at the end).
3275  * The glob pattern is: b\\\*? - IOW, both \ and * are literals
3276  * and are glob-escaped. If this does not match, bash/ash print b\*?
3277  * - IOW: they "unbackslash" the glob pattern.
3278  * Now, look at this:
3279  *
3280  * v='\\\*'; echo b$v?
3281  *
3282  * The glob pattern is the same here: b\\\*? - the unquoted $v expansion
3283  * should be used as glob pattern with no changes. However, if glob
3284  * does not match, bash/ash print b\\\*? - NOT THE SAME as first example!
3285  *
3286  * ash implements this by having an encoded representation of the word
3287  * to glob, which IS NOT THE SAME as the glob pattern - it has more data.
3288  * Glob pattern is derived from it. If glob fails, the decision what result
3289  * should be is made using that encoded representation. Not glob pattern.
3290  */
3291 
3292 #if ENABLE_HUSH_BRACE_EXPANSION
3293 /* There in a GNU extension, GLOB_BRACE, but it is not usable:
3294  * first, it processes even {a} (no commas), second,
3295  * I didn't manage to make it return strings when they don't match
3296  * existing files. Need to re-implement it.
3297  */
3298 
3299 /* Helper */
3300 static int glob_needed(const char *s)
3301 {
3302  while (*s) {
3303  if (*s == '\\') {
3304  if (!s[1])
3305  return 0;
3306  s += 2;
3307  continue;
3308  }
3309  if (*s == '*' || *s == '[' || *s == '?' || *s == '{')
3310  return 1;
3311  s++;
3312  }
3313  return 0;
3314 }
3315 /* Return pointer to next closing brace or to comma */
3316 static const char *next_brace_sub(const char *cp)
3317 {
3318  unsigned depth = 0;
3319  cp++;
3320  while (*cp != '\0') {
3321  if (*cp == '\\') {
3322  if (*++cp == '\0')
3323  break;
3324  cp++;
3325  continue;
3326  }
3327  if ((*cp == '}' && depth-- == 0) || (*cp == ',' && depth == 0))
3328  break;
3329  if (*cp++ == '{')
3330  depth++;
3331  }
3332 
3333  return *cp != '\0' ? cp : NULL;
3334 }
3335 /* Recursive brace globber. Note: may garble pattern[]. */
3336 static int glob_brace(char *pattern, o_string *o, int n)
3337 {
3338  char *new_pattern_buf;
3339  const char *begin;
3340  const char *next;
3341  const char *rest;
3342  const char *p;
3343  size_t rest_len;
3344 
3345  debug_printf_glob("glob_brace('%s')\n", pattern);
3346 
3347  begin = pattern;
3348  while (1) {
3349  if (*begin == '\0')
3350  goto simple_glob;
3351  if (*begin == '{') {
3352  /* Find the first sub-pattern and at the same time
3353  * find the rest after the closing brace */
3354  next = next_brace_sub(begin);
3355  if (next == NULL) {
3356  /* An illegal expression */
3357  goto simple_glob;
3358  }
3359  if (*next == '}') {
3360  /* "{abc}" with no commas - illegal
3361  * brace expr, disregard and skip it */
3362  begin = next + 1;
3363  continue;
3364  }
3365  break;
3366  }
3367  if (*begin == '\\' && begin[1] != '\0')
3368  begin++;
3369  begin++;
3370  }
3371  debug_printf_glob("begin:%s\n", begin);
3372  debug_printf_glob("next:%s\n", next);
3373 
3374  /* Now find the end of the whole brace expression */
3375  rest = next;
3376  while (*rest != '}') {
3377  rest = next_brace_sub(rest);
3378  if (rest == NULL) {
3379  /* An illegal expression */
3380  goto simple_glob;
3381  }
3382  debug_printf_glob("rest:%s\n", rest);
3383  }
3384  rest_len = strlen(++rest) + 1;
3385 
3386  /* We are sure the brace expression is well-formed */
3387 
3388  /* Allocate working buffer large enough for our work */
3389  new_pattern_buf = xmalloc(strlen(pattern));
3390 
3391  /* We have a brace expression. BEGIN points to the opening {,
3392  * NEXT points past the terminator of the first element, and REST
3393  * points past the final }. We will accumulate result names from
3394  * recursive runs for each brace alternative in the buffer using
3395  * GLOB_APPEND. */
3396 
3397  p = begin + 1;
3398  while (1) {
3399  /* Construct the new glob expression */
3400  memcpy(
3401  mempcpy(
3402  mempcpy(new_pattern_buf,
3403  /* We know the prefix for all sub-patterns */
3404  pattern, begin - pattern),
3405  p, next - p),
3406  rest, rest_len);
3407 
3408  /* Note: glob_brace() may garble new_pattern_buf[].
3409  * That's why we re-copy prefix every time (1st memcpy above).
3410  */
3411  n = glob_brace(new_pattern_buf, o, n);
3412  if (*next == '}') {
3413  /* We saw the last entry */
3414  break;
3415  }
3416  p = next + 1;
3417  next = next_brace_sub(next);
3418  }
3419  free(new_pattern_buf);
3420  return n;
3421 
3422  simple_glob:
3423  {
3424  int gr;
3425  glob_t globdata;
3426 
3427  memset(&globdata, 0, sizeof(globdata));
3428  gr = glob(pattern, 0, NULL, &globdata);
3429  debug_printf_glob("glob('%s'):%d\n", pattern, gr);
3430  if (gr != 0) {
3431  if (gr == GLOB_NOMATCH) {
3432  globfree(&globdata);
3433  /* NB: garbles parameter */
3434  unbackslash(pattern);
3435  o_addstr_with_NUL(o, pattern);
3436  debug_printf_glob("glob pattern '%s' is literal\n", pattern);
3437  return o_save_ptr_helper(o, n);
3438  }
3439  if (gr == GLOB_NOSPACE)
3440  bb_die_memory_exhausted();
3441  /* GLOB_ABORTED? Only happens with GLOB_ERR flag,
3442  * but we didn't specify it. Paranoia again. */
3443  bb_error_msg_and_die("glob error %d on '%s'", gr, pattern);
3444  }
3445  if (globdata.gl_pathv && globdata.gl_pathv[0]) {
3446  char **argv = globdata.gl_pathv;
3447  while (1) {
3448  o_addstr_with_NUL(o, *argv);
3449  n = o_save_ptr_helper(o, n);
3450  argv++;
3451  if (!*argv)
3452  break;
3453  }
3454  }
3455  globfree(&globdata);
3456  }
3457  return n;
3458 }
3459 /* Performs globbing on last list[],
3460  * saving each result as a new list[].
3461  */
3462 static int perform_glob(o_string *o, int n)
3463 {
3464  char *pattern, *copy;
3465 
3466  debug_printf_glob("start perform_glob: n:%d o->data:%p\n", n, o->data);
3467  if (!o->data)
3468  return o_save_ptr_helper(o, n);
3469  pattern = o->data + o_get_last_ptr(o, n);
3470  debug_printf_glob("glob pattern '%s'\n", pattern);
3471  if (!glob_needed(pattern)) {
3472  /* unbackslash last string in o in place, fix length */
3473  o->length = unbackslash(pattern) - o->data;
3474  debug_printf_glob("glob pattern '%s' is literal\n", pattern);
3475  return o_save_ptr_helper(o, n);
3476  }
3477 
3478  copy = xstrdup(pattern);
3479  /* "forget" pattern in o */
3480  o->length = pattern - o->data;
3481  n = glob_brace(copy, o, n);
3482  free(copy);
3483  if (DEBUG_GLOB)
3484  debug_print_list("perform_glob returning", o, n);
3485  return n;
3486 }
3487 
3488 #else /* !HUSH_BRACE_EXPANSION */
3489 
3490 /* Helper */
3491 static int glob_needed(const char *s)
3492 {
3493  while (*s) {
3494  if (*s == '\\') {
3495  if (!s[1])
3496  return 0;
3497  s += 2;
3498  continue;
3499  }
3500  if (*s == '*' || *s == '[' || *s == '?')
3501  return 1;
3502  s++;
3503  }
3504  return 0;
3505 }
3506 /* Performs globbing on last list[],
3507  * saving each result as a new list[].
3508  */
3509 static int perform_glob(o_string *o, int n)
3510 {
3511  glob_t globdata;
3512  int gr;
3513  char *pattern;
3514 
3515  debug_printf_glob("start perform_glob: n:%d o->data:%p\n", n, o->data);
3516  if (!o->data)
3517  return o_save_ptr_helper(o, n);
3518  pattern = o->data + o_get_last_ptr(o, n);
3519  debug_printf_glob("glob pattern '%s'\n", pattern);
3520  if (!glob_needed(pattern)) {
3521  literal:
3522  /* unbackslash last string in o in place, fix length */
3523  o->length = unbackslash(pattern) - o->data;
3524  debug_printf_glob("glob pattern '%s' is literal\n", pattern);
3525  return o_save_ptr_helper(o, n);
3526  }
3527 
3528  memset(&globdata, 0, sizeof(globdata));
3529  /* Can't use GLOB_NOCHECK: it does not unescape the string.
3530  * If we glob "*.\*" and don't find anything, we need
3531  * to fall back to using literal "*.*", but GLOB_NOCHECK
3532  * will return "*.\*"!
3533  */
3534  gr = glob(pattern, 0, NULL, &globdata);
3535  debug_printf_glob("glob('%s'):%d\n", pattern, gr);
3536  if (gr != 0) {
3537  if (gr == GLOB_NOMATCH) {
3538  globfree(&globdata);
3539  goto literal;
3540  }
3541  if (gr == GLOB_NOSPACE)
3542  bb_die_memory_exhausted();
3543  /* GLOB_ABORTED? Only happens with GLOB_ERR flag,
3544  * but we didn't specify it. Paranoia again. */
3545  bb_error_msg_and_die("glob error %d on '%s'", gr, pattern);
3546  }
3547  if (globdata.gl_pathv && globdata.gl_pathv[0]) {
3548  char **argv = globdata.gl_pathv;
3549  /* "forget" pattern in o */
3550  o->length = pattern - o->data;
3551  while (1) {
3552  o_addstr_with_NUL(o, *argv);
3553  n = o_save_ptr_helper(o, n);
3554  argv++;
3555  if (!*argv)
3556  break;
3557  }
3558  }
3559  globfree(&globdata);
3560  if (DEBUG_GLOB)
3561  debug_print_list("perform_glob returning", o, n);
3562  return n;
3563 }
3564 
3565 #endif /* !HUSH_BRACE_EXPANSION */
3566 
3567 /* If o->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_GLOB, glob the string so far remembered.
3568  * Otherwise, just finish current list[] and start new */
3569 static int o_save_ptr(o_string *o, int n)
3570 {
3571  if (o->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_GLOB) {
3572  /* If o->has_empty_slot, list[n] was already globbed
3573  * (if it was requested back then when it was filled)
3574  * so don't do that again! */
3575  if (!o->has_empty_slot)
3576  return perform_glob(o, n); /* o_save_ptr_helper is inside */
3577  }
3578  return o_save_ptr_helper(o, n);
3579 }
3580 
3581 /* "Please convert list[n] to real char* ptrs, and NULL terminate it." */
3582 static char **o_finalize_list(o_string *o, int n)
3583 {
3584  char **list;
3585  int string_start;
3586 
3587  if (DEBUG_EXPAND)
3588  debug_print_list("finalized", o, n);
3589  debug_printf_expand("finalized n:%d\n", n);
3590  list = (char**)o->data;
3591  string_start = ((n + 0xf) & ~0xf) * sizeof(list[0]);
3592  list[--n] = NULL;
3593  while (n) {
3594  n--;
3595  list[n] = o->data + (int)(uintptr_t)list[n] + string_start;
3596  }
3597  return list;
3598 }
3599 
3600 static void free_pipe_list(struct pipe *pi);
3601 
3602 /* Returns pi->next - next pipe in the list */
3603 static struct pipe *free_pipe(struct pipe *pi)
3604 {
3605  struct pipe *next;
3606  int i;
3607 
3608  debug_printf_clean("free_pipe (pid %d)\n", getpid());
3609  for (i = 0; i < pi->num_cmds; i++) {
3610  struct command *command;
3611  struct redir_struct *r, *rnext;
3612 
3613  command = &pi->cmds[i];
3614  debug_printf_clean(" command %d:\n", i);
3615  if (command->argv) {
3616  if (DEBUG_CLEAN) {
3617  int a;
3618  char **p;
3619  for (a = 0, p = command->argv; *p; a++, p++) {
3620  debug_printf_clean(" argv[%d] = %s\n", a, *p);
3621  }
3622  }
3623  free_strings(command->argv);
3624  //command->argv = NULL;
3625  }
3626  /* not "else if": on syntax error, we may have both! */
3627  if (command->group) {
3628  debug_printf_clean(" begin group (cmd_type:%d)\n",
3629  command->cmd_type);
3630  free_pipe_list(command->group);
3631  debug_printf_clean(" end group\n");
3632  //command->group = NULL;
3633  }
3634  /* else is crucial here.
3635  * If group != NULL, child_func is meaningless */
3636 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
3637  else if (command->child_func) {
3638  debug_printf_exec("cmd %p releases child func at %p\n", command, command->child_func);
3639  command->child_func->parent_cmd = NULL;
3640  }
3641 #endif
3642 #if !BB_MMU
3643  free(command->group_as_string);
3644  //command->group_as_string = NULL;
3645 #endif
3646  for (r = command->redirects; r; r = rnext) {
3647  debug_printf_clean(" redirect %d%s",
3648  r->rd_fd, redir_table[r->rd_type].descrip);
3649  /* guard against the case >$FOO, where foo is unset or blank */
3650  if (r->rd_filename) {
3651  debug_printf_clean(" fname:'%s'\n", r->rd_filename);
3652  free(r->rd_filename);
3653  //r->rd_filename = NULL;
3654  }
3655  debug_printf_clean(" rd_dup:%d\n", r->rd_dup);
3656  rnext = r->next;
3657  free(r);
3658  }
3659  //command->redirects = NULL;
3660  }
3661  free(pi->cmds); /* children are an array, they get freed all at once */
3662  //pi->cmds = NULL;
3663 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
3664  free(pi->cmdtext);
3665  //pi->cmdtext = NULL;
3666 #endif
3667 
3668  next = pi->next;
3669  free(pi);
3670  return next;
3671 }
3672 
3673 static void free_pipe_list(struct pipe *pi)
3674 {
3675  while (pi) {
3676 #if HAS_KEYWORDS
3677  debug_printf_clean("pipe reserved word %d\n", pi->res_word);
3678 #endif
3679  debug_printf_clean("pipe followup code %d\n", pi->followup);
3680  pi = free_pipe(pi);
3681  }
3682 }
3683 
3684 
3685 /*** Parsing routines ***/
3686 
3687 #ifndef debug_print_tree
3688 static void debug_print_tree(struct pipe *pi, int lvl)
3689 {
3690  static const char *const PIPE[] ALIGN_PTR = {
3691  [PIPE_SEQ] = "SEQ",
3692  [PIPE_AND] = "AND",
3693  [PIPE_OR ] = "OR" ,
3694  [PIPE_BG ] = "BG" ,
3695  };
3696  static const char *RES[] = {
3697  [RES_NONE ] = "NONE" ,
3698 # if ENABLE_HUSH_IF
3699  [RES_IF ] = "IF" ,
3700  [RES_THEN ] = "THEN" ,
3701  [RES_ELIF ] = "ELIF" ,
3702  [RES_ELSE ] = "ELSE" ,
3703  [RES_FI ] = "FI" ,
3704 # endif
3705 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
3706  [RES_FOR ] = "FOR" ,
3707  [RES_WHILE] = "WHILE",
3708  [RES_UNTIL] = "UNTIL",
3709  [RES_DO ] = "DO" ,
3710  [RES_DONE ] = "DONE" ,
3711 # endif
3712 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS || ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
3713  [RES_IN ] = "IN" ,
3714 # endif
3715 # if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
3716  [RES_CASE ] = "CASE" ,
3717  [RES_CASE_IN ] = "CASE_IN" ,
3718  [RES_MATCH] = "MATCH",
3719  [RES_CASE_BODY] = "CASE_BODY",
3720  [RES_ESAC ] = "ESAC" ,
3721 # endif
3722  [RES_XXXX ] = "XXXX" ,
3723  [RES_SNTX ] = "SNTX" ,
3724  };
3725  static const char *const CMDTYPE[] ALIGN_PTR = {
3726  "{}",
3727  "()",
3728  "[noglob]",
3729 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
3730  "func()",
3731 # endif
3732  };
3733 
3734  int pin, prn;
3735 
3736  pin = 0;
3737  while (pi) {
3738  fdprintf(2, "%*spipe %d #cmds:%d %sres_word=%s followup=%d %s\n",
3739  lvl*2, "",
3740  pin,
3741  pi->num_cmds,
3742  (IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(pi->pi_inverted ? "! " :) ""),
3743  RES[pi->res_word],
3744  pi->followup, PIPE[pi->followup]
3745  );
3746  prn = 0;
3747  while (prn < pi->num_cmds) {
3748  struct command *command = &pi->cmds[prn];
3749  char **argv = command->argv;
3750 
3751  fdprintf(2, "%*s cmd %d assignment_cnt:%d",
3752  lvl*2, "", prn,
3753  command->assignment_cnt);
3754 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
3755  fdprintf(2, " LINENO:%u", command->lineno);
3756 # endif
3757  if (command->group) {
3758  fdprintf(2, " group %s: (argv=%p)%s%s\n",
3759  CMDTYPE[command->cmd_type],
3760  argv
3761 # if !BB_MMU
3762  , " group_as_string:", command->group_as_string
3763 # else
3764  , "", ""
3765 # endif
3766  );
3767  debug_print_tree(command->group, lvl+1);
3768  prn++;
3769  continue;
3770  }
3771  if (argv) while (*argv) {
3772  fdprintf(2, " '%s'", *argv);
3773  argv++;
3774  }
3775  if (command->redirects)
3776  fdprintf(2, " {redir}");
3777  fdprintf(2, "\n");
3778  prn++;
3779  }
3780  pi = pi->next;
3781  pin++;
3782  }
3783 }
3784 #endif /* debug_print_tree */
3785 
3786 static struct pipe *new_pipe(void)
3787 {
3788  struct pipe *pi;
3789  pi = xzalloc(sizeof(struct pipe));
3790  /*pi->res_word = RES_NONE; - RES_NONE is 0 anyway */
3791  return pi;
3792 }
3793 
3794 /* Command (member of a pipe) is complete, or we start a new pipe
3795  * if ctx->command is NULL.
3796  * No errors possible here.
3797  */
3798 static int done_command(struct parse_context *ctx)
3799 {
3800  /* The command is really already in the pipe structure, so
3801  * advance the pipe counter and make a new, null command. */
3802  struct pipe *pi = ctx->pipe;
3803  struct command *command = ctx->command;
3804 
3805 #if 0 /* Instead we emit error message at run time */
3806  if (ctx->pending_redirect) {
3807  /* For example, "cmd >" (no filename to redirect to) */
3808  syntax_error("invalid redirect");
3809  ctx->pending_redirect = NULL;
3810  }
3811 #endif
3812 
3813  if (command) {
3814  if (IS_NULL_CMD(command)) {
3815  debug_printf_parse("done_command: skipping null cmd, num_cmds=%d\n", pi->num_cmds);
3816  goto clear_and_ret;
3817  }
3818  pi->num_cmds++;
3819  debug_printf_parse("done_command: ++num_cmds=%d\n", pi->num_cmds);
3820  //debug_print_tree(ctx->list_head, 20);
3821  } else {
3822  debug_printf_parse("done_command: initializing, num_cmds=%d\n", pi->num_cmds);
3823  }
3824 
3825  /* Only real trickiness here is that the uncommitted
3826  * command structure is not counted in pi->num_cmds. */
3827  pi->cmds = xrealloc(pi->cmds, sizeof(*pi->cmds) * (pi->num_cmds+1));
3828  ctx->command = command = &pi->cmds[pi->num_cmds];
3829  clear_and_ret:
3830  memset(command, 0, sizeof(*command));
3831 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
3832  command->lineno = G.parse_lineno;
3833  debug_printf_parse("command->lineno = G.parse_lineno (%u)\n", G.parse_lineno);
3834 #endif
3835  return pi->num_cmds; /* used only for 0/nonzero check */
3836 }
3837 
3838 static void done_pipe(struct parse_context *ctx, pipe_style type)
3839 {
3840  int not_null;
3841 
3842  debug_printf_parse("done_pipe entered, followup %d\n", type);
3843  /* Close previous command */
3844  not_null = done_command(ctx);
3845 #if HAS_KEYWORDS
3846  ctx->pipe->pi_inverted = ctx->ctx_inverted;
3847  ctx->ctx_inverted = 0;
3848  ctx->pipe->res_word = ctx->ctx_res_w;
3849 #endif
3850  if (type == PIPE_BG && ctx->list_head != ctx->pipe) {
3851  /* Necessary since && and || have precedence over &:
3852  * "cmd1 && cmd2 &" must spawn both cmds, not only cmd2,
3853  * in a backgrounded subshell.
3854  */
3855  struct pipe *pi;
3856  struct command *command;
3857 
3858  /* Is this actually this construct, all pipes end with && or ||? */
3859  pi = ctx->list_head;
3860  while (pi != ctx->pipe) {
3861  if (pi->followup != PIPE_AND && pi->followup != PIPE_OR)
3862  goto no_conv;
3863  pi = pi->next;
3864  }
3865 
3866  debug_printf_parse("BG with more than one pipe, converting to { p1 &&...pN; } &\n");
3867  pi->followup = PIPE_SEQ; /* close pN _not_ with "&"! */
3868  pi = xzalloc(sizeof(*pi));
3869  pi->followup = PIPE_BG;
3870  pi->num_cmds = 1;
3871  pi->cmds = xzalloc(sizeof(pi->cmds[0]));
3872  command = &pi->cmds[0];
3873  if (CMD_NORMAL != 0) /* "if xzalloc didn't do that already" */
3874  command->cmd_type = CMD_NORMAL;
3875  command->group = ctx->list_head;
3876 #if !BB_MMU
3877  command->group_as_string = xstrndup(
3878  ctx->as_string.data,
3879  ctx->as_string.length - 1 /* do not copy last char, "&" */
3880  );
3881 #endif
3882  /* Replace all pipes in ctx with one newly created */
3883  ctx->list_head = ctx->pipe = pi;
3884  /* for cases like "cmd && &", do not be tricked by last command
3885  * being null - the entire {...} & is NOT null! */
3886  not_null = 1;
3887  } else {
3888  no_conv:
3889  ctx->pipe->followup = type;
3890  }
3891 
3892  /* Without this check, even just <enter> on command line generates
3893  * tree of three NOPs (!). Which is harmless but annoying.
3894  * IOW: it is safe to do it unconditionally. */
3895  if (not_null
3896 #if ENABLE_HUSH_IF
3897  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_FI
3898 #endif
3899 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
3900  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_DONE
3901  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_FOR
3902  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_IN
3903 #endif
3904 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
3905  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_ESAC
3906 #endif
3907  ) {
3908  struct pipe *new_p;
3909  debug_printf_parse("done_pipe: adding new pipe: "
3910  "not_null:%d ctx->ctx_res_w:%d\n",
3911  not_null, ctx->ctx_res_w);
3912  new_p = new_pipe();
3913  ctx->pipe->next = new_p;
3914  ctx->pipe = new_p;
3915  /* RES_THEN, RES_DO etc are "sticky" -
3916  * they remain set for pipes inside if/while.
3917  * This is used to control execution.
3918  * RES_FOR and RES_IN are NOT sticky (needed to support
3919  * cases where variable or value happens to match a keyword):
3920  */
3921 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
3922  if (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_FOR
3923  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_IN)
3924  ctx->ctx_res_w = RES_NONE;
3925 #endif
3926 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
3927  if (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_MATCH)
3928  ctx->ctx_res_w = RES_CASE_BODY;
3929  if (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_CASE)
3930  ctx->ctx_res_w = RES_CASE_IN;
3931 #endif
3932  ctx->command = NULL; /* trick done_command below */
3933  /* Create the memory for command, roughly:
3934  * ctx->pipe->cmds = new struct command;
3935  * ctx->command = &ctx->pipe->cmds[0];
3936  */
3937  done_command(ctx);
3938  //debug_print_tree(ctx->list_head, 10);
3939  }
3940  debug_printf_parse("done_pipe return\n");
3941 }
3942 
3943 static void initialize_context(struct parse_context *ctx)
3944 {
3945  memset(ctx, 0, sizeof(*ctx));
3946  if (MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT != 0)
3947  ctx->is_assignment = MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT;
3948  ctx->pipe = ctx->list_head = new_pipe();
3949  /* Create the memory for command, roughly:
3950  * ctx->pipe->cmds = new struct command;
3951  * ctx->command = &ctx->pipe->cmds[0];
3952  */
3953  done_command(ctx);
3954 }
3955 
3956 /* If a reserved word is found and processed, parse context is modified
3957  * and 1 is returned.
3958  */
3959 #if HAS_KEYWORDS
3960 struct reserved_combo {
3961  char literal[6];
3962  unsigned char res;
3963  unsigned char assignment_flag;
3964  uint32_t flag;
3965 };
3966 enum {
3967  FLAG_END = (1 << RES_NONE ),
3968 # if ENABLE_HUSH_IF
3969  FLAG_IF = (1 << RES_IF ),
3970  FLAG_THEN = (1 << RES_THEN ),
3971  FLAG_ELIF = (1 << RES_ELIF ),
3972  FLAG_ELSE = (1 << RES_ELSE ),
3973  FLAG_FI = (1 << RES_FI ),
3974 # endif
3975 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
3976  FLAG_FOR = (1 << RES_FOR ),
3977  FLAG_WHILE = (1 << RES_WHILE),
3978  FLAG_UNTIL = (1 << RES_UNTIL),
3979  FLAG_DO = (1 << RES_DO ),
3980  FLAG_DONE = (1 << RES_DONE ),
3981  FLAG_IN = (1 << RES_IN ),
3982 # endif
3983 # if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
3984  FLAG_MATCH = (1 << RES_MATCH),
3985  FLAG_ESAC = (1 << RES_ESAC ),
3986 # endif
3987  FLAG_START = (1 << RES_XXXX ),
3988 };
3989 
3990 static const struct reserved_combo* match_reserved_word(o_string *word)
3991 {
3992  /* Mostly a list of accepted follow-up reserved words.
3993  * FLAG_END means we are done with the sequence, and are ready
3994  * to turn the compound list into a command.
3995  * FLAG_START means the word must start a new compound list.
3996  */
3997  static const struct reserved_combo reserved_list[] ALIGN4 = {
3998 # if ENABLE_HUSH_IF
3999  { "!", RES_NONE, NOT_ASSIGNMENT , 0 },
4000  { "if", RES_IF, MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT, FLAG_THEN | FLAG_START },
4001  { "then", RES_THEN, MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT, FLAG_ELIF | FLAG_ELSE | FLAG_FI },
4002  { "elif", RES_ELIF, MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT, FLAG_THEN },
4003  { "else", RES_ELSE, MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT, FLAG_FI },
4004  { "fi", RES_FI, NOT_ASSIGNMENT , FLAG_END },
4005 # endif
4006 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
4007  { "for", RES_FOR, NOT_ASSIGNMENT , FLAG_IN | FLAG_DO | FLAG_START },
4008  { "while", RES_WHILE, MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT, FLAG_DO | FLAG_START },
4009  { "until", RES_UNTIL, MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT, FLAG_DO | FLAG_START },
4010  { "in", RES_IN, NOT_ASSIGNMENT , FLAG_DO },
4011  { "do", RES_DO, MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT, FLAG_DONE },
4012  { "done", RES_DONE, NOT_ASSIGNMENT , FLAG_END },
4013 # endif
4014 # if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
4015  { "case", RES_CASE, NOT_ASSIGNMENT , FLAG_MATCH | FLAG_START },
4016  { "esac", RES_ESAC, NOT_ASSIGNMENT , FLAG_END },
4017 # endif
4018  };
4019  const struct reserved_combo *r;
4020 
4021  for (r = reserved_list; r < reserved_list + ARRAY_SIZE(reserved_list); r++) {
4022  if (strcmp(word->data, r->literal) == 0)
4023  return r;
4024  }
4025  return NULL;
4026 }
4027 /* Return NULL: not a keyword, else: keyword
4028  */
4029 static const struct reserved_combo* reserved_word(struct parse_context *ctx)
4030 {
4031 # if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
4032  static const struct reserved_combo reserved_match = {
4033  "", RES_MATCH, NOT_ASSIGNMENT , FLAG_MATCH | FLAG_ESAC
4034  };
4035 # endif
4036  const struct reserved_combo *r;
4037 
4038  if (ctx->word.has_quoted_part)
4039  return 0;
4040  r = match_reserved_word(&ctx->word);
4041  if (!r)
4042  return r; /* NULL */
4043 
4044  debug_printf("found reserved word %s, res %d\n", r->literal, r->res);
4045 # if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
4046  if (r->res == RES_IN && ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_CASE_IN) {
4047  /* "case word IN ..." - IN part starts first MATCH part */
4048  r = &reserved_match;
4049  } else
4050 # endif
4051  if (r->flag == 0) { /* '!' */
4052  if (ctx->ctx_inverted) { /* bash doesn't accept '! ! true' */
4053  syntax_error("! ! command");
4054  ctx->ctx_res_w = RES_SNTX;
4055  }
4056  ctx->ctx_inverted = 1;
4057  return r;
4058  }
4059  if (r->flag & FLAG_START) {
4060  struct parse_context *old;
4061 
4062  old = xmemdup(ctx, sizeof(*ctx));
4063  debug_printf_parse("push stack %p\n", old);
4064  initialize_context(ctx);
4065  ctx->stack = old;
4066  } else if (/*ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_NONE ||*/ !(ctx->old_flag & (1 << r->res))) {
4067  syntax_error_at(ctx->word.data);
4068  ctx->ctx_res_w = RES_SNTX;
4069  return r;
4070  } else {
4071  /* "{...} fi" is ok. "{...} if" is not
4072  * Example:
4073  * if { echo foo; } then { echo bar; } fi */
4074  if (ctx->command->group)
4075  done_pipe(ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
4076  }
4077 
4078  ctx->ctx_res_w = r->res;
4079  ctx->old_flag = r->flag;
4080  ctx->is_assignment = r->assignment_flag;
4081  debug_printf_parse("ctx->is_assignment='%s'\n", assignment_flag[ctx->is_assignment]);
4082 
4083  if (ctx->old_flag & FLAG_END) {
4084  struct parse_context *old;
4085 
4086  done_pipe(ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
4087  debug_printf_parse("pop stack %p\n", ctx->stack);
4088  old = ctx->stack;
4089  old->command->group = ctx->list_head;
4090  old->command->cmd_type = CMD_NORMAL;
4091 # if !BB_MMU
4092  /* At this point, the compound command's string is in
4093  * ctx->as_string... except for the leading keyword!
4094  * Consider this example: "echo a | if true; then echo a; fi"
4095  * ctx->as_string will contain "true; then echo a; fi",
4096  * with "if " remaining in old->as_string!
4097  */
4098  {
4099  char *str;
4100  int len = old->as_string.length;
4101  /* Concatenate halves */
4102  o_addstr(&old->as_string, ctx->as_string.data);
4103  o_free(&ctx->as_string);
4104  /* Find where leading keyword starts in first half */
4105  str = old->as_string.data + len;
4106  if (str > old->as_string.data)
4107  str--; /* skip whitespace after keyword */
4108  while (str > old->as_string.data && isalpha(str[-1]))
4109  str--;
4110  /* Ugh, we're done with this horrid hack */
4111  old->command->group_as_string = xstrdup(str);
4112  debug_printf_parse("pop, remembering as:'%s'\n",
4113  old->command->group_as_string);
4114  }
4115 # endif
4116  *ctx = *old; /* physical copy */
4117  free(old);
4118  }
4119  return r;
4120 }
4121 #endif /* HAS_KEYWORDS */
4122 
4123 /* Word is complete, look at it and update parsing context.
4124  * Normal return is 0. Syntax errors return 1.
4125  * Note: on return, word is reset, but not o_free'd!
4126  */
4127 static int done_word(struct parse_context *ctx)
4128 {
4129  struct command *command = ctx->command;
4130 
4131  debug_printf_parse("done_word entered: '%s' %p\n", ctx->word.data, command);
4132  if (ctx->word.length == 0 && !ctx->word.has_quoted_part) {
4133  debug_printf_parse("done_word return 0: true null, ignored\n");
4134  return 0;
4135  }
4136 
4137  if (ctx->pending_redirect) {
4138  /* We do not glob in e.g. >*.tmp case. bash seems to glob here
4139  * only if run as "bash", not "sh" */
4140  /* http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/V3_chap02.html
4141  * "2.7 Redirection
4142  * If the redirection operator is "<<" or "<<-", the word
4143  * that follows the redirection operator shall be
4144  * subjected to quote removal; it is unspecified whether
4145  * any of the other expansions occur. For the other
4146  * redirection operators, the word that follows the
4147  * redirection operator shall be subjected to tilde
4148  * expansion, parameter expansion, command substitution,
4149  * arithmetic expansion, and quote removal.
4150  * Pathname expansion shall not be performed
4151  * on the word by a non-interactive shell; an interactive
4152  * shell may perform it, but shall do so only when
4153  * the expansion would result in one word."
4154  */
4155 //bash does not do parameter/command substitution or arithmetic expansion
4156 //for _heredoc_ redirection word: these constructs look for exact eof marker
4157 // as written:
4158 // <<EOF$t
4159 // <<EOF$((1))
4160 // <<EOF`true` [this case also makes heredoc "quoted", a-la <<"EOF". Probably bash-4.3.43 bug]
4161 
4162  ctx->pending_redirect->rd_filename = xstrdup(ctx->word.data);
4163  /* Cater for >\file case:
4164  * >\a creates file a; >\\a, >"\a", >"\\a" create file \a
4165  * Same with heredocs:
4166  * for <<\H delim is H; <<\\H, <<"\H", <<"\\H" - \H
4167  */
4168  if (ctx->pending_redirect->rd_type == REDIRECT_HEREDOC) {
4169  unbackslash(ctx->pending_redirect->rd_filename);
4170  /* Is it <<"HEREDOC"? */
4171  if (ctx->word.has_quoted_part) {
4172  ctx->pending_redirect->rd_dup |= HEREDOC_QUOTED;
4173  }
4174  }
4175  debug_printf_parse("word stored in rd_filename: '%s'\n", ctx->word.data);
4176  ctx->pending_redirect = NULL;
4177  } else {
4178 #if HAS_KEYWORDS
4179 # if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
4180  if (ctx->ctx_dsemicolon
4181  && strcmp(ctx->word.data, "esac") != 0 /* not "... pattern) cmd;; esac" */
4182  ) {
4183  /* already done when ctx_dsemicolon was set to 1: */
4184  /* ctx->ctx_res_w = RES_MATCH; */
4185  ctx->ctx_dsemicolon = 0;
4186  } else
4187 # endif
4188 # if defined(CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
4189  if (command->cmd_type == CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB
4190  && strcmp(ctx->word.data, "]]") == 0
4191  ) {
4192  /* allow "[[ ]] >file" etc */
4193  command->cmd_type = CMD_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB;
4194  } else
4195 # endif
4196  if (!command->argv /* if it's the first word... */
4197 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
4198  && ctx->ctx_res_w != RES_FOR /* ...not after FOR or IN */
4199  && ctx->ctx_res_w != RES_IN
4200 # endif
4201 # if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
4202  && ctx->ctx_res_w != RES_CASE
4203 # endif
4204  ) {
4205  const struct reserved_combo *reserved;
4206  reserved = reserved_word(ctx);
4207  debug_printf_parse("checking for reserved-ness: %d\n", !!reserved);
4208  if (reserved) {
4209 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
4210 /* Case:
4211  * "while ...; do
4212  * cmd ..."
4213  * If we don't close the pipe _now_, immediately after "do", lineno logic
4214  * sees "cmd" as starting at "do" - i.e., at the previous line.
4215  */
4216  if (0
4217  IF_HUSH_IF(|| reserved->res == RES_THEN)
4218  IF_HUSH_IF(|| reserved->res == RES_ELIF)
4219  IF_HUSH_IF(|| reserved->res == RES_ELSE)
4220  IF_HUSH_LOOPS(|| reserved->res == RES_DO)
4221  ) {
4222  done_pipe(ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
4223  }
4224 # endif
4225  o_reset_to_empty_unquoted(&ctx->word);
4226  debug_printf_parse("done_word return %d\n",
4227  (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_SNTX));
4228  return (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_SNTX);
4229  }
4230 # if defined(CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
4231  if (strcmp(ctx->word.data, "[[") == 0) {
4232  command->cmd_type = CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB;
4233  } else
4234 # endif
4235 # if defined(CMD_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
4236  if (0
4237  /* In bash, local/export/readonly are special, args
4238  * are assignments and therefore expansion of them
4239  * should be "one-word" expansion:
4240  * $ export i=`echo 'a b'` # one arg: "i=a b"
4241  * compare with:
4242  * $ ls i=`echo 'a b'` # two args: "i=a" and "b"
4243  * ls: cannot access i=a: No such file or directory
4244  * ls: cannot access b: No such file or directory
4245  * Note: bash 3.2.33(1) does this only if export word
4246  * itself is not quoted:
4247  * $ export i=`echo 'aaa bbb'`; echo "$i"
4248  * aaa bbb
4249  * $ "export" i=`echo 'aaa bbb'`; echo "$i"
4250  * aaa
4251  */
4252  IF_HUSH_LOCAL( || strcmp(ctx->word.data, "local") == 0)
4253  IF_HUSH_EXPORT( || strcmp(ctx->word.data, "export") == 0)
4254  IF_HUSH_READONLY(|| strcmp(ctx->word.data, "readonly") == 0)
4255  ) {
4256  command->cmd_type = CMD_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB;
4257  }
4258 # else
4259  { /* empty block to pair "if ... else" */ }
4260 # endif
4261  }
4262 #endif /* HAS_KEYWORDS */
4263 
4264  if (command->group) {
4265  /* "{ echo foo; } echo bar" - bad */
4266  syntax_error_at(ctx->word.data);
4267  debug_printf_parse("done_word return 1: syntax error, "
4268  "groups and arglists don't mix\n");
4269  return 1;
4270  }
4271 
4272  /* If this word wasn't an assignment, next ones definitely
4273  * can't be assignments. Even if they look like ones. */
4274  if (ctx->is_assignment != DEFINITELY_ASSIGNMENT
4275  && ctx->is_assignment != WORD_IS_KEYWORD
4276  ) {
4277  ctx->is_assignment = NOT_ASSIGNMENT;
4278  } else {
4279  if (ctx->is_assignment == DEFINITELY_ASSIGNMENT) {
4280  command->assignment_cnt++;
4281  debug_printf_parse("++assignment_cnt=%d\n", command->assignment_cnt);
4282  }
4283  debug_printf_parse("ctx->is_assignment was:'%s'\n", assignment_flag[ctx->is_assignment]);
4284  ctx->is_assignment = MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT;
4285  }
4286  debug_printf_parse("ctx->is_assignment='%s'\n", assignment_flag[ctx->is_assignment]);
4287  command->argv = add_string_to_strings(command->argv, xstrdup(ctx->word.data));
4288  debug_print_strings("word appended to argv", command->argv);
4289  }
4290 
4291 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
4292  if (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_FOR) {
4293  if (ctx->word.has_quoted_part
4294  || endofname(command->argv[0])[0] != '\0'
4295  ) {
4296  /* bash says just "not a valid identifier" */
4297  syntax_error("bad variable name in for");
4298  return 1;
4299  }
4300  /* Force FOR to have just one word (variable name) */
4301  /* NB: basically, this makes hush see "for v in ..."
4302  * syntax as if it is "for v; in ...". FOR and IN become
4303  * two pipe structs in parse tree. */
4304  done_pipe(ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
4305  }
4306 #endif
4307 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
4308  /* Force CASE to have just one word */
4309  if (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_CASE) {
4310  done_pipe(ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
4311  }
4312 #endif
4313 
4314  o_reset_to_empty_unquoted(&ctx->word);
4315 
4316  debug_printf_parse("done_word return 0\n");
4317  return 0;
4318 }
4319 
4320 
4321 /* Peek ahead in the input to find out if we have a "&n" construct,
4322  * as in "2>&1", that represents duplicating a file descriptor.
4323  * Return:
4324  * REDIRFD_CLOSE if >&- "close fd" construct is seen,
4325  * REDIRFD_SYNTAX_ERR if syntax error,
4326  * REDIRFD_TO_FILE if no & was seen,
4327  * or the number found.
4328  */
4329 #if BB_MMU
4330 #define parse_redir_right_fd(as_string, input) \
4331  parse_redir_right_fd(input)
4332 #endif
4333 static int parse_redir_right_fd(o_string *as_string, struct in_str *input)
4334 {
4335  int ch, d, ok;
4336 
4337  ch = i_peek(input);
4338  if (ch != '&')
4339  return REDIRFD_TO_FILE;
4340 
4341  ch = i_getch(input); /* get the & */
4342  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
4343  ch = i_peek(input);
4344  if (ch == '-') {
4345  ch = i_getch(input);
4346  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
4347  return REDIRFD_CLOSE;
4348  }
4349  d = 0;
4350  ok = 0;
4351  while (ch != EOF && isdigit(ch)) {
4352  d = d*10 + (ch-'0');
4353  ok = 1;
4354  ch = i_getch(input);
4355  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
4356  ch = i_peek(input);
4357  }
4358  if (ok) return d;
4359 
4360 //TODO: this is the place to catch ">&file" bashism (redirect both fd 1 and 2)
4361 
4362  bb_simple_error_msg("ambiguous redirect");
4363  return REDIRFD_SYNTAX_ERR;
4364 }
4365 
4366 /* Return code is 0 normal, 1 if a syntax error is detected
4367  */
4368 static int parse_redirect(struct parse_context *ctx,
4369  int fd,
4370  redir_type style,
4371  struct in_str *input)
4372 {
4373  struct command *command = ctx->command;
4374  struct redir_struct *redir;
4375  struct redir_struct **redirp;
4376  int dup_num;
4377 
4378  dup_num = REDIRFD_TO_FILE;
4379  if (style != REDIRECT_HEREDOC) {
4380  /* Check for a '>&1' type redirect */
4381  dup_num = parse_redir_right_fd(&ctx->as_string, input);
4382  if (dup_num == REDIRFD_SYNTAX_ERR)
4383  return 1;
4384  } else {
4385  int ch = i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input);
4386  dup_num = (ch == '-'); /* HEREDOC_SKIPTABS bit is 1 */
4387  if (dup_num) { /* <<-... */
4388  ch = i_getch(input);
4389  nommu_addchr(&ctx->as_string, ch);
4390  ch = i_peek(input);
4391  }
4392  }
4393 
4394  if (style == REDIRECT_OVERWRITE && dup_num == REDIRFD_TO_FILE) {
4395  int ch = i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input);
4396  if (ch == '|') {
4397  /* >|FILE redirect ("clobbering" >).
4398  * Since we do not support "set -o noclobber" yet,
4399  * >| and > are the same for now. Just eat |.
4400  */
4401  ch = i_getch(input);
4402  nommu_addchr(&ctx->as_string, ch);
4403  }
4404  }
4405 
4406  /* Create a new redir_struct and append it to the linked list */
4407  redirp = &command->redirects;
4408  while ((redir = *redirp) != NULL) {
4409  redirp = &(redir->next);
4410  }
4411  *redirp = redir = xzalloc(sizeof(*redir));
4412  /* redir->next = NULL; */
4413  /* redir->rd_filename = NULL; */
4414  redir->rd_type = style;
4415  redir->rd_fd = (fd == -1) ? redir_table[style].default_fd : fd;
4416 
4417  debug_printf_parse("redirect type %d %s\n", redir->rd_fd,
4418  redir_table[style].descrip);
4419 
4420  redir->rd_dup = dup_num;
4421  if (style != REDIRECT_HEREDOC && dup_num != REDIRFD_TO_FILE) {
4422  /* Erik had a check here that the file descriptor in question
4423  * is legit; I postpone that to "run time"
4424  * A "-" representation of "close me" shows up as a -3 here */
4425  debug_printf_parse("duplicating redirect '%d>&%d'\n",
4426  redir->rd_fd, redir->rd_dup);
4427  } else {
4428 #if 0 /* Instead we emit error message at run time */
4429  if (ctx->pending_redirect) {
4430  /* For example, "cmd > <file" */
4431  syntax_error("invalid redirect");
4432  }
4433 #endif
4434  /* Set ctx->pending_redirect, so we know what to do at the
4435  * end of the next parsed word. */
4436  ctx->pending_redirect = redir;
4437  }
4438  return 0;
4439 }
4440 
4441 /* If a redirect is immediately preceded by a number, that number is
4442  * supposed to tell which file descriptor to redirect. This routine
4443  * looks for such preceding numbers. In an ideal world this routine
4444  * needs to handle all the following classes of redirects...
4445  * echo 2>foo # redirects fd 2 to file "foo", nothing passed to echo
4446  * echo 49>foo # redirects fd 49 to file "foo", nothing passed to echo
4447  * echo -2>foo # redirects fd 1 to file "foo", "-2" passed to echo
4448  * echo 49x>foo # redirects fd 1 to file "foo", "49x" passed to echo
4449  *
4450  * http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/009695399/utilities/xcu_chap02.html
4451  * "2.7 Redirection
4452  * ... If n is quoted, the number shall not be recognized as part of
4453  * the redirection expression. For example:
4454  * echo \2>a
4455  * writes the character 2 into file a"
4456  * We are getting it right by setting ->has_quoted_part on any <char>
4457  *
4458  * A -1 return means no valid number was found,
4459  * the caller should use the appropriate default for this redirection.
4460  */
4461 static int redirect_opt_num(o_string *o)
4462 {
4463  int num;
4464 
4465  if (o->data == NULL)
4466  return -1;
4467  num = bb_strtou(o->data, NULL, 10);
4468  if (errno || num < 0)
4469  return -1;
4470  o_reset_to_empty_unquoted(o);
4471  return num;
4472 }
4473 
4474 #if BB_MMU
4475 #define fetch_till_str(as_string, input, word, skip_tabs) \
4476  fetch_till_str(input, word, skip_tabs)
4477 #endif
4478 static char *fetch_till_str(o_string *as_string,
4479  struct in_str *input,
4480  const char *word,
4481  int heredoc_flags)
4482 {
4483  o_string heredoc = NULL_O_STRING;
4484  unsigned past_EOL;
4485  int prev = 0; /* not \ */
4486  int ch;
4487 
4488  /* Starting with "" is necessary for this case:
4489  * cat <<EOF
4490  *
4491  * xxx
4492  * EOF
4493  */
4494  heredoc.data = xzalloc(1); /* start as "", not as NULL */
4495 
4496  goto jump_in;
4497 
4498  while (1) {
4499  ch = i_getch(input);
4500  if (ch != EOF)
4501  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
4502  if (ch == '\n' || ch == EOF) {
4503  check_heredoc_end:
4504  if ((heredoc_flags & HEREDOC_QUOTED) || prev != '\\') {
4505  /* End-of-line, and not a line continuation */
4506  if (strcmp(heredoc.data + past_EOL, word) == 0) {
4507  heredoc.data[past_EOL] = '\0';
4508  debug_printf_heredoc("parsed '%s' heredoc '%s'\n", word, heredoc.data);
4509  return heredoc.data;
4510  }
4511  if (ch == '\n') {
4512  /* This is a new line.
4513  * Remember position and backslash-escaping status.
4514  */
4515  o_addchr(&heredoc, ch);
4516  prev = ch;
4517  jump_in:
4518  past_EOL = heredoc.length;
4519  /* Get 1st char of next line, possibly skipping leading tabs */
4520  do {
4521  ch = i_getch(input);
4522  if (ch != EOF)
4523  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
4524  } while ((heredoc_flags & HEREDOC_SKIPTABS) && ch == '\t');
4525  /* If this immediately ended the line,
4526  * go back to end-of-line checks.
4527  */
4528  if (ch == '\n')
4529  goto check_heredoc_end;
4530  }
4531  } else {
4532  /* Backslash-line continuation in an unquoted
4533  * heredoc. This does not need special handling
4534  * for heredoc body (unquoted heredocs are
4535  * expanded on "execution" and that would take
4536  * care of this case too), but not the case
4537  * of line continuation *in terminator*:
4538  * cat <<EOF
4539  * Ok1
4540  * EO\
4541  * F
4542  */
4543  heredoc.data[--heredoc.length] = '\0';
4544  prev = 0; /* not '\' */
4545  continue;
4546  }
4547  }
4548  if (ch == EOF) {
4549  o_free(&heredoc);
4550  return NULL; /* error */
4551  }
4552  o_addchr(&heredoc, ch);
4553  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
4554  if (prev == '\\' && ch == '\\')
4555  /* Correctly handle foo\<eol> (not a line cont.) */
4556  prev = 0; /* not '\' */
4557  else
4558  prev = ch;
4559  }
4560 }
4561 
4562 /* Look at entire parse tree for not-yet-loaded REDIRECT_HEREDOCs
4563  * and load them all. There should be exactly heredoc_cnt of them.
4564  */
4565 #if BB_MMU
4566 #define fetch_heredocs(as_string, pi, heredoc_cnt, input) \
4567  fetch_heredocs(pi, heredoc_cnt, input)
4568 #endif
4569 static int fetch_heredocs(o_string *as_string, struct pipe *pi, int heredoc_cnt, struct in_str *input)
4570 {
4571  while (pi && heredoc_cnt) {
4572  int i;
4573  struct command *cmd = pi->cmds;
4574 
4575  debug_printf_heredoc("fetch_heredocs: num_cmds:%d cmd argv0:'%s'\n",
4576  pi->num_cmds,
4577  cmd->argv ? cmd->argv[0] : "NONE"
4578  );
4579  for (i = 0; i < pi->num_cmds; i++) {
4580  struct redir_struct *redir = cmd->redirects;
4581 
4582  debug_printf_heredoc("fetch_heredocs: %d cmd argv0:'%s'\n",
4583  i, cmd->argv ? cmd->argv[0] : "NONE");
4584  while (redir) {
4585  if (redir->rd_type == REDIRECT_HEREDOC) {
4586  char *p;
4587 
4588  redir->rd_type = REDIRECT_HEREDOC2;
4589  /* redir->rd_dup is (ab)used to indicate <<- */
4590  p = fetch_till_str(as_string, input,
4591  redir->rd_filename, redir->rd_dup);
4592  if (!p) {
4593  syntax_error("unexpected EOF in here document");
4594  return -1;
4595  }
4596  free(redir->rd_filename);
4597  redir->rd_filename = p;
4598  heredoc_cnt--;
4599  }
4600  redir = redir->next;
4601  }
4602  if (cmd->group) {
4603  //bb_error_msg("%s:%u heredoc_cnt:%d", __func__, __LINE__, heredoc_cnt);
4604  heredoc_cnt = fetch_heredocs(as_string, cmd->group, heredoc_cnt, input);
4605  //bb_error_msg("%s:%u heredoc_cnt:%d", __func__, __LINE__, heredoc_cnt);
4606  if (heredoc_cnt < 0)
4607  return heredoc_cnt; /* error */
4608  }
4609  cmd++;
4610  }
4611  pi = pi->next;
4612  }
4613  return heredoc_cnt;
4614 }
4615 
4616 
4617 static int run_list(struct pipe *pi);
4618 #if BB_MMU
4619 #define parse_stream(pstring, heredoc_cnt_ptr, input, end_trigger) \
4620  parse_stream(heredoc_cnt_ptr, input, end_trigger)
4621 #endif
4622 static struct pipe *parse_stream(char **pstring,
4623  int *heredoc_cnt_ptr,
4624  struct in_str *input,
4625  int end_trigger);
4626 
4627 /* Returns number of heredocs not yet consumed,
4628  * or -1 on error.
4629  */
4630 static int parse_group(struct parse_context *ctx,
4631  struct in_str *input, int ch)
4632 {
4633  /* ctx->word contains characters seen prior to ( or {.
4634  * Typically it's empty, but for function defs,
4635  * it contains function name (without '()'). */
4636 #if BB_MMU
4637 # define as_string NULL
4638 #else
4639  char *as_string = NULL;
4640 #endif
4641  struct pipe *pipe_list;
4642  int heredoc_cnt = 0;
4643  int endch;
4644  struct command *command = ctx->command;
4645 
4646  debug_printf_parse("parse_group entered\n");
4647 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
4648  if (ch == '(' && !ctx->word.has_quoted_part) {
4649  if (ctx->word.length)
4650  if (done_word(ctx))
4651  return -1;
4652  if (!command->argv)
4653  goto skip; /* (... */
4654  if (command->argv[1]) { /* word word ... (... */
4655  syntax_error_unexpected_ch('(');
4656  return -1;
4657  }
4658  /* it is "word(..." or "word (..." */
4659  do
4660  ch = i_getch(input);
4661  while (ch == ' ' || ch == '\t');
4662  if (ch != ')') {
4663  syntax_error_unexpected_ch(ch);
4664  return -1;
4665  }
4666  nommu_addchr(&ctx->as_string, ch);
4667  do
4668  ch = i_getch(input);
4669  while (ch == ' ' || ch == '\t' || ch == '\n');
4670  if (ch != '{' && ch != '(') {
4671  syntax_error_unexpected_ch(ch);
4672  return -1;
4673  }
4674  nommu_addchr(&ctx->as_string, ch);
4675  command->cmd_type = CMD_FUNCDEF;
4676  goto skip;
4677  }
4678 #endif
4679 
4680 #if 0 /* Prevented by caller */
4681  if (command->argv /* word [word]{... */
4682  || ctx->word.length /* word{... */
4683  || ctx->word.has_quoted_part /* ""{... */
4684  ) {
4685  syntax_error(NULL);
4686  debug_printf_parse("parse_group return -1: "
4687  "syntax error, groups and arglists don't mix\n");
4688  return -1;
4689  }
4690 #endif
4691 
4692  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(skip:)
4693 
4694  endch = '}';
4695  if (ch == '(') {
4696  endch = ')';
4697  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(if (command->cmd_type != CMD_FUNCDEF))
4698  command->cmd_type = CMD_SUBSHELL;
4699  } else {
4700  /* bash does not allow "{echo...", requires whitespace */
4701  ch = i_peek(input);
4702  if (ch != ' ' && ch != '\t' && ch != '\n'
4703  && ch != '(' /* but "{(..." is allowed (without whitespace) */
4704  ) {
4705  syntax_error_unexpected_ch(ch);
4706  return -1;
4707  }
4708  if (ch != '(') {
4709  ch = i_getch(input);
4710  nommu_addchr(&ctx->as_string, ch);
4711  }
4712  }
4713 
4714  debug_printf_heredoc("calling parse_stream, heredoc_cnt:%d\n", heredoc_cnt);
4715  pipe_list = parse_stream(&as_string, &heredoc_cnt, input, endch);
4716  debug_printf_heredoc("parse_stream returned: heredoc_cnt:%d\n", heredoc_cnt);
4717 #if !BB_MMU
4718  if (as_string)
4719  o_addstr(&ctx->as_string, as_string);
4720 #endif
4721 
4722  /* empty ()/{} or parse error? */
4723  if (!pipe_list || pipe_list == ERR_PTR) {
4724  /* parse_stream already emitted error msg */
4725  if (!BB_MMU)
4726  free(as_string);
4727  debug_printf_parse("parse_group return -1: "
4728  "parse_stream returned %p\n", pipe_list);
4729  return -1;
4730  }
4731 #if !BB_MMU
4732  as_string[strlen(as_string) - 1] = '\0'; /* plink ')' or '}' */
4733  command->group_as_string = as_string;
4734  debug_printf_parse("end of group, remembering as:'%s'\n",
4735  command->group_as_string);
4736 #endif
4737 
4738 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
4739  /* Convert "f() (cmds)" to "f() {(cmds)}" */
4740  if (command->cmd_type == CMD_FUNCDEF && endch == ')') {
4741  struct command *cmd2;
4742 
4743  cmd2 = xzalloc(sizeof(*cmd2));
4744  cmd2->cmd_type = CMD_SUBSHELL;
4745  cmd2->group = pipe_list;
4746 # if !BB_MMU
4747 //UNTESTED!
4748  cmd2->group_as_string = command->group_as_string;
4749  command->group_as_string = xasprintf("(%s)", command->group_as_string);
4750 # endif
4751 
4752  pipe_list = new_pipe();
4753  pipe_list->cmds = cmd2;
4754  pipe_list->num_cmds = 1;
4755  }
4756 #endif
4757 
4758  command->group = pipe_list;
4759 
4760  debug_printf_parse("parse_group return %d\n", heredoc_cnt);
4761  return heredoc_cnt;
4762  /* command remains "open", available for possible redirects */
4763 #undef as_string
4764 }
4765 
4766 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TICK || ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_MATH || ENABLE_HUSH_DOLLAR_OPS
4767 /* Subroutines for copying $(...) and `...` things */
4768 /* '...' */
4769 static int add_till_single_quote(o_string *dest, struct in_str *input)
4770 {
4771  while (1) {
4772  int ch = i_getch(input);
4773  if (ch == EOF) {
4774  syntax_error_unterm_ch('\'');
4775  return 0;
4776  }
4777  if (ch == '\'')
4778  return 1;
4779  o_addchr(dest, ch);
4780  }
4781 }
4782 static int add_till_single_quote_dquoted(o_string *dest, struct in_str *input)
4783 {
4784  while (1) {
4785  int ch = i_getch(input);
4786  if (ch == EOF) {
4787  syntax_error_unterm_ch('\'');
4788  return 0;
4789  }
4790  if (ch == '\'')
4791  return 1;
4792  o_addqchr(dest, ch);
4793  }
4794 }
4795 /* "...\"...`..`...." - do we need to handle "...$(..)..." too? */
4796 static int add_till_backquote(o_string *dest, struct in_str *input, int in_dquote);
4797 static int add_till_double_quote(o_string *dest, struct in_str *input)
4798 {
4799  while (1) {
4800  int ch = i_getch(input);
4801  if (ch == EOF) {
4802  syntax_error_unterm_ch('"');
4803  return 0;
4804  }
4805  if (ch == '"')
4806  return 1;
4807  if (ch == '\\') { /* \x. Copy both chars. */
4808  o_addchr(dest, ch);
4809  ch = i_getch(input);
4810  }
4811  o_addchr(dest, ch);
4812  if (ch == '`') {
4813  if (!add_till_backquote(dest, input, /*in_dquote:*/ 1))
4814  return 0;
4815  o_addchr(dest, ch);
4816  continue;
4817  }
4818  //if (ch == '$') ...
4819  }
4820 }
4821 /* Process `cmd` - copy contents until "`" is seen. Complicated by
4822  * \` quoting.
4823  * "Within the backquoted style of command substitution, backslash
4824  * shall retain its literal meaning, except when followed by: '$', '`', or '\'.
4825  * The search for the matching backquote shall be satisfied by the first
4826  * backquote found without a preceding backslash; during this search,
4827  * if a non-escaped backquote is encountered within a shell comment,
4828  * a here-document, an embedded command substitution of the $(command)
4829  * form, or a quoted string, undefined results occur. A single-quoted
4830  * or double-quoted string that begins, but does not end, within the
4831  * "`...`" sequence produces undefined results."
4832  * Example Output
4833  * echo `echo '\'TEST\`echo ZZ\`BEST` \TESTZZBEST
4834  */
4835 static int add_till_backquote(o_string *dest, struct in_str *input, int in_dquote)
4836 {
4837  while (1) {
4838  int ch = i_getch(input);
4839  if (ch == '`')
4840  return 1;
4841  if (ch == '\\') {
4842  /* \x. Copy both unless it is \`, \$, \\ and maybe \" */
4843  ch = i_getch(input);
4844  if (ch != '`'
4845  && ch != '$'
4846  && ch != '\\'
4847  && (!in_dquote || ch != '"')
4848  ) {
4849  o_addchr(dest, '\\');
4850  }
4851  }
4852  if (ch == EOF) {
4853  syntax_error_unterm_ch('`');
4854  return 0;
4855  }
4856  o_addchr(dest, ch);
4857  }
4858 }
4859 /* Process $(cmd) - copy contents until ")" is seen. Complicated by
4860  * quoting and nested ()s.
4861  * "With the $(command) style of command substitution, all characters
4862  * following the open parenthesis to the matching closing parenthesis
4863  * constitute the command. Any valid shell script can be used for command,
4864  * except a script consisting solely of redirections which produces
4865  * unspecified results."
4866  * Example Output
4867  * echo $(echo '(TEST)' BEST) (TEST) BEST
4868  * echo $(echo 'TEST)' BEST) TEST) BEST
4869  * echo $(echo \‍(\‍(TEST\‍) BEST) ((TEST) BEST
4870  *
4871  * Also adapted to eat ${var%...} and $((...)) constructs, since ... part
4872  * can contain arbitrary constructs, just like $(cmd).
4873  * In bash compat mode, it needs to also be able to stop on ':' or '/'
4874  * for ${var:N[:M]} and ${var/P[/R]} parsing.
4875  */
4876 #define DOUBLE_CLOSE_CHAR_FLAG 0x80
4877 static int add_till_closing_bracket(o_string *dest, struct in_str *input, unsigned end_ch)
4878 {
4879  int ch;
4880  char dbl = end_ch & DOUBLE_CLOSE_CHAR_FLAG;
4881 # if BASH_SUBSTR || BASH_PATTERN_SUBST
4882  char end_char2 = end_ch >> 8;
4883 # endif
4884  end_ch &= (DOUBLE_CLOSE_CHAR_FLAG - 1);
4885 
4886 # if ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
4887  G.promptmode = 1; /* PS2 */
4888 # endif
4889  debug_printf_prompt("%s promptmode=%d\n", __func__, G.promptmode);
4890 
4891  while (1) {
4892  ch = i_getch(input);
4893  if (ch == EOF) {
4894  syntax_error_unterm_ch(end_ch);
4895  return 0;
4896  }
4897  if (ch == end_ch
4898 # if BASH_SUBSTR || BASH_PATTERN_SUBST
4899  || ch == end_char2
4900 # endif
4901  ) {
4902  if (!dbl)
4903  break;
4904  /* we look for closing )) of $((EXPR)) */
4905  if (i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input) == end_ch) {
4906  i_getch(input); /* eat second ')' */
4907  break;
4908  }
4909  }
4910  o_addchr(dest, ch);
4911  //bb_error_msg("%s:o_addchr('%c')", __func__, ch);
4912  if (ch == '(' || ch == '{') {
4913  ch = (ch == '(' ? ')' : '}');
4914  if (!add_till_closing_bracket(dest, input, ch))
4915  return 0;
4916  o_addchr(dest, ch);
4917  continue;
4918  }
4919  if (ch == '\'') {
4920  if (!add_till_single_quote(dest, input))
4921  return 0;
4922  o_addchr(dest, ch);
4923  continue;
4924  }
4925  if (ch == '"') {
4926  if (!add_till_double_quote(dest, input))
4927  return 0;
4928  o_addchr(dest, ch);
4929  continue;
4930  }
4931  if (ch == '`') {
4932  if (!add_till_backquote(dest, input, /*in_dquote:*/ 0))
4933  return 0;
4934  o_addchr(dest, ch);
4935  continue;
4936  }
4937  if (ch == '\\') {
4938  /* \x. Copy verbatim. Important for \‍(, \‍) */
4939  ch = i_getch(input);
4940  if (ch == EOF) {
4941  syntax_error_unterm_ch(end_ch);
4942  return 0;
4943  }
4944 # if 0
4945  if (ch == '\n') {
4946  /* "backslash+newline", ignore both */
4947  o_delchr(dest); /* undo insertion of '\' */
4948  continue;
4949  }
4950 # endif
4951  o_addchr(dest, ch);
4952  //bb_error_msg("%s:o_addchr('%c') after '\\'", __func__, ch);
4953  continue;
4954  }
4955  }
4956  debug_printf_parse("%s return '%s' ch:'%c'\n", __func__, dest->data, ch);
4957  return ch;
4958 }
4959 #endif /* ENABLE_HUSH_TICK || ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_MATH || ENABLE_HUSH_DOLLAR_OPS */
4960 
4961 #if BASH_DOLLAR_SQUOTE
4962 /* Return code: 1 for "found and parsed", 0 for "seen something else" */
4963 # if BB_MMU
4964 #define parse_dollar_squote(as_string, dest, input) \
4965  parse_dollar_squote(dest, input)
4966 #define as_string NULL
4967 # endif
4968 static int parse_dollar_squote(o_string *as_string, o_string *dest, struct in_str *input)
4969 {
4970  int start;
4971  int ch = i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input); /* first character after the $ */
4972  debug_printf_parse("parse_dollar_squote entered: ch='%c'\n", ch);
4973  if (ch != '\'')
4974  return 0;
4975 
4976  dest->has_quoted_part = 1;
4977  start = dest->length;
4978 
4979  ch = i_getch(input); /* eat ' */
4980  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
4981  while (1) {
4982  ch = i_getch(input);
4983  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
4984  if (ch == EOF) {
4985  syntax_error_unterm_ch('\'');
4986  return 0;
4987  }
4988  if (ch == '\'')
4989  break;
4990  if (ch == SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL) {
4991  /* Convert raw ^C to corresponding special variable reference */
4992  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
4993  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_QUOTED_SVS);
4994  /* will addchr() another SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL (see after the if() block) */
4995  } else if (ch == '\\') {
4996  static const char C_escapes[] ALIGN1 = "nrbtfav""x\\01234567";
4997 
4998  ch = i_getch(input);
4999  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5000  if (strchr(C_escapes, ch)) {
5001  char buf[4];
5002  char *p = buf;
5003  int cnt = 2;
5004 
5005  buf[0] = ch;
5006  if ((unsigned char)(ch - '0') <= 7) { /* \ooo */
5007  do {
5008  ch = i_peek(input);
5009  if ((unsigned char)(ch - '0') > 7)
5010  break;
5011  *++p = ch = i_getch(input);
5012  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5013  } while (--cnt != 0);
5014  } else if (ch == 'x') { /* \xHH */
5015  do {
5016  ch = i_peek(input);
5017  if (!isxdigit(ch))
5018  break;
5019  *++p = ch = i_getch(input);
5020  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5021  } while (--cnt != 0);
5022  if (cnt == 2) { /* \x but next char is "bad" */
5023  ch = 'x';
5024  goto unrecognized;
5025  }
5026  } /* else simple seq like \\ or \t */
5027  *++p = '\0';
5028  p = buf;
5029  ch = bb_process_escape_sequence((void*)&p);
5030  //bb_error_msg("buf:'%s' ch:%x", buf, ch);
5031  if (ch == '\0')
5032  continue; /* bash compat: $'...\0...' emits nothing */
5033  } else { /* unrecognized "\z": encode both chars unless ' or " */
5034  if (ch != '\'' && ch != '"') {
5035  unrecognized:
5036  o_addqchr(dest, '\\');
5037  }
5038  }
5039  } /* if (\...) */
5040  o_addqchr(dest, ch);
5041  }
5042 
5043  if (dest->length == start) {
