7503  *pp++ = (char *) "";
7504  }
7505  *pp++ = g_argv0;
7506  while (*g_argv)
7507  *pp++ = *g_argv++;
7508  /* *pp = NULL; - is already there */
7509  pp = environ;
7510 
7511  do_exec:
7512  debug_printf_exec("re_execute_shell pid:%d cmd:'%s'\n", getpid(), s);
7513  /* Don't propagate SIG_IGN to the child */
7514  if (SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS != 0)
7515  switch_off_special_sigs(G.special_sig_mask & SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS);
7516  execve(bb_busybox_exec_path, argv, pp);
7517  /* Fallback. Useful for init=/bin/hush usage etc */
7518  if (argv[0][0] == '/')
7519  execve(argv[0], argv, pp);
7520  xfunc_error_retval = 127;
7521  bb_simple_error_msg_and_die("can't re-execute the shell");
7522 }
7523 #endif /* !BB_MMU */
7524 
7525 
7526 static int run_and_free_list(struct pipe *pi);
7527 
7528 /* Executing from string: eval, sh -c '...'
7529  * or from file: /etc/profile, . file, sh <script>, sh (intereactive)
7530  * end_trigger controls how often we stop parsing
7531  * NUL: parse all, execute, return
7532  * ';': parse till ';' or newline, execute, repeat till EOF
7533  */
7534 static void parse_and_run_stream(struct in_str *inp, int end_trigger)
7535 {
7536  /* Why we need empty flag?
7537  * An obscure corner case "false; ``; echo $?":
7538  * empty command in `` should still set $? to 0.
7539  * But we can't just set $? to 0 at the start,
7540  * this breaks "false; echo `echo $?`" case.
7541  */
7542  bool empty = 1;
7543  while (1) {
7544  struct pipe *pipe_list;
7545 
7546 #if ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
7547  if (end_trigger == ';') {
7548  G.promptmode = 0; /* PS1 */
7549  debug_printf_prompt("%s promptmode=%d\n", __func__, G.promptmode);
7550  }
7551 #endif
7552  pipe_list = parse_stream(NULL, NULL, inp, end_trigger);
7553  if (!pipe_list || pipe_list == ERR_PTR) { /* EOF/error */
7554  /* If we are in "big" script
7555  * (not in `cmd` or something similar)...
7556  */
7557  if (pipe_list == ERR_PTR && end_trigger == ';') {
7558  /* Discard cached input (rest of line) */
7559  int ch = inp->last_char;
7560  while (ch != EOF && ch != '\n') {
7561  //bb_error_msg("Discarded:'%c'", ch);
7562  ch = i_getch(inp);
7563  }
7564  /* Force prompt */
7565  inp->p = NULL;
7566  /* This stream isn't empty */
7567  empty = 0;
7568  continue;
7569  }
7570  if (!pipe_list && empty)
7571  G.last_exitcode = 0;
7572  break;
7573  }
7574  debug_print_tree(pipe_list, 0);
7575  debug_printf_exec("parse_and_run_stream: run_and_free_list\n");
7576  run_and_free_list(pipe_list);
7577  empty = 0;
7578  if (G_flag_return_in_progress == 1)
7579  break;
7580  }
7581 }
7582 
7583 static void parse_and_run_string(const char *s)
7584 {
7585  struct in_str input;
7586  IF_HUSH_LINENO_VAR(unsigned sv = G.parse_lineno;)
7587 
7588  setup_string_in_str(&input, s);
7589  parse_and_run_stream(&input, '\0');
7590  IF_HUSH_LINENO_VAR(G.parse_lineno = sv;)
7591 }
7592 
7593 static void parse_and_run_file(HFILE *fp)
7594 {
7595  struct in_str input;
7596  IF_HUSH_LINENO_VAR(unsigned sv = G.parse_lineno;)
7597 
7598  IF_HUSH_LINENO_VAR(G.parse_lineno = 1;)
7599  setup_file_in_str(&input, fp);
7600  parse_and_run_stream(&input, ';');
7601  IF_HUSH_LINENO_VAR(G.parse_lineno = sv;)
7602 }
7603 
7604 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TICK
7605 static int generate_stream_from_string(const char *s, pid_t *pid_p)
7606 {
7607  pid_t pid;
7608  int channel[2];
7609 # if !BB_MMU
7610  char **to_free = NULL;
7611 # endif
7612 
7613  xpipe(channel);
7614  pid = BB_MMU ? xfork() : xvfork();
7615  if (pid == 0) { /* child */
7616  disable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
7617  /* Process substitution is not considered to be usual
7618  * 'command execution'.
7619  * SUSv3 says ctrl-Z should be ignored, ctrl-C should not.
7620  */
7621  bb_signals(0
7622  + (1 << SIGTSTP)
7623  + (1 << SIGTTIN)
7624  + (1 << SIGTTOU)
7625  , SIG_IGN);
7626  close(channel[0]); /* NB: close _first_, then move fd! */
7627  xmove_fd(channel[1], 1);
7628 # if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
7629  /* Awful hack for `trap` or $(trap).
7630  *
7631  * http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/009695399/utilities/trap.html
7632  * contains an example where "trap" is executed in a subshell:
7633  *
7634  * save_traps=$(trap)
7635  * ...
7636  * eval "$save_traps"
7637  *
7638  * Standard does not say that "trap" in subshell shall print
7639  * parent shell's traps. It only says that its output
7640  * must have suitable form, but then, in the above example
7641  * (which is not supposed to be normative), it implies that.
7642  *
7643  * bash (and probably other shell) does implement it
7644  * (traps are reset to defaults, but "trap" still shows them),
7645  * but as a result, "trap" logic is hopelessly messed up:
7646  *
7647  * # trap
7648  * trap -- 'echo Ho' SIGWINCH <--- we have a handler
7649  * # (trap) <--- trap is in subshell - no output (correct, traps are reset)
7650  * # true | trap <--- trap is in subshell - no output (ditto)
7651  * # echo `true | trap` <--- in subshell - output (but traps are reset!)
7652  * trap -- 'echo Ho' SIGWINCH
7653  * # echo `(trap)` <--- in subshell in subshell - output
7654  * trap -- 'echo Ho' SIGWINCH
7655  * # echo `true | (trap)` <--- in subshell in subshell in subshell - output!
7656  * trap -- 'echo Ho' SIGWINCH
7657  *
7658  * The rules when to forget and when to not forget traps
7659  * get really complex and nonsensical.
7660  *
7661  * Our solution: ONLY bare $(trap) or `trap` is special.
7662  */
7663  s = skip_whitespace(s);
7664  if (is_prefixed_with(s, "trap")
7665  && skip_whitespace(s + 4)[0] == '\0'
7666  ) {
7667  static const char *const argv[] ALIGN_PTR = { NULL, NULL };
7668  builtin_trap((char**)argv);
7669  fflush_all(); /* important */
7670  _exit(0);
7671  }
7672 # endif
7673 # if BB_MMU
7674  /* Prevent it from trying to handle ctrl-z etc */
7675  IF_HUSH_JOB(G.run_list_level = 1;)
7676  CLEAR_RANDOM_T(&G.random_gen); /* or else $RANDOM repeats in child */
7677  reset_traps_to_defaults();
7678  IF_HUSH_MODE_X(G.x_mode_depth++;)
7679  //bb_error_msg("%s: ++x_mode_depth=%d", __func__, G.x_mode_depth);
7680  parse_and_run_string(s);
7681  _exit(G.last_exitcode);
7682 # else
7683  /* We re-execute after vfork on NOMMU. This makes this script safe:
7684  * yes "0123456789012345678901234567890" | dd bs=32 count=64k >BIG
7685  * huge=`cat BIG` # was blocking here forever
7686  * echo OK
7687  */
7688  re_execute_shell(&to_free,
7689  s,
7690  G.global_argv[0],
7691  G.global_argv + 1,
7692  NULL);
7693 # endif
7694  }
7695 
7696  /* parent */
7697  *pid_p = pid;
7698 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
7699  G.count_SIGCHLD++;
7700 //bb_error_msg("[%d] fork in generate_stream_from_string:"
7701 // " G.count_SIGCHLD:%d G.handled_SIGCHLD:%d",
7702 // getpid(), G.count_SIGCHLD, G.handled_SIGCHLD);
7703 # endif
7704  enable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
7705 # if !BB_MMU
7706  free(to_free);
7707 # endif
7708  close(channel[1]);
7709  return channel[0];
7710 }
7711 
7712 /* Return code is exit status of the process that is run. */
7713 static int process_command_subs(o_string *dest, const char *s)
7714 {
7715  FILE *fp;
7716  pid_t pid;
7717  int status, ch, eol_cnt;
7718 
7719  fp = xfdopen_for_read(generate_stream_from_string(s, &pid));
7720 
7721  /* Now send results of command back into original context */
7722  eol_cnt = 0;
7723  while ((ch = getc(fp)) != EOF) {
7724  if (ch == '\0')
7725  continue;
7726  if (ch == '\n') {
7727  eol_cnt++;
7728  continue;
7729  }
7730  while (eol_cnt) {
7731  o_addchr(dest, '\n');
7732  eol_cnt--;
7733  }
7734  o_addQchr(dest, ch);
7735  }
7736 
7737  debug_printf("done reading from `cmd` pipe, closing it\n");
7738  fclose(fp);
7739  /* We need to extract exitcode. Test case
7740  * "true; echo `sleep 1; false` $?"
7741  * should print 1 */
7742  safe_waitpid(pid, &status, 0);
7743  debug_printf("child exited. returning its exitcode:%d\n", WEXITSTATUS(status));
7744  return WEXITSTATUS(status);
7745 }
7746 #endif /* ENABLE_HUSH_TICK */
7747 
7748 
7749 static void setup_heredoc(struct redir_struct *redir)
7750 {
7751  struct fd_pair pair;
7752  pid_t pid;
7753  int len, written;
7754  /* the _body_ of heredoc (misleading field name) */
7755  const char *heredoc = redir->rd_filename;
7756  char *expanded;
7757 #if !BB_MMU
7758  char **to_free;
7759 #endif
7760 
7761  expanded = NULL;
7762  if (!(redir->rd_dup & HEREDOC_QUOTED)) {
7763  expanded = encode_then_expand_string(heredoc);
7764  if (expanded)
7765  heredoc = expanded;
7766  }
7767  len = strlen(heredoc);
7768 
7769  close(redir->rd_fd); /* often saves dup2+close in xmove_fd */
7770  xpiped_pair(pair);
7771  xmove_fd(pair.rd, redir->rd_fd);
7772 
7773  /* Try writing without forking. Newer kernels have
7774  * dynamically growing pipes. Must use non-blocking write! */
7775  ndelay_on(pair.wr);
7776  while (1) {
7777  written = write(pair.wr, heredoc, len);
7778  if (written <= 0)
7779  break;
7780  len -= written;
7781  if (len == 0) {
7782  close(pair.wr);
7783  free(expanded);
7784  return;
7785  }
7786  heredoc += written;
7787  }
7788  ndelay_off(pair.wr);
7789 
7790  /* Okay, pipe buffer was not big enough */
7791  /* Note: we must not create a stray child (bastard? :)
7792  * for the unsuspecting parent process. Child creates a grandchild
7793  * and exits before parent execs the process which consumes heredoc
7794  * (that exec happens after we return from this function) */
7795 #if !BB_MMU
7796  to_free = NULL;
7797 #endif
7798  pid = xvfork();
7799  if (pid == 0) {
7800  /* child */
7801  disable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
7802  pid = BB_MMU ? xfork() : xvfork();
7803  if (pid != 0)
7804  _exit(0);
7805  /* grandchild */
7806  close(redir->rd_fd); /* read side of the pipe */
7807 #if BB_MMU
7808  full_write(pair.wr, heredoc, len); /* may loop or block */
7809  _exit(0);
7810 #else
7811  /* Delegate blocking writes to another process */
7812  xmove_fd(pair.wr, STDOUT_FILENO);
7813  re_execute_shell(&to_free, heredoc, NULL, NULL, NULL);
7814 #endif
7815  }
7816  /* parent */
7817 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
7818  G.count_SIGCHLD++;
7819 //bb_error_msg("[%d] fork in setup_heredoc: G.count_SIGCHLD:%d G.handled_SIGCHLD:%d", getpid(), G.count_SIGCHLD, G.handled_SIGCHLD);
7820 #endif
7821  enable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
7822 #if !BB_MMU
7823  free(to_free);
7824 #endif
7825  close(pair.wr);
7826  free(expanded);
7827  wait(NULL); /* wait till child has died */
7828 }
7829 
7830 struct squirrel {
7831  int orig_fd;
7832  int moved_to;
7833  /* moved_to = n: fd was moved to n; restore back to orig_fd after redir */
7834  /* moved_to = -1: fd was opened by redirect; close orig_fd after redir */
7835 };
7836 
7837 static struct squirrel *append_squirrel(struct squirrel *sq, int i, int orig, int moved)
7838 {
7839  sq = xrealloc(sq, (i + 2) * sizeof(sq[0]));
7840  sq[i].orig_fd = orig;
7841  sq[i].moved_to = moved;
7842  sq[i+1].orig_fd = -1; /* end marker */
7843  return sq;
7844 }
7845 
7846 static struct squirrel *add_squirrel(struct squirrel *sq, int fd, int avoid_fd)
7847 {
7848  int moved_to;
7849  int i;
7850 
7851  i = 0;
7852  if (sq) for (; sq[i].orig_fd >= 0; i++) {
7853  /* If we collide with an already moved fd... */
7854  if (fd == sq[i].moved_to) {
7855  sq[i].moved_to = dup_CLOEXEC(sq[i].moved_to, avoid_fd);
7856  debug_printf_redir("redirect_fd %d: already busy, moving to %d\n", fd, sq[i].moved_to);
7857  if (sq[i].moved_to < 0) /* what? */
7858  xfunc_die();
7859  return sq;
7860  }
7861  if (fd == sq[i].orig_fd) {
7862  /* Example: echo Hello >/dev/null 1>&2 */
7863  debug_printf_redir("redirect_fd %d: already moved\n", fd);
7864  return sq;
7865  }
7866  }
7867 
7868  /* If this fd is open, we move and remember it; if it's closed, moved_to = -1 */
7869  moved_to = dup_CLOEXEC(fd, avoid_fd);
7870  debug_printf_redir("redirect_fd %d: previous fd is moved to %d (-1 if it was closed)\n", fd, moved_to);
7871  if (moved_to < 0 && errno != EBADF)
7872  xfunc_die();
7873  return append_squirrel(sq, i, fd, moved_to);
7874 }
7875 
7876 static struct squirrel *add_squirrel_closed(struct squirrel *sq, int fd)
7877 {
7878  int i;
7879 
7880  i = 0;
7881  if (sq) for (; sq[i].orig_fd >= 0; i++) {
7882  /* If we collide with an already moved fd... */
7883  if (fd == sq[i].orig_fd) {
7884  /* Examples:
7885  * "echo 3>FILE 3>&- 3>FILE"
7886  * "echo 3>&- 3>FILE"
7887  * No need for last redirect to insert
7888  * another "need to close 3" indicator.
7889  */
7890  debug_printf_redir("redirect_fd %d: already moved or closed\n", fd);
7891  return sq;
7892  }
7893  }
7894 
7895  debug_printf_redir("redirect_fd %d: previous fd was closed\n", fd);
7896  return append_squirrel(sq, i, fd, -1);
7897 }
7898 
7899 /* fd: redirect wants this fd to be used (e.g. 3>file).
7900  * Move all conflicting internally used fds,
7901  * and remember them so that we can restore them later.
7902  */
7903 static int save_fd_on_redirect(int fd, int avoid_fd, struct squirrel **sqp)
7904 {
7905  if (avoid_fd < 9) /* the important case here is that it can be -1 */
7906  avoid_fd = 9;
7907 
7908 #if ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
7909  if (fd != 0 /* don't trigger for G_interactive_fd == 0 (that's "not interactive" flag) */
7910  && fd == G_interactive_fd
7911  ) {
7912  /* Testcase: "ls -l /proc/$$/fd 255>&-" should work */
7913  G_interactive_fd = xdup_CLOEXEC_and_close(G_interactive_fd, avoid_fd);
7914  debug_printf_redir("redirect_fd %d: matches interactive_fd, moving it to %d\n", fd, G_interactive_fd);
7915  return 1; /* "we closed fd" */
7916  }
7917 #endif
7918  /* Are we called from setup_redirects(squirrel==NULL)
7919  * in redirect in a [v]forked child?
7920  */
7921  if (sqp == NULL) {
7922  /* No need to move script fds.
7923  * For NOMMU case, it's actively wrong: we'd change ->fd
7924  * fields in memory for the parent, but parent's fds
7925  * aren't moved, it would use wrong fd!
7926  * Reproducer: "cmd 3>FILE" in script.
7927  * If we would call move_HFILEs_on_redirect(), child would:
7928  * fcntl64(3, F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC, 10) = 10
7929  * close(3) = 0
7930  * and change ->fd to 10 if fd#3 is a script fd. WRONG.
7931  */
7932  //bb_error_msg("sqp == NULL: [v]forked child");
7933  return 0;
7934  }
7935 
7936  /* If this one of script's fds? */
7937  if (move_HFILEs_on_redirect(fd, avoid_fd))
7938  return 1; /* yes. "we closed fd" (actually moved it) */
7939 
7940  /* Are we called for "exec 3>FILE"? Came through
7941  * redirect_and_varexp_helper(squirrel=ERR_PTR) -> setup_redirects(ERR_PTR)
7942  * This case used to fail for this script:
7943  * exec 3>FILE
7944  * echo Ok
7945  * ...100000 more lines...
7946  * echo Ok
7947  * as follows:
7948  * read(3, "exec 3>FILE\necho Ok\necho Ok"..., 1024) = 1024
7949  * open("FILE", O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_TRUNC|O_LARGEFILE, 0666) = 4
7950  * dup2(4, 3) = 3
7951  * ^^^^^^^^ oops, we lost fd#3 opened to our script!
7952  * close(4) = 0
7953  * write(1, "Ok\n", 3) = 3
7954  * ... = 3
7955  * write(1, "Ok\n", 3) = 3
7956  * read(3, 0x94fbc08, 1024) = -1 EBADF (Bad file descriptor)
7957  * ^^^^^^^^ oops, wrong fd!!!
7958  * With this case separate from sqp == NULL and *after* move_HFILEs,
7959  * it now works:
7960  */
7961  if (sqp == ERR_PTR) {
7962  /* Don't preserve redirected fds: exec is _meant_ to change these */
7963  //bb_error_msg("sqp == ERR_PTR: exec >FILE");
7964  return 0;
7965  }
7966 
7967  /* Check whether it collides with any open fds (e.g. stdio), save fds as needed */
7968  *sqp = add_squirrel(*sqp, fd, avoid_fd);
7969  return 0; /* "we did not close fd" */
7970 }
7971 
7972 static void restore_redirects(struct squirrel *sq)
7973 {
7974  if (sq) {
7975  int i;
7976  for (i = 0; sq[i].orig_fd >= 0; i++) {
7977  if (sq[i].moved_to >= 0) {
7978  /* We simply die on error */
7979  debug_printf_redir("restoring redirected fd from %d to %d\n", sq[i].moved_to, sq[i].orig_fd);
7980  xmove_fd(sq[i].moved_to, sq[i].orig_fd);
7981  } else {
7982  /* cmd1 9>FILE; cmd2_should_see_fd9_closed */
7983  debug_printf_redir("restoring redirected fd %d: closing it\n", sq[i].orig_fd);
7984  close(sq[i].orig_fd);
7985  }
7986  }
7987  free(sq);
7988  }
7989  if (G.HFILE_stdin
7990  && G.HFILE_stdin->fd > STDIN_FILENO
7991  /* we compare > STDIN, not == STDIN, since hfgetc()
7992  * closes fd and sets ->fd to -1 if EOF is reached.
7993  * Testcase: echo 'pwd' | hush
7994  */
7995  ) {
7996  /* Testcase: interactive "read r <FILE; echo $r; read r; echo $r".
7997  * Redirect moves ->fd to e.g. 10,
7998  * and it is not restored above (we do not restore script fds
7999  * after redirects, we just use new, "moved" fds).
8000  * However for stdin, get_user_input() -> read_line_input(),
8001  * and read builtin, depend on fd == STDIN_FILENO.
8002  */
8003  debug_printf_redir("restoring %d to stdin\n", G.HFILE_stdin->fd);
8004  xmove_fd(G.HFILE_stdin->fd, STDIN_FILENO);
8005  G.HFILE_stdin->fd = STDIN_FILENO;
8006  }
8007 
8008  /* If moved, G_interactive_fd stays on new fd, not restoring it */
8009 }
8010 
8011 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_STANDALONE && BB_MMU
8012 static void close_saved_fds_and_FILE_fds(void)
8013 {
8014  if (G_interactive_fd)
8015  close(G_interactive_fd);
8016  close_all_HFILE_list();
8017 }
8018 #endif
8019 
8020 static int internally_opened_fd(int fd, struct squirrel *sq)
8021 {
8022  int i;
8023 
8024 #if ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
8025  if (fd == G_interactive_fd)
8026  return 1;
8027 #endif
8028  /* If this one of script's fds? */
8029  if (fd_in_HFILEs(fd))
8030  return 1;
8031 
8032  if (sq) for (i = 0; sq[i].orig_fd >= 0; i++) {
8033  if (fd == sq[i].moved_to)
8034  return 1;
8035  }
8036  return 0;
8037 }
8038 
8039 /* squirrel != NULL means we squirrel away copies of stdin, stdout,
8040  * and stderr if they are redirected. */
8041 static int setup_redirects(struct command *prog, struct squirrel **sqp)
8042 {
8043  struct redir_struct *redir;
8044 
8045  for (redir = prog->redirects; redir; redir = redir->next) {
8046  int newfd;
8047  int closed;
8048 
8049  if (redir->rd_type == REDIRECT_HEREDOC2) {
8050  /* "rd_fd<<HERE" case */
8051  save_fd_on_redirect(redir->rd_fd, /*avoid:*/ 0, sqp);
8052  /* for REDIRECT_HEREDOC2, rd_filename holds _contents_
8053  * of the heredoc */
8054  debug_printf_redir("set heredoc '%s'\n",
8055  redir->rd_filename);
8056  setup_heredoc(redir);
8057  continue;
8058  }
8059 
8060  if (redir->rd_dup == REDIRFD_TO_FILE) {
8061  /* "rd_fd<*>file" case (<*> is <,>,>>,<>) */
8062  char *p;
8063  int mode;
8064 
8065  if (redir->rd_filename == NULL) {
8066  /* Examples:
8067  * "cmd >" (no filename)
8068  * "cmd > <file" (2nd redirect starts too early)
8069  */
8070  syntax_error("invalid redirect");
8071  continue;
8072  }
8073  mode = redir_table[redir->rd_type].mode;
8074  p = expand_string_to_string(redir->rd_filename,
8075  EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS, /*unbackslash:*/ 1);
8076  newfd = open_or_warn(p, mode);
8077  free(p);
8078  if (newfd < 0) {
8079  /* Error message from open_or_warn can be lost
8080  * if stderr has been redirected, but bash
8081  * and ash both lose it as well
8082  * (though zsh doesn't!)
8083  */
8084  return 1;
8085  }
8086  if (newfd == redir->rd_fd && sqp) {
8087  /* open() gave us precisely the fd we wanted.
8088  * This means that this fd was not busy
8089  * (not opened to anywhere).
8090  * Remember to close it on restore:
8091  */
8092  *sqp = add_squirrel_closed(*sqp, newfd);
8093  debug_printf_redir("redir to previously closed fd %d\n", newfd);
8094  }
8095  } else {
8096  /* "rd_fd>&rd_dup" or "rd_fd>&-" case */
8097  newfd = redir->rd_dup;
8098  }
8099 
8100  if (newfd == redir->rd_fd)
8101  continue;
8102 
8103  /* if "N>FILE": move newfd to redir->rd_fd */
8104  /* if "N>&M": dup newfd to redir->rd_fd */
8105  /* if "N>&-": close redir->rd_fd (newfd is REDIRFD_CLOSE) */
8106 
8107  closed = save_fd_on_redirect(redir->rd_fd, /*avoid:*/ newfd, sqp);
8108  if (newfd == REDIRFD_CLOSE) {
8109  /* "N>&-" means "close me" */
8110  if (!closed) {
8111  /* ^^^ optimization: saving may already
8112  * have closed it. If not... */
8113  close(redir->rd_fd);
8114  }
8115  /* Sometimes we do another close on restore, getting EBADF.
8116  * Consider "echo 3>FILE 3>&-"
8117  * first redirect remembers "need to close 3",
8118  * and second redirect closes 3! Restore code then closes 3 again.
8119  */
8120  } else {
8121  /* if newfd is a script fd or saved fd, simulate EBADF */
8122  if (internally_opened_fd(newfd, sqp && sqp != ERR_PTR ? *sqp : NULL)) {
8123  //errno = EBADF;
8124  //bb_perror_msg_and_die("can't duplicate file descriptor");
8125  newfd = -1; /* same effect as code above */
8126  }
8127  xdup2(newfd, redir->rd_fd);
8128  if (redir->rd_dup == REDIRFD_TO_FILE)
8129  /* "rd_fd > FILE" */
8130  close(newfd);
8131  /* else: "rd_fd > rd_dup" */
8132  }
8133  }
8134  return 0;
8135 }
8136 
8137 static char *find_in_path(const char *arg)
8138 {
8139  char *ret = NULL;
8140  const char *PATH = get_local_var_value("PATH");
8141 
8142  if (!PATH)
8143  return NULL;
8144 
8145  while (1) {
8146  const char *end = strchrnul(PATH, ':');
8147  int sz = end - PATH; /* must be int! */
8148 
8149  free(ret);
8150  if (sz != 0) {
8151  ret = xasprintf("%.*s/%s", sz, PATH, arg);
8152  } else {
8153  /* We have xxx::yyyy in $PATH,
8154  * it means "use current dir" */
8155  ret = xstrdup(arg);
8156  }
8157  if (access(ret, F_OK) == 0)
8158  break;
8159 
8160  if (*end == '\0') {
8161  free(ret);
8162  return NULL;
8163  }
8164  PATH = end + 1;
8165  }
8166 
8167  return ret;
8168 }
8169 
8170 static const struct built_in_command *find_builtin_helper(const char *name,
8171  const struct built_in_command *x,
8172  const struct built_in_command *end)
8173 {
8174  while (x != end) {
8175  if (strcmp(name, x->b_cmd) != 0) {
8176  x++;
8177  continue;
8178  }
8179  debug_printf_exec("found builtin '%s'\n", name);
8180  return x;
8181  }
8182  return NULL;
8183 }
8184 static const struct built_in_command *find_builtin1(const char *name)
8185 {
8186  return find_builtin_helper(name, bltins1, &bltins1[ARRAY_SIZE(bltins1)]);
8187 }
8188 static const struct built_in_command *find_builtin(const char *name)
8189 {
8190  const struct built_in_command *x = find_builtin1(name);
8191  if (x)
8192  return x;
8193  return find_builtin_helper(name, bltins2, &bltins2[ARRAY_SIZE(bltins2)]);
8194 }
8195 
8196 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB && ENABLE_FEATURE_TAB_COMPLETION
8197 static const char * FAST_FUNC get_builtin_name(int i)
8198 {
8199  if (/*i >= 0 && */ i < ARRAY_SIZE(bltins1)) {
8200  return bltins1[i].b_cmd;
8201  }
8202  i -= ARRAY_SIZE(bltins1);
8203  if (i < ARRAY_SIZE(bltins2)) {
8204  return bltins2[i].b_cmd;
8205  }
8206  return NULL;
8207 }
8208 #endif
8209 
8210 static void remove_nested_vars(void)
8211 {
8212  struct variable *cur;
8213  struct variable **cur_pp;
8214 
8215  cur_pp = &G.top_var;
8216  while ((cur = *cur_pp) != NULL) {
8217  if (cur->var_nest_level <= G.var_nest_level) {
8218  cur_pp = &cur->next;
8219  continue;
8220  }
8221  /* Unexport */
8222  if (cur->flg_export) {
8223  debug_printf_env("unexporting nested '%s'/%u\n", cur->varstr, cur->var_nest_level);
8224  bb_unsetenv(cur->varstr);
8225  }
8226  /* Remove from global list */
8227  *cur_pp = cur->next;
8228  /* Free */
8229  if (!cur->max_len) {
8230  debug_printf_env("freeing nested '%s'/%u\n", cur->varstr, cur->var_nest_level);
8231  free(cur->varstr);
8232  }
8233  free(cur);
8234  }
8235 }
8236 
8237 static void enter_var_nest_level(void)
8238 {
8239  G.var_nest_level++;
8240  debug_printf_env("var_nest_level++ %u\n", G.var_nest_level);
8241 
8242  /* Try: f() { echo -n .; f; }; f
8243  * struct variable::var_nest_level is uint16_t,
8244  * thus limiting recursion to < 2^16.
8245  * In any case, with 8 Mbyte stack SEGV happens
8246  * not too long after 2^16 recursions anyway.
8247  */
8248  if (G.var_nest_level > 0xff00)
8249  bb_error_msg_and_die("fatal recursion (depth %u)", G.var_nest_level);
8250 }
8251 
8252 static void leave_var_nest_level(void)
8253 {
8254  G.var_nest_level--;
8255  debug_printf_env("var_nest_level-- %u\n", G.var_nest_level);
8256  if (HUSH_DEBUG && (int)G.var_nest_level < 0)
8257  bb_simple_error_msg_and_die("BUG: nesting underflow");
8258 
8259  remove_nested_vars();
8260 }
8261 
8262 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
8263 static struct function **find_function_slot(const char *name)
8264 {
8265  struct function *funcp;
8266  struct function **funcpp = &G.top_func;
8267 
8268  while ((funcp = *funcpp) != NULL) {
8269  if (strcmp(name, funcp->name) == 0) {
8270  debug_printf_exec("found function '%s'\n", name);
8271  break;
8272  }
8273  funcpp = &funcp->next;
8274  }
8275  return funcpp;
8276 }
8277 
8278 static ALWAYS_INLINE const struct function *find_function(const char *name)
8279 {
8280  const struct function *funcp = *find_function_slot(name);
8281  return funcp;
8282 }
8283 
8284 /* Note: takes ownership on name ptr */
8285 static struct function *new_function(char *name)
8286 {
8287  struct function **funcpp = find_function_slot(name);
8288  struct function *funcp = *funcpp;
8289 
8290  if (funcp != NULL) {
8291  struct command *cmd = funcp->parent_cmd;
8292  debug_printf_exec("func %p parent_cmd %p\n", funcp, cmd);
8293  if (!cmd) {
8294  debug_printf_exec("freeing & replacing function '%s'\n", funcp->name);
8295  free(funcp->name);
8296  /* Note: if !funcp->body, do not free body_as_string!
8297  * This is a special case of "-F name body" function:
8298  * body_as_string was not malloced! */
8299  if (funcp->body) {
8300  free_pipe_list(funcp->body);
8301 # if !BB_MMU
8302  free(funcp->body_as_string);
8303 # endif
8304  }
8305  } else {
8306  debug_printf_exec("reinserting in tree & replacing function '%s'\n", funcp->name);
8307  cmd->argv[0] = funcp->name;
8308  cmd->group = funcp->body;
8309 # if !BB_MMU
8310  cmd->group_as_string = funcp->body_as_string;
8311 # endif
8312  }
8313  } else {
8314  debug_printf_exec("remembering new function '%s'\n", name);
8315  funcp = *funcpp = xzalloc(sizeof(*funcp));
8316  /*funcp->next = NULL;*/
8317  }
8318 
8319  funcp->name = name;
8320  return funcp;
8321 }
8322 
8323 # if ENABLE_HUSH_UNSET
8324 static void unset_func(const char *name)
8325 {
8326  struct function **funcpp = find_function_slot(name);
8327  struct function *funcp = *funcpp;
8328 
8329  if (funcp != NULL) {
8330  debug_printf_exec("freeing function '%s'\n", funcp->name);
8331  *funcpp = funcp->next;
8332  /* funcp is unlinked now, deleting it.
8333  * Note: if !funcp->body, the function was created by
8334  * "-F name body", do not free ->body_as_string
8335  * and ->name as they were not malloced. */
8336  if (funcp->body) {
8337  free_pipe_list(funcp->body);
8338  free(funcp->name);
8339 # if !BB_MMU
8340  free(funcp->body_as_string);
8341 # endif
8342  }
8343  free(funcp);
8344  }
8345 }
8346 # endif
8347 
8348 # if BB_MMU
8349 #define exec_function(to_free, funcp, argv) \
8350  exec_function(funcp, argv)
8351 # endif
8352 static void exec_function(char ***to_free,
8353  const struct function *funcp,
8354  char **argv) NORETURN;
8355 static void exec_function(char ***to_free,
8356  const struct function *funcp,
8357  char **argv)
8358 {
8359 # if BB_MMU
8360  int n;
8361 
8362  argv[0] = G.global_argv[0];
8363  G.global_argv = argv;
8364  G.global_argc = n = 1 + string_array_len(argv + 1);
8365 
8366 // Example when we are here: "cmd | func"
8367 // func will run with saved-redirect fds open.
8368 // $ f() { echo /proc/self/fd/*; }
8369 // $ true | f
8370 // /proc/self/fd/0 /proc/self/fd/1 /proc/self/fd/2 /proc/self/fd/255 /proc/self/fd/3
8371 // stdio^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ G_interactive_fd^ DIR fd for glob
8372 // Same in script:
8373 // $ . ./SCRIPT
8374 // /proc/self/fd/0 /proc/self/fd/1 /proc/self/fd/2 /proc/self/fd/255 /proc/self/fd/3 /proc/self/fd/4
8375 // stdio^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ G_interactive_fd^ opened ./SCRIPT DIR fd for glob
8376 // They are CLOEXEC so external programs won't see them, but
8377 // for "more correctness" we might want to close those extra fds here:
8378 //? close_saved_fds_and_FILE_fds();
8379 
8380  /* "we are in a function, ok to use return" */
8381  G_flag_return_in_progress = -1;
8382  enter_var_nest_level();
8383  IF_HUSH_LOCAL(G.func_nest_level++;)
8384 
8385  /* On MMU, funcp->body is always non-NULL */
8386  n = run_list(funcp->body);
8387  _exit(n);
8388 # else
8389 //? close_saved_fds_and_FILE_fds();
8390 
8391 //TODO: check whether "true | func_with_return" works
8392 
8393  re_execute_shell(to_free,
8394  funcp->body_as_string,
8395  G.global_argv[0],
8396  argv + 1,
8397  NULL);
8398 # endif
8399 }
8400 
8401 static int run_function(const struct function *funcp, char **argv)
8402 {
8403  int rc;
8404  save_arg_t sv;
8405  smallint sv_flg;
8406 
8407  save_and_replace_G_args(&sv, argv);
8408 
8409  /* "We are in function, ok to use return" */
8410  sv_flg = G_flag_return_in_progress;
8411  G_flag_return_in_progress = -1;
8412 
8413  /* Make "local" variables properly shadow previous ones */
8414  IF_HUSH_LOCAL(enter_var_nest_level();)
8415  IF_HUSH_LOCAL(G.func_nest_level++;)
8416 
8417  /* On MMU, funcp->body is always non-NULL */
8418 # if !BB_MMU
8419  if (!funcp->body) {
8420  /* Function defined by -F */
8421  parse_and_run_string(funcp->body_as_string);
8422  rc = G.last_exitcode;
8423  } else
8424 # endif
8425  {
8426  rc = run_list(funcp->body);
8427  }
8428 
8429  IF_HUSH_LOCAL(G.func_nest_level--;)
8430  IF_HUSH_LOCAL(leave_var_nest_level();)
8431 
8432  G_flag_return_in_progress = sv_flg;
8433 # if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
8434  debug_printf_exec("G.return_exitcode=-1\n");
8435  G.return_exitcode = -1; /* invalidate stashed return value */
8436 # endif
8437 
8438  restore_G_args(&sv, argv);
8439 
8440  return rc;
8441 }
8442 #endif /* ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS */
8443 
8444 
8445 #if BB_MMU
8446 #define exec_builtin(to_free, x, argv) \
8447  exec_builtin(x, argv)
8448 #else
8449 #define exec_builtin(to_free, x, argv) \
8450  exec_builtin(to_free, argv)
8451 #endif
8452 static void exec_builtin(char ***to_free,
8453  const struct built_in_command *x,
8454  char **argv) NORETURN;
8455 static void exec_builtin(char ***to_free,
8456  const struct built_in_command *x,
8457  char **argv)
8458 {
8459 #if BB_MMU
8460  int rcode;
8461 //? close_saved_fds_and_FILE_fds();
8462  rcode = x->b_function(argv);
8463  fflush_all();
8464  _exit(rcode);
8465 #else
8466  fflush_all();
8467  /* On NOMMU, we must never block!
8468  * Example: { sleep 99 | read line; } & echo Ok
8469  */
8470  re_execute_shell(to_free,
8471  argv[0],
8472  G.global_argv[0],
8473  G.global_argv + 1,
8474  argv);
8475 #endif
8476 }
8477 
8478 
8479 static void execvp_or_die(char **argv) NORETURN;
8480 static void execvp_or_die(char **argv)
8481 {
8482  int e;
8483  debug_printf_exec("execing '%s'\n", argv[0]);
8484  /* Don't propagate SIG_IGN to the child */
8485  if (SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS != 0)
8486  switch_off_special_sigs(G.special_sig_mask & SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS);
8487  execvp(argv[0], argv);
8488  e = 2;
8489  if (errno == EACCES) e = 126;
8490  if (errno == ENOENT) e = 127;
8491  bb_perror_msg("can't execute '%s'", argv[0]);
8492  _exit(e);
8493 }
8494 
8495 #if ENABLE_HUSH_MODE_X
8496 static void x_mode_print_optionally_squoted(const char *str)
8497 {
8498  unsigned len;
8499  const char *cp;
8500 
8501  cp = str;
8502 
8503  /* the set of chars which-cause-string-to-be-squoted mimics bash */
8504  /* test a char with: bash -c 'set -x; echo "CH"' */
8505  if (str[strcspn(str, "\\\"'`$(){}[]<>;#&|~*?!^"
8506  " " "\001\002\003\004\005\006\007"
8507  "\010\011\012\013\014\015\016\017"
8508  "\020\021\022\023\024\025\026\027"
8509  "\030\031\032\033\034\035\036\037"
8510  )
8511  ] == '\0'
8512  ) {
8513  /* string has no special chars */
8514  x_mode_addstr(str);
8515  return;
8516  }
8517 
8518  cp = str;
8519  for (;;) {
8520  /* print '....' up to EOL or first squote */
8521  len = (int)(strchrnul(cp, '\'') - cp);
8522  if (len != 0) {
8523  x_mode_addchr('\'');
8524  x_mode_addblock(cp, len);
8525  x_mode_addchr('\'');
8526  cp += len;
8527  }
8528  if (*cp == '\0')
8529  break;
8530  /* string contains squote(s), print them as \' */
8531  x_mode_addchr('\\');
8532  x_mode_addchr('\'');
8533  cp++;
8534  }
8535 }
8536 static void dump_cmd_in_x_mode(char **argv)
8537 {
8538  if (G_x_mode && argv) {
8539  unsigned n;
8540 
8541  /* "+[+++...][ cmd...]\n\0" */
8542  x_mode_prefix();
8543  n = 0;
8544  while (argv[n]) {
8545  x_mode_addchr(' ');
8546  if (argv[n][0] == '\0') {
8547  x_mode_addchr('\'');
8548  x_mode_addchr('\'');
8549  } else {
8550  x_mode_print_optionally_squoted(argv[n]);
8551  }
8552  n++;
8553  }
8554  x_mode_flush();
8555  }
8556 }
8557 #else
8558 # define dump_cmd_in_x_mode(argv) ((void)0)
8559 #endif
8560 
8561 #if ENABLE_HUSH_COMMAND
8562 static void if_command_vV_print_and_exit(char opt_vV, char *cmd, const char *explanation)
8563 {
8564  char *to_free;
8565 
8566  if (!opt_vV)
8567  return;
8568 
8569  to_free = NULL;
8570  if (!explanation) {
8571  char *path = getenv("PATH");
8572  explanation = to_free = find_executable(cmd, &path); /* path == NULL is ok */
8573  if (!explanation)
8574  _exit(1); /* PROG was not found */
8575  if (opt_vV != 'V')
8576  cmd = to_free; /* -v PROG prints "/path/to/PROG" */
8577  }
8578  printf((opt_vV == 'V') ? "%s is %s\n" : "%s\n", cmd, explanation);
8579  free(to_free);
8580  fflush_all();
8581  _exit(0);
8582 }
8583 #else
8584 # define if_command_vV_print_and_exit(a,b,c) ((void)0)
8585 #endif
8586 
8587 #if BB_MMU
8588 #define pseudo_exec_argv(nommu_save, argv, assignment_cnt, argv_expanded) \
8589  pseudo_exec_argv(argv, assignment_cnt, argv_expanded)
8590 #define pseudo_exec(nommu_save, command, argv_expanded) \
8591  pseudo_exec(command, argv_expanded)
8592 #endif
8593 
8594 /* Called after [v]fork() in run_pipe, or from builtin_exec.
8595  * Never returns.
8596  * Don't exit() here. If you don't exec, use _exit instead.
8597  * The at_exit handlers apparently confuse the calling process,
8598  * in particular stdin handling. Not sure why? -- because of vfork! (vda)
8599  */
8600 static void pseudo_exec_argv(nommu_save_t *nommu_save,
8601  char **argv, int assignment_cnt,
8602  char **argv_expanded) NORETURN;
8603 static NOINLINE void pseudo_exec_argv(nommu_save_t *nommu_save,
8604  char **argv, int assignment_cnt,
8605  char **argv_expanded)
8606 {
8607  const struct built_in_command *x;
8608  struct variable **sv_shadowed;
8609  char **new_env;
8610  IF_HUSH_COMMAND(char opt_vV = 0;)
8611  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(const struct function *funcp;)
8612 
8613  new_env = expand_assignments(argv, assignment_cnt);
8614  dump_cmd_in_x_mode(new_env);
8615 
8616  if (!argv[assignment_cnt]) {
8617  /* Case when we are here: ... | var=val | ...
8618  * (note that we do not exit early, i.e., do not optimize out
8619  * expand_assignments(): think about ... | var=`sleep 1` | ...
8620  */
8621  free_strings(new_env);
8622  _exit_SUCCESS();
8623  }
8624 
8625  sv_shadowed = G.shadowed_vars_pp;
8626 #if BB_MMU
8627  G.shadowed_vars_pp = NULL; /* "don't save, free them instead" */
8628 #else
8629  G.shadowed_vars_pp = &nommu_save->old_vars;
8630  G.var_nest_level++;
8631 #endif
8632  set_vars_and_save_old(new_env);
8633  G.shadowed_vars_pp = sv_shadowed;
8634 
8635  if (argv_expanded) {
8636  argv = argv_expanded;
8637  } else {
8638  argv = expand_strvec_to_strvec(argv + assignment_cnt);
8639 #if !BB_MMU
8640  nommu_save->argv = argv;
8641 #endif
8642  }
8643  dump_cmd_in_x_mode(argv);
8644 
8645 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_STANDALONE || BB_MMU
8646  if (strchr(argv[0], '/') != NULL)
8647  goto skip;
8648 #endif
8649 
8650 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
8651  /* Check if the command matches any functions (this goes before bltins) */
8652  funcp = find_function(argv[0]);
8653  if (funcp)
8654  exec_function(&nommu_save->argv_from_re_execing, funcp, argv);
8655 #endif
8656 
8657 #if ENABLE_HUSH_COMMAND
8658  /* "command BAR": run BAR without looking it up among functions
8659  * "command -v BAR": print "BAR" or "/path/to/BAR"; or exit 1
8660  * "command -V BAR": print "BAR is {a function,a shell builtin,/path/to/BAR}"
8661  */
8662  while (strcmp(argv[0], "command") == 0 && argv[1]) {
8663  char *p;
8664 
8665  argv++;
8666  p = *argv;
8667  if (p[0] != '-' || !p[1])
8668  continue; /* bash allows "command command command [-OPT] BAR" */
8669 
8670  for (;;) {
8671  p++;
8672  switch (*p) {
8673  case '\0':
8674  argv++;
8675  p = *argv;
8676  if (p[0] != '-' || !p[1])
8677  goto after_opts;
8678  continue; /* next arg is also -opts, process it too */
8679  case 'v':
8680  case 'V':
8681  opt_vV = *p;
8682  continue;
8683  default:
8684  bb_error_msg_and_die("%s: %s: invalid option", "command", argv[0]);
8685  }
8686  }
8687  }
8688  after_opts:
8689 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
8690  if (opt_vV && find_function(argv[0]))
8691  if_command_vV_print_and_exit(opt_vV, argv[0], "a function");
8692 # endif
8693 #endif
8694 
8695  /* Check if the command matches any of the builtins.
8696  * Depending on context, this might be redundant. But it's
8697  * easier to waste a few CPU cycles than it is to figure out
8698  * if this is one of those cases.
8699  */
8700  /* Why "BB_MMU ? :" difference in logic? -
8701  * On NOMMU, it is more expensive to re-execute shell
8702  * just in order to run echo or test builtin.
8703  * It's better to skip it here and run corresponding
8704  * non-builtin later. */
8705  x = BB_MMU ? find_builtin(argv[0]) : find_builtin1(argv[0]);
8706  if (x) {
8707  if_command_vV_print_and_exit(opt_vV, argv[0], "a shell builtin");
8708  exec_builtin(&nommu_save->argv_from_re_execing, x, argv);
8709  }
8710 
8711 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_STANDALONE
8712  /* Check if the command matches any busybox applets */
8713  {
8714  int a = find_applet_by_name(argv[0]);
8715  if (a >= 0) {
8716  if_command_vV_print_and_exit(opt_vV, argv[0], "an applet");
8717 # if BB_MMU /* see above why on NOMMU it is not allowed */
8718  if (APPLET_IS_NOEXEC(a)) {
8719  /* Do not leak open fds from opened script files etc.
8720  * Testcase: interactive "ls -l /proc/self/fd"
8721  * should not show tty fd open.
8722  */
8723  close_saved_fds_and_FILE_fds();
8724 //FIXME: should also close saved redir fds
8725 //This casuses test failures in
8726 //redir_children_should_not_see_saved_fd_2.tests
8727 //redir_children_should_not_see_saved_fd_3.tests
8728 //if you replace "busybox find" with just "find" in them
8729  /* Without this, "rm -i FILE" can't be ^C'ed: */
8730  switch_off_special_sigs(G.special_sig_mask);
8731  debug_printf_exec("running applet '%s'\n", argv[0]);
8732  run_noexec_applet_and_exit(a, argv[0], argv);
8733  }
8734 # endif
8735  /* Re-exec ourselves */
8736  debug_printf_exec("re-execing applet '%s'\n", argv[0]);
8737  /* Don't propagate SIG_IGN to the child */
8738  if (SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS != 0)
8739  switch_off_special_sigs(G.special_sig_mask & SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS);
8740  execv(bb_busybox_exec_path, argv);
8741  /* If they called chroot or otherwise made the binary no longer
8742  * executable, fall through */
8743  }
8744  }
8745 #endif
8746 
8747 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_STANDALONE || BB_MMU
8748  skip:
8749 #endif
8750  if_command_vV_print_and_exit(opt_vV, argv[0], NULL);
8751  execvp_or_die(argv);
8752 }
8753 
8754 /* Called after [v]fork() in run_pipe
8755  */
8756 static void pseudo_exec(nommu_save_t *nommu_save,
8757  struct command *command,
8758  char **argv_expanded) NORETURN;
8759 static void pseudo_exec(nommu_save_t *nommu_save,
8760  struct command *command,
8761  char **argv_expanded)
8762 {
8763 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
8764  if (command->cmd_type == CMD_FUNCDEF) {
8765  /* Ignore funcdefs in pipes:
8766  * true | f() { cmd }
8767  */
8768  _exit(0);
8769  }
8770 #endif
8771 
8772  if (command->argv) {
8773  pseudo_exec_argv(nommu_save, command->argv,
8774  command->assignment_cnt, argv_expanded);
8775  }
8776 
8777  if (command->group) {
8778  /* Cases when we are here:
8779  * ( list )
8780  * { list } &
8781  * ... | ( list ) | ...
8782  * ... | { list } | ...
8783  */
8784 #if BB_MMU
8785  int rcode;
8786  debug_printf_exec("pseudo_exec: run_list\n");
8787  reset_traps_to_defaults();
8788  rcode = run_list(command->group);
8789  /* OK to leak memory by not calling free_pipe_list,
8790  * since this process is about to exit */
8791  _exit(rcode);
8792 #else
8793  re_execute_shell(&nommu_save->argv_from_re_execing,
8794  command->group_as_string,
8795  G.global_argv[0],
8796  G.global_argv + 1,
8797  NULL);
8798 #endif
8799  }
8800 
8801  /* Case when we are here: ... | >file */
8802  debug_printf_exec("pseudo_exec'ed null command\n");
8803  _exit_SUCCESS();
8804 }
8805 
8806 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
8807 static const char *get_cmdtext(struct pipe *pi)
8808 {
8809  char **argv;
8810  char *p;
8811  int len;
8812 
8813  /* This is subtle. ->cmdtext is created only on first backgrounding.
8814  * (Think "cat, <ctrl-z>, fg, <ctrl-z>, fg, <ctrl-z>...." here...)
8815  * On subsequent bg argv is trashed, but we won't use it */
8816  if (pi->cmdtext)
8817  return pi->cmdtext;
8818 
8819  argv = pi->cmds[0].argv;
8820  if (!argv) {
8821  pi->cmdtext = xzalloc(1);
8822  return pi->cmdtext;
8823  }
8824  len = 0;
8825  do {
8826  len += strlen(*argv) + 1;
8827  } while (*++argv);
8828  p = xmalloc(len);
8829  pi->cmdtext = p;
8830  argv = pi->cmds[0].argv;
8831  do {
8832  p = stpcpy(p, *argv);
8833  *p++ = ' ';
8834  } while (*++argv);
8835  p[-1] = '\0';
8836  return pi->cmdtext;
8837 }
8838 
8839 static void remove_job_from_table(struct pipe *pi)
8840 {
8841  struct pipe *prev_pipe;
8842 
8843  if (pi == G.job_list) {
8844  G.job_list = pi->next;
8845  } else {
8846  prev_pipe = G.job_list;
8847  while (prev_pipe->next != pi)
8848  prev_pipe = prev_pipe->next;
8849  prev_pipe->next = pi->next;
8850  }
8851  G.last_jobid = 0;
8852  if (G.job_list)
8853  G.last_jobid = G.job_list->jobid;
8854 }
8855 
8856 static void delete_finished_job(struct pipe *pi)
8857 {
8858  remove_job_from_table(pi);
8859  free_pipe(pi);
8860 }
8861 
8862 static void clean_up_last_dead_job(void)
8863 {
8864  if (G.job_list && !G.job_list->alive_cmds)
8865  delete_finished_job(G.job_list);
8866 }
8867 
8868 static void insert_job_into_table(struct pipe *pi)
8869 {
8870  struct pipe *job, **jobp;
8871  int i;
8872 
8873  clean_up_last_dead_job();
8874 
8875  /* Find the end of the list, and find next job ID to use */
8876  i = 0;
8877  jobp = &G.job_list;
8878  while ((job = *jobp) != NULL) {
8879  if (job->jobid > i)
8880  i = job->jobid;
8881  jobp = &job->next;
8882  }
8883  pi->jobid = i + 1;
8884 
8885  /* Create a new job struct at the end */
8886  job = *jobp = xmemdup(pi, sizeof(*pi));
8887  job->next = NULL;
8888  job->cmds = xzalloc(sizeof(pi->cmds[0]) * pi->num_cmds);
8889  /* Cannot copy entire pi->cmds[] vector! This causes double frees */
8890  for (i = 0; i < pi->num_cmds; i++) {
8891  job->cmds[i].pid = pi->cmds[i].pid;
8892  /* all other fields are not used and stay zero */
8893  }
8894  job->cmdtext = xstrdup(get_cmdtext(pi));
8895 
8896  if (G_interactive_fd)
8897  printf("[%u] %u %s\n", job->jobid, (unsigned)job->cmds[0].pid, job->cmdtext);
8898  G.last_jobid = job->jobid;
8899 }
8900 #endif /* JOB */
8901 
8902 static int job_exited_or_stopped(struct pipe *pi)
8903 {
8904  int rcode, i;
8905 
8906  if (pi->alive_cmds != pi->stopped_cmds)
8907  return -1;
8908 
8909  /* All processes in fg pipe have exited or stopped */
8910  rcode = 0;
8911  i = pi->num_cmds;
8912  while (--i >= 0) {
8913  rcode = pi->cmds[i].cmd_exitcode;
8914  /* usually last process gives overall exitstatus,
8915  * but with "set -o pipefail", last *failed* process does */
8916  if (G.o_opt[OPT_O_PIPEFAIL] == 0 || rcode != 0)
8917  break;
8918  }
8919  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(if (pi->pi_inverted) rcode = !rcode;)
8920  return rcode;
8921 }
8922 
8923 static int process_wait_result(struct pipe *fg_pipe, pid_t childpid, int status)
8924 {
8925 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
8926  struct pipe *pi;
8927 #endif
8928  int i, dead;
8929 
8930  dead = WIFEXITED(status) || WIFSIGNALED(status);
8931 
8932 #if DEBUG_JOBS
8933  if (WIFSTOPPED(status))
8934  debug_printf_jobs("pid %d stopped by sig %d (exitcode %d)\n",
8935  childpid, WSTOPSIG(status), WEXITSTATUS(status));
8936  if (WIFSIGNALED(status))
8937  debug_printf_jobs("pid %d killed by sig %d (exitcode %d)\n",
8938  childpid, WTERMSIG(status), WEXITSTATUS(status));
8939  if (WIFEXITED(status))
8940  debug_printf_jobs("pid %d exited, exitcode %d\n",
8941  childpid, WEXITSTATUS(status));
8942 #endif
8943  /* Were we asked to wait for a fg pipe? */
8944  if (fg_pipe) {
8945  i = fg_pipe->num_cmds;
8946 
8947  while (--i >= 0) {
8948  int rcode;
8949 
8950  debug_printf_jobs("check pid %d\n", fg_pipe->cmds[i].pid);
8951  if (fg_pipe->cmds[i].pid != childpid)
8952  continue;
8953  if (dead) {
8954  int ex;
8955  fg_pipe->cmds[i].pid = 0;
8956  fg_pipe->alive_cmds--;
8957  ex = WEXITSTATUS(status);
8958  /* bash prints killer signal's name for *last*
8959  * process in pipe (prints just newline for SIGINT/SIGPIPE).
8960  * Mimic this. Example: "sleep 5" + (^\ or kill -QUIT)
8961  */
8962  if (WIFSIGNALED(status)) {
8963  int sig = WTERMSIG(status);
8964 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
8965  if (G.run_list_level == 1
8966  /* ^^^^^ Do not print in nested contexts, example:
8967  * echo `sleep 1; sh -c 'kill -9 $$'` - prints "137", NOT "Killed 137"
8968  */
8969  && i == fg_pipe->num_cmds-1
8970  ) {
8971  /* strsignal() is for bash compat. ~600 bloat versus bbox's get_signame() */
8972  puts(sig == SIGINT || sig == SIGPIPE ? "" : strsignal(sig));
8973  }
8974 #endif
8975  /* TODO: if (WCOREDUMP(status)) + " (core dumped)"; */
8976  /* MIPS has 128 sigs (1..128), if sig==128,
8977  * 128 + sig would result in exitcode 256 -> 0!
8978  */
8979  ex = 128 | sig;
8980  }
8981  fg_pipe->cmds[i].cmd_exitcode = ex;
8982  } else {
8983  fg_pipe->stopped_cmds++;
8984  }
8985  debug_printf_jobs("fg_pipe: alive_cmds %d stopped_cmds %d\n",
8986  fg_pipe->alive_cmds, fg_pipe->stopped_cmds);
8987  rcode = job_exited_or_stopped(fg_pipe);
8988  if (rcode >= 0) {
8989 /* Note: *non-interactive* bash does not continue if all processes in fg pipe
8990  * are stopped. Testcase: "cat | cat" in a script (not on command line!)
8991  * and "killall -STOP cat" */
8992  if (G_interactive_fd) {
8993 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
8994  if (fg_pipe->alive_cmds != 0)
8995  insert_job_into_table(fg_pipe);
8996 #endif
8997  return rcode;
8998  }
8999  if (fg_pipe->alive_cmds == 0)
9000  return rcode;
9001  }
9002  /* There are still running processes in the fg_pipe */
9003  return -1;
9004  }
9005  /* It wasn't in fg_pipe, look for process in bg pipes */
9006  }
9007 
9008 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9009  /* We were asked to wait for bg or orphaned children */
9010  /* No need to remember exitcode in this case */
9011  for (pi = G.job_list; pi; pi = pi->next) {
9012  for (i = 0; i < pi->num_cmds; i++) {
9013  if (pi->cmds[i].pid == childpid)
9014  goto found_pi_and_prognum;
9015  }
9016  }
9017  /* Happens when shell is used as init process (init=/bin/sh) */
9018  debug_printf("checkjobs: pid %d was not in our list!\n", childpid);
9019  return -1; /* this wasn't a process from fg_pipe */
9020 
9021  found_pi_and_prognum:
9022  if (dead) {
9023  /* child exited */
9024  int rcode = WEXITSTATUS(status);
9025  if (WIFSIGNALED(status))
9026  /* NB: not 128 + sig, MIPS has sig 128 */
9027  rcode = 128 | WTERMSIG(status);
9028  pi->cmds[i].cmd_exitcode = rcode;
9029  if (G.last_bg_pid == pi->cmds[i].pid)
9030  G.last_bg_pid_exitcode = rcode;
9031  pi->cmds[i].pid = 0;
9032  pi->alive_cmds--;
9033  if (!pi->alive_cmds) {
9034 # if ENABLE_HUSH_BASH_COMPAT
9035  G.dead_job_exitcode = job_exited_or_stopped(pi);
9036 # endif
9037  if (G_interactive_fd) {
9038  printf(JOB_STATUS_FORMAT, pi->jobid,
9039  "Done", pi->cmdtext);
9040  delete_finished_job(pi);
9041  } else {
9042 /*
9043  * bash deletes finished jobs from job table only in interactive mode,
9044  * after "jobs" cmd, or if pid of a new process matches one of the old ones
9045  * (see cleanup_dead_jobs(), delete_old_job(), J_NOTIFIED in bash source).
9046  * Testcase script: "(exit 3) & sleep 1; wait %1; echo $?" prints 3 in bash.
9047  * We only retain one "dead" job, if it's the single job on the list.
9048  * This covers most of real-world scenarios where this is useful.
9049  */
9050  if (pi != G.job_list)
9051  delete_finished_job(pi);
9052  }
9053  }
9054  } else {
9055  /* child stopped */
9056  pi->stopped_cmds++;
9057  }
9058 #endif
9059  return -1; /* this wasn't a process from fg_pipe */
9060 }
9061 
9062 /* Check to see if any processes have exited -- if they have,
9063  * figure out why and see if a job has completed.
9064  *
9065  * If non-NULL fg_pipe: wait for its completion or stop.
9066  * Return its exitcode or zero if stopped.
9067  *
9068  * Alternatively (fg_pipe == NULL, waitfor_pid != 0):
9069  * waitpid(WNOHANG), if waitfor_pid exits or stops, return exitcode+1,
9070  * else return <0 if waitpid errors out (e.g. ECHILD: nothing to wait for)
9071  * or 0 if no children changed status.
9072  *
9073  * Alternatively (fg_pipe == NULL, waitfor_pid == 0),
9074  * return <0 if waitpid errors out (e.g. ECHILD: nothing to wait for)
9075  * or 0 if no children changed status.
9076  */
9077 static int checkjobs(struct pipe *fg_pipe, pid_t waitfor_pid)
9078 {
9079  int attributes;
9080  int status;
9081  int rcode = 0;
9082 
9083  debug_printf_jobs("checkjobs %p\n", fg_pipe);
9084 
9085  attributes = WUNTRACED;
9086  if (fg_pipe == NULL)
9087  attributes |= WNOHANG;
9088 
9089  errno = 0;
9090 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
9091  if (G.handled_SIGCHLD == G.count_SIGCHLD) {
9092 //bb_error_msg("[%d] checkjobs: G.count_SIGCHLD:%d G.handled_SIGCHLD:%d children?:%d fg_pipe:%p",
9093 //getpid(), G.count_SIGCHLD, G.handled_SIGCHLD, G.we_have_children, fg_pipe);
9094  /* There was neither fork nor SIGCHLD since last waitpid */
9095  /* Avoid doing waitpid syscall if possible */
9096  if (!G.we_have_children) {
9097  errno = ECHILD;
9098  return -1;
9099  }
9100  if (fg_pipe == NULL) { /* is WNOHANG set? */
9101  /* We have children, but they did not exit
9102  * or stop yet (we saw no SIGCHLD) */
9103  return 0;
9104  }
9105  /* else: !WNOHANG, waitpid will block, can't short-circuit */
9106  }
9107 #endif
9108 
9109 /* Do we do this right?
9110  * bash-3.00# sleep 20 | false
9111  * <ctrl-Z pressed>
9112  * [3]+ Stopped sleep 20 | false
9113  * bash-3.00# echo $?
9114  * 1 <========== bg pipe is not fully done, but exitcode is already known!
9115  * [hush 1.14.0: yes we do it right]
9116  */
9117  while (1) {
9118  pid_t childpid;
9119 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
9120  int i;
9121  i = G.count_SIGCHLD;
9122 #endif
9123  childpid = waitpid(-1, &status, attributes);
9124  if (childpid <= 0) {
9125  if (childpid && errno != ECHILD)
9126  bb_simple_perror_msg("waitpid");
9127 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
9128  else { /* Until next SIGCHLD, waitpid's are useless */
9129  G.we_have_children = (childpid == 0);
9130  G.handled_SIGCHLD = i;
9131 //bb_error_msg("[%d] checkjobs: waitpid returned <= 0, G.count_SIGCHLD:%d G.handled_SIGCHLD:%d", getpid(), G.count_SIGCHLD, G.handled_SIGCHLD);
9132  }
9133 #endif
9134  /* ECHILD (no children), or 0 (no change in children status) */
9135  rcode = childpid;
9136  break;
9137  }
9138  rcode = process_wait_result(fg_pipe, childpid, status);
9139  if (rcode >= 0) {
9140  /* fg_pipe exited or stopped */
9141  break;
9142  }
9143  if (childpid == waitfor_pid) { /* "wait PID" */
9144  debug_printf_exec("childpid==waitfor_pid:%d status:0x%08x\n", childpid, status);
9145  rcode = WEXITSTATUS(status);
9146  if (WIFSIGNALED(status))
9147  rcode = 128 | WTERMSIG(status);
9148  if (WIFSTOPPED(status))
9149  /* bash: "cmd & wait $!" and cmd stops: $? = 128 | stopsig */
9150  rcode = 128 | WSTOPSIG(status);
9151  rcode++;
9152  break; /* "wait PID" called us, give it exitcode+1 */
9153  }
9154 #if ENABLE_HUSH_BASH_COMPAT
9155  if (-1 == waitfor_pid /* "wait -n" (wait for any one job) */
9156  && G.dead_job_exitcode >= 0 /* some job did finish */
9157  ) {
9158  debug_printf_exec("waitfor_pid:-1\n");
9159  rcode = G.dead_job_exitcode + 1;
9160  break;
9161  }
9162 #endif
9163  /* This wasn't one of our processes, or */
9164  /* fg_pipe still has running processes, do waitpid again */
9165  } /* while (waitpid succeeds)... */
9166 
9167  return rcode;
9168 }
9169 
9170 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9171 static int checkjobs_and_fg_shell(struct pipe *fg_pipe)
9172 {
9173  pid_t p;
9174  int rcode = checkjobs(fg_pipe, 0 /*(no pid to wait for)*/);
9175  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp) {
9176  /* Job finished, move the shell to the foreground */
9177  p = getpgrp(); /* our process group id */
9178  debug_printf_jobs("fg'ing ourself: getpgrp()=%d\n", (int)p);
9179  tcsetpgrp(G_interactive_fd, p);
9180  }
9181  return rcode;
9182 }
9183 #endif
9184 
9185 /* Start all the jobs, but don't wait for anything to finish.
9186  * See checkjobs().
9187  *
9188  * Return code is normally -1, when the caller has to wait for children
9189  * to finish to determine the exit status of the pipe. If the pipe
9190  * is a simple builtin command, however, the action is done by the
9191  * time run_pipe returns, and the exit code is provided as the
9192  * return value.
9193  *
9194  * Returns -1 only if started some children. IOW: we have to
9195  * mask out retvals of builtins etc with 0xff!
9196  *
9197  * The only case when we do not need to [v]fork is when the pipe
9198  * is single, non-backgrounded, non-subshell command. Examples:
9199  * cmd ; ... { list } ; ...
9200  * cmd && ... { list } && ...
9201  * cmd || ... { list } || ...
9202  * If it is, then we can run cmd as a builtin, NOFORK,
9203  * or (if SH_STANDALONE) an applet, and we can run the { list }
9204  * with run_list. If it isn't one of these, we fork and exec cmd.
9205  *
9206  * Cases when we must fork:
9207  * non-single: cmd | cmd
9208  * backgrounded: cmd & { list } &
9209  * subshell: ( list ) [&]
9210  */
9211 #if !ENABLE_HUSH_MODE_X
9212 #define redirect_and_varexp_helper(command, sqp, argv_expanded) \
9213  redirect_and_varexp_helper(command, sqp)
9214 #endif
9215 static int redirect_and_varexp_helper(
9216  struct command *command,
9217  struct squirrel **sqp,
9218  char **argv_expanded)
9219 {
9220  /* Assignments occur before redirects. Try:
9221  * a=`sleep 1` sleep 2 3>/qwe/rty
9222  */
9223 
9224  char **new_env = expand_assignments(command->argv, command->assignment_cnt);
9225  dump_cmd_in_x_mode(new_env);
9226  dump_cmd_in_x_mode(argv_expanded);
9227  /* this takes ownership of new_env[i] elements, and frees new_env: */
9228  set_vars_and_save_old(new_env);
9229 
9230  return setup_redirects(command, sqp);
9231 }
9232 static NOINLINE int run_pipe(struct pipe *pi)
9233 {
9234  static const char *const null_ptr = NULL;
9235 
9236  int cmd_no;
9237  int next_infd;
9238  struct command *command;
9239  char **argv_expanded;
9240  char **argv;
9241  struct squirrel *squirrel = NULL;
9242  int rcode;
9243 
9244  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe start: members:%d\n", pi->num_cmds);
9245  debug_enter();
9246 
9247  /* Testcase: set -- q w e; (IFS='' echo "$*"; IFS=''; echo "$*"); echo "$*"
9248  * Result should be 3 lines: q w e, qwe, q w e
9249  */
9250  if (G.ifs_whitespace != G.ifs)
9251  free(G.ifs_whitespace);
9252  G.ifs = get_local_var_value("IFS");
9253  if (G.ifs) {
9254  char *p;
9255  G.ifs_whitespace = (char*)G.ifs;
9256  p = skip_whitespace(G.ifs);
9257  if (*p) {
9258  /* Not all $IFS is whitespace */
9259  char *d;
9260  int len = p - G.ifs;
9261  p = skip_non_whitespace(p);
9262  G.ifs_whitespace = xmalloc(len + strlen(p) + 1); /* can overestimate */
9263  d = mempcpy(G.ifs_whitespace, G.ifs, len);
9264  while (*p) {
9265  if (isspace(*p))
9266  *d++ = *p;
9267  p++;
9268  }
9269  *d = '\0';
9270  }
9271  } else {
9272  G.ifs = defifs;
9273  G.ifs_whitespace = (char*)G.ifs;
9274  }
9275 
9276  IF_HUSH_JOB(pi->pgrp = -1;)
9277  pi->stopped_cmds = 0;
9278  command = &pi->cmds[0];
9279  argv_expanded = NULL;
9280 
9281  if (pi->num_cmds != 1
9282  || pi->followup == PIPE_BG
9283  || command->cmd_type == CMD_SUBSHELL
9284  ) {
9285  goto must_fork;
9286  }
9287 
9288  pi->alive_cmds = 1;
9289 
9290  debug_printf_exec(": group:%p argv:'%s'\n",
9291  command->group, command->argv ? command->argv[0] : "NONE");
9292 
9293  if (command->group) {
9294 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
9295  if (command->cmd_type == CMD_FUNCDEF) {
9296  /* "executing" func () { list } */
9297  struct function *funcp;
9298 
9299  funcp = new_function(command->argv[0]);
9300  /* funcp->name is already set to argv[0] */
9301  funcp->body = command->group;
9302 # if !BB_MMU
9303  funcp->body_as_string = command->group_as_string;
9304  command->group_as_string = NULL;
9305 # endif
9306  command->group = NULL;
9307  command->argv[0] = NULL;
9308  debug_printf_exec("cmd %p has child func at %p\n", command, funcp);
9309  funcp->parent_cmd = command;
9310  command->child_func = funcp;
9311 
9312  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe: return EXIT_SUCCESS\n");
9313  debug_leave();
9314  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
9315  }
9316 #endif
9317  /* { list } */
9318  debug_printf_exec("non-subshell group\n");
9319  rcode = 1; /* exitcode if redir failed */
9320  if (setup_redirects(command, &squirrel) == 0) {
9321  debug_printf_exec(": run_list\n");
9322 //FIXME: we need to pass squirrel down into run_list()
9323 //for SH_STANDALONE case, or else this construct:
9324 // { find /proc/self/fd; true; } >FILE; cmd2
9325 //has no way of closing saved fd#1 for "find",
9326 //and in SH_STANDALONE mode, "find" is not execed,
9327 //therefore CLOEXEC on saved fd does not help.
9328  rcode = run_list(command->group) & 0xff;
9329  }
9330  restore_redirects(squirrel);
9331  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(if (pi->pi_inverted) rcode = !rcode;)
9332  debug_leave();
9333  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe: return %d\n", rcode);
9334  return rcode;
9335  }
9336 
9337  argv = command->argv ? command->argv : (char **) &null_ptr;
9338  {
9339  const struct built_in_command *x;
9340  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(const struct function *funcp;)
9341  IF_NOT_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(enum { funcp = 0 };)
9342  struct variable **sv_shadowed;
9343  struct variable *old_vars;
9344 
9345 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
9346  G.execute_lineno = command->lineno;
9347 #endif
9348 
9349  if (argv[command->assignment_cnt] == NULL) {
9350  /* Assignments, but no command.
9351  * Ensure redirects take effect (that is, create files).
9352  * Try "a=t >file"
9353  */
9354  unsigned i;
9355  G.expand_exitcode = 0;
9356  only_assignments:
9357  rcode = setup_redirects(command, &squirrel);
9358  restore_redirects(squirrel);
9359 
9360  /* Set shell variables */
9361  i = 0;
9362  while (i < command->assignment_cnt) {
9363  char *p = expand_string_to_string(argv[i],
9364  EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS,
9365  /*unbackslash:*/ 1
9366  );
9367 #if ENABLE_HUSH_MODE_X
9368  if (G_x_mode) {
9369  char *eq;
9370  if (i == 0)
9371  x_mode_prefix();
9372  x_mode_addchr(' ');
9373  eq = strchrnul(p, '=');
9374  if (*eq) eq++;
9375  x_mode_addblock(p, (eq - p));
9376  x_mode_print_optionally_squoted(eq);
9377  x_mode_flush();
9378  }
9379 #endif
9380  debug_printf_env("set shell var:'%s'->'%s'\n", *argv, p);
9381  if (set_local_var0(p)) {
9382  /* assignment to readonly var / putenv error? */
9383  rcode = 1;
9384  }
9385  i++;
9386  }
9387  /* Redirect error sets $? to 1. Otherwise,
9388  * if evaluating assignment value set $?, retain it.
9389  * Else, clear $?:
9390  * false; q=`exit 2`; echo $? - should print 2
9391  * false; x=1; echo $? - should print 0
9392  * Because of the 2nd case, we can't just use G.last_exitcode.
9393  */
9394  if (rcode == 0)
9395  rcode = G.expand_exitcode;
9396  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(if (pi->pi_inverted) rcode = !rcode;)
9397  debug_leave();
9398  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe: return %d\n", rcode);
9399  return rcode;
9400  }
9401 
9402  /* Expand the rest into (possibly) many strings each */
9403 #if defined(CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
9404  if (command->cmd_type == CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
9405  argv_expanded = expand_strvec_to_strvec_singleword_noglob(argv + command->assignment_cnt);
9406  else
9407 #endif
9408 #if defined(CMD_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
9409  if (command->cmd_type == CMD_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
9410  argv_expanded = expand_strvec_to_strvec_singleword_noglob(argv + command->assignment_cnt);
9411  else
9412 #endif
9413  argv_expanded = expand_strvec_to_strvec(argv + command->assignment_cnt);
9414 
9415  /* If someone gives us an empty string: `cmd with empty output` */
9416  if (!argv_expanded[0]) {
9417  free(argv_expanded);
9418  /* `false` still has to set exitcode 1 */
9419  G.expand_exitcode = G.last_exitcode;
9420  goto only_assignments;
9421  }
9422 
9423  old_vars = NULL;
9424  sv_shadowed = G.shadowed_vars_pp;
9425 
9426  /* Check if argv[0] matches any functions (this goes before bltins) */
9427  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(funcp = find_function(argv_expanded[0]);)
9428  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(x = NULL;)
9429  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(if (!funcp))
9430  x = find_builtin(argv_expanded[0]);
9431  if (x || funcp) {
9432  if (x && x->b_function == builtin_exec && argv_expanded[1] == NULL) {
9433  debug_printf("exec with redirects only\n");
9434  /*
9435  * Variable assignments are executed, but then "forgotten":
9436  * a=`sleep 1;echo A` exec 3>&-; echo $a
9437  * sleeps, but prints nothing.
9438  */
9439  enter_var_nest_level();
9440  G.shadowed_vars_pp = &old_vars;
9441  rcode = redirect_and_varexp_helper(command,
9442  /*squirrel:*/ ERR_PTR,
9443  argv_expanded
9444  );
9445  G.shadowed_vars_pp = sv_shadowed;
9446  /* rcode=1 can be if redir file can't be opened */
9447 
9448  goto clean_up_and_ret1;
9449  }
9450 
9451  /* Bump var nesting, or this will leak exported $a:
9452  * a=b true; env | grep ^a=
9453  */
9454  enter_var_nest_level();
9455  /* Collect all variables "shadowed" by helper
9456  * (IOW: old vars overridden by "var1=val1 var2=val2 cmd..." syntax)
9457  * into old_vars list:
9458  */
9459  G.shadowed_vars_pp = &old_vars;
9460  rcode = redirect_and_varexp_helper(command, &squirrel, argv_expanded);
9461  if (rcode == 0) {
9462  if (!funcp) {
9463  /* Do not collect *to old_vars list* vars shadowed
9464  * by e.g. "local VAR" builtin (collect them
9465  * in the previously nested list instead):
9466  * don't want them to be restored immediately
9467  * after "local" completes.
9468  */
9469  G.shadowed_vars_pp = sv_shadowed;
9470 
9471  debug_printf_exec(": builtin '%s' '%s'...\n",
9472  x->b_cmd, argv_expanded[1]);
9473  fflush_all();
9474  rcode = x->b_function(argv_expanded) & 0xff;
9475  fflush_all();
9476  }
9477 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
9478  else {
9479  debug_printf_exec(": function '%s' '%s'...\n",
9480  funcp->name, argv_expanded[1]);
9481  rcode = run_function(funcp, argv_expanded) & 0xff;
9482  /*
9483  * But do collect *to old_vars list* vars shadowed
9484  * within function execution. To that end, restore
9485  * this pointer _after_ function run:
9486  */
9487  G.shadowed_vars_pp = sv_shadowed;
9488  }
9489 #endif
9490  }
9491  } else
9492  if (ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_NOFORK && NUM_APPLETS > 1) {
9493  int n = find_applet_by_name(argv_expanded[0]);
9494  if (n < 0 || !APPLET_IS_NOFORK(n))
9495  goto must_fork;
9496 
9497  enter_var_nest_level();
9498  /* Collect all variables "shadowed" by helper into old_vars list */
9499  G.shadowed_vars_pp = &old_vars;
9500  rcode = redirect_and_varexp_helper(command, &squirrel, argv_expanded);
9501  G.shadowed_vars_pp = sv_shadowed;
9502 
9503  if (rcode == 0) {
9504  debug_printf_exec(": run_nofork_applet '%s' '%s'...\n",
9505  argv_expanded[0], argv_expanded[1]);
9506  /*
9507  * Note: signals (^C) can't interrupt here.
9508  * We remember them and they will be acted upon
9509  * after applet returns.
9510  * This makes applets which can run for a long time
9511  * and/or wait for user input ineligible for NOFORK:
9512  * for example, "yes" or "rm" (rm -i waits for input).
9513  */
9514  rcode = run_nofork_applet(n, argv_expanded);
9515  }
9516  } else
9517  goto must_fork;
9518 
9519  restore_redirects(squirrel);
9520  clean_up_and_ret1:
9521  leave_var_nest_level();
9522  add_vars(old_vars);
9523 
9524  /*
9525  * Try "usleep 99999999" + ^C + "echo $?"
9526  * with FEATURE_SH_NOFORK=y.
9527  */
9528  if (!funcp) {
9529  /* It was builtin or nofork.
9530  * if this would be a real fork/execed program,
9531  * it should have died if a fatal sig was received.
9532  * But OTOH, there was no separate process,
9533  * the sig was sent to _shell_, not to non-existing
9534  * child.
9535  * Let's just handle ^C only, this one is obvious:
9536  * we aren't ok with exitcode 0 when ^C was pressed
9537  * during builtin/nofork.
9538  */
9539  if (sigismember(&G.pending_set, SIGINT))
9540  rcode = 128 | SIGINT;
9541  }
9542  free(argv_expanded);
9543  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(if (pi->pi_inverted) rcode = !rcode;)
9544  debug_leave();
9545  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe return %d\n", rcode);
9546  return rcode;
9547  }
9548 
9549  must_fork:
9550  /* NB: argv_expanded may already be created, and that
9551  * might include `cmd` runs! Do not rerun it! We *must*
9552  * use argv_expanded if it's non-NULL */
9553 
9554  /* Going to fork a child per each pipe member */
9555  pi->alive_cmds = 0;
9556  next_infd = 0;
9557 
9558  cmd_no = 0;
9559  while (cmd_no < pi->num_cmds) {
9560  struct fd_pair pipefds;
9561 #if !BB_MMU
9562  int sv_var_nest_level = G.var_nest_level;
9563  volatile nommu_save_t nommu_save;
9564  nommu_save.old_vars = NULL;
9565  nommu_save.argv = NULL;
9566  nommu_save.argv_from_re_execing = NULL;
9567 #endif
9568  command = &pi->cmds[cmd_no];
9569  cmd_no++;
9570  if (command->argv) {
9571  debug_printf_exec(": pipe member '%s' '%s'...\n",
9572  command->argv[0], command->argv[1]);
9573  } else {
9574  debug_printf_exec(": pipe member with no argv\n");
9575  }
9576 
9577  /* pipes are inserted between pairs of commands */
9578  pipefds.rd = 0;
9579  pipefds.wr = 1;
9580  if (cmd_no < pi->num_cmds)
9581  xpiped_pair(pipefds);
9582 
9583 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
9584  G.execute_lineno = command->lineno;
9585 #endif
9586 
9587  command->pid = BB_MMU ? fork() : vfork();
9588  if (!command->pid) { /* child */
9589 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9590  disable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
9591  CLEAR_RANDOM_T(&G.random_gen); /* or else $RANDOM repeats in child */
9592 
9593  /* Every child adds itself to new process group
9594  * with pgid == pid_of_first_child_in_pipe */
9595  if (G.run_list_level == 1 && G_interactive_fd) {
9596  pid_t pgrp;
9597  pgrp = pi->pgrp;
9598  if (pgrp < 0) /* true for 1st process only */
9599  pgrp = getpid();
9600  if (setpgid(0, pgrp) == 0
9601  && pi->followup != PIPE_BG
9602  && G_saved_tty_pgrp /* we have ctty */
9603  ) {
9604  /* We do it in *every* child, not just first,
9605  * to avoid races */
9606  tcsetpgrp(G_interactive_fd, pgrp);
9607  }
9608  }
9609 #endif
9610  if (pi->alive_cmds == 0 && pi->followup == PIPE_BG) {
9611  /* 1st cmd in backgrounded pipe
9612  * should have its stdin /dev/null'ed */
9613  close(0);
9614  if (open(bb_dev_null, O_RDONLY))
9615  xopen("/", O_RDONLY);
9616  } else {
9617  xmove_fd(next_infd, 0);
9618  }
9619  xmove_fd(pipefds.wr, 1);
9620  if (pipefds.rd > 1)
9621  close(pipefds.rd);
9622  /* Like bash, explicit redirects override pipes,
9623  * and the pipe fd (fd#1) is available for dup'ing:
9624  * "cmd1 2>&1 | cmd2": fd#1 is duped to fd#2, thus stderr
9625  * of cmd1 goes into pipe.
9626  */
9627  if (setup_redirects(command, NULL)) {
9628  /* Happens when redir file can't be opened:
9629  * $ hush -c 'echo FOO >&2 | echo BAR 3>/qwe/rty; echo BAZ'
9630  * FOO
9631  * hush: can't open '/qwe/rty': No such file or directory
9632  * BAZ
9633  * (echo BAR is not executed, it hits _exit(1) below)
9634  */
9635  _exit(1);
9636  }
9637 
9638  /* Stores to nommu_save list of env vars putenv'ed
9639  * (NOMMU, on MMU we don't need that) */
9640  /* cast away volatility... */
9641  pseudo_exec((nommu_save_t*) &nommu_save, command, argv_expanded);
9642  /* pseudo_exec() does not return */
9643  }
9644 
9645  /* parent or error */
9646 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
9647  G.count_SIGCHLD++;
9648 //bb_error_msg("[%d] fork in run_pipe: G.count_SIGCHLD:%d G.handled_SIGCHLD:%d", getpid(), G.count_SIGCHLD, G.handled_SIGCHLD);
9649 #endif
9650  enable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
9651 #if !BB_MMU
9652  /* Clean up after vforked child */
9653  free(nommu_save.argv);
9654  free(nommu_save.argv_from_re_execing);
9655  G.var_nest_level = sv_var_nest_level;
9656  remove_nested_vars();
9657  add_vars(nommu_save.old_vars);
9658 #endif
9659  free(argv_expanded);
9660  argv_expanded = NULL;
9661  if (command->pid < 0) { /* [v]fork failed */
9662  /* Clearly indicate, was it fork or vfork */
9663  bb_simple_perror_msg(BB_MMU ? "vfork"+1 : "vfork");
9664  } else {
9665  pi->alive_cmds++;
9666 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9667  /* Second and next children need to know pid of first one */
9668  if (pi->pgrp < 0)
9669  pi->pgrp = command->pid;
9670 #endif
9671  }
9672 
9673  if (cmd_no > 1)
9674  close(next_infd);
9675  if (cmd_no < pi->num_cmds)
9676  close(pipefds.wr);
9677  /* Pass read (output) pipe end to next iteration */
9678  next_infd = pipefds.rd;
9679  }
9680 
9681  if (!pi->alive_cmds) {
9682  debug_leave();
9683  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe return 1 (all forks failed, no children)\n");
9684  return 1;
9685  }
9686 
9687  debug_leave();
9688  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe return -1 (%u children started)\n", pi->alive_cmds);
9689  return -1;
9690 }
9691 
9692 /* NB: called by pseudo_exec, and therefore must not modify any
9693  * global data until exec/_exit (we can be a child after vfork!) */
9694 static int run_list(struct pipe *pi)
9695 {
9696 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
9697  char *case_word = NULL;
9698 #endif
9699 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9700  struct pipe *loop_top = NULL;
9701  char **for_lcur = NULL;
9702  char **for_list = NULL;
9703 #endif
9704  smallint last_followup;
9705  smalluint rcode;
9706 #if ENABLE_HUSH_IF || ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
9707  smalluint cond_code = 0;
9708 #else
9709  enum { cond_code = 0 };
9710 #endif
9711 #if HAS_KEYWORDS
9712  smallint rword; /* RES_foo */
9713  smallint last_rword; /* ditto */
9714 #endif
9715 
9716  debug_printf_exec("run_list start lvl %d\n", G.run_list_level);
9717  debug_enter();
9718 
9719 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9720  /* Check syntax for "for" */
9721  {
9722  struct pipe *cpipe;
9723  for (cpipe = pi; cpipe; cpipe = cpipe->next) {
9724  if (cpipe->res_word != RES_FOR && cpipe->res_word != RES_IN)
9725  continue;
9726  /* current word is FOR or IN (BOLD in comments below) */
9727  if (cpipe->next == NULL) {
9728  syntax_error("malformed for");
9729  debug_leave();
9730  debug_printf_exec("run_list lvl %d return 1\n", G.run_list_level);
9731  return 1;
9732  }
9733  /* "FOR v; do ..." and "for v IN a b; do..." are ok */
9734  if (cpipe->next->res_word == RES_DO)
9735  continue;
9736  /* next word is not "do". It must be "in" then ("FOR v in ...") */
9737  if (cpipe->res_word == RES_IN /* "for v IN a b; not_do..."? */
9738  || cpipe->next->res_word != RES_IN /* FOR v not_do_and_not_in..."? */
9739  ) {
9740  syntax_error("malformed for");
9741  debug_leave();
9742  debug_printf_exec("run_list lvl %d return 1\n", G.run_list_level);
9743  return 1;
9744  }
9745  }
9746  }
9747 #endif
9748 
9749  /* Past this point, all code paths should jump to ret: label
9750  * in order to return, no direct "return" statements please.
9751  * This helps to ensure that no memory is leaked. */
9752 
9753 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9754  G.run_list_level++;
9755 #endif
9756 
9757 #if HAS_KEYWORDS
9758  rword = RES_NONE;
9759  last_rword = RES_XXXX;
9760 #endif
9761  last_followup = PIPE_SEQ;
9762  rcode = G.last_exitcode;
9763 
9764  /* Go through list of pipes, (maybe) executing them. */
9765  for (; pi; pi = IF_HUSH_LOOPS(rword == RES_DONE ? loop_top : ) pi->next) {
9766  int r;
9767  int sv_errexit_depth;
9768 
9769  if (G.flag_SIGINT)
9770  break;
9771  if (G_flag_return_in_progress == 1)
9772  break;
9773 
9774  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(rword = pi->res_word;)
9775  debug_printf_exec(": rword=%d cond_code=%d last_rword=%d\n",
9776  rword, cond_code, last_rword);
9777 
9778  sv_errexit_depth = G.errexit_depth;
9779  if (
9780 #if ENABLE_HUSH_IF
9781  rword == RES_IF || rword == RES_ELIF ||
9782 #endif
9783  pi->followup != PIPE_SEQ
9784  ) {
9785  G.errexit_depth++;
9786  }
9787 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9788  if ((rword == RES_WHILE || rword == RES_UNTIL || rword == RES_FOR)
9789  && loop_top == NULL /* avoid bumping G.depth_of_loop twice */
9790  ) {
9791  /* start of a loop: remember where loop starts */
9792  loop_top = pi;
9793  G.depth_of_loop++;
9794  }
9795 #endif
9796  /* Still in the same "if...", "then..." or "do..." branch? */
9797  if (IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(rword == last_rword &&) 1) {
9798  if ((rcode == 0 && last_followup == PIPE_OR)
9799  || (rcode != 0 && last_followup == PIPE_AND)
9800  ) {
9801  /* It is "<true> || CMD" or "<false> && CMD"
9802  * and we should not execute CMD */
9803  debug_printf_exec("skipped cmd because of || or &&\n");
9804  last_followup = pi->followup;
9805  goto dont_check_jobs_but_continue;
9806  }
9807  }
9808  last_followup = pi->followup;
9809  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(last_rword = rword;)
9810 #if ENABLE_HUSH_IF
9811  if (cond_code) {
9812  if (rword == RES_THEN) {
9813  /* if false; then ... fi has exitcode 0! */
9814  G.last_exitcode = rcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
9815  /* "if <false> THEN cmd": skip cmd */
9816  continue;
9817  }
9818  } else {
9819  if (rword == RES_ELSE || rword == RES_ELIF) {
9820  /* "if <true> then ... ELSE/ELIF cmd":
9821  * skip cmd and all following ones */
9822  break;
9823  }
9824  }
9825 #endif
9826 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9827  if (rword == RES_FOR) { /* && pi->num_cmds - always == 1 */
9828  if (!for_lcur) {
9829  /* first loop through for */
9830 
9831  static const char encoded_dollar_at[] ALIGN1 = {
9832  SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL, '@' | 0x80, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL, '\0'
9833  }; /* encoded representation of "$@" */
9834  static const char *const encoded_dollar_at_argv[] ALIGN_PTR = {
9835  encoded_dollar_at, NULL
9836  }; /* argv list with one element: "$@" */
9837  char **vals;
9838 
9839  G.last_exitcode = rcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
9840  vals = (char**)encoded_dollar_at_argv;
9841  if (pi->next->res_word == RES_IN) {
9842  /* if no variable values after "in" we skip "for" */
9843  if (!pi->next->cmds[0].argv) {
9844  debug_printf_exec(": null FOR: exitcode EXIT_SUCCESS\n");
9845  break;
9846  }
9847  vals = pi->next->cmds[0].argv;
9848  } /* else: "for var; do..." -> assume "$@" list */
9849  /* create list of variable values */
9850  debug_print_strings("for_list made from", vals);
9851  for_list = expand_strvec_to_strvec(vals);
9852  for_lcur = for_list;
9853  debug_print_strings("for_list", for_list);
9854  }
9855  if (!*for_lcur) {
9856  /* "for" loop is over, clean up */
9857  free(for_list);
9858  for_list = NULL;
9859  for_lcur = NULL;
9860  break;
9861  }
9862  /* Insert next value from for_lcur */
9863  /* note: *for_lcur already has quotes removed, $var expanded, etc */
9864  set_local_var_from_halves(pi->cmds[0].argv[0], *for_lcur++);
9865  continue;
9866  }
9867  if (rword == RES_IN) {
9868  continue; /* "for v IN list;..." - "in" has no cmds anyway */
9869  }
9870  if (rword == RES_DONE) {
9871  continue; /* "done" has no cmds too */
9872  }
9873 #endif
9874 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
9875  if (rword == RES_CASE) {
9876  debug_printf_exec("CASE cond_code:%d\n", cond_code);
9877  case_word = expand_string_to_string(pi->cmds->argv[0],
9878  EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS, /*unbackslash:*/ 1);
9879  debug_printf_exec("CASE word1:'%s'\n", case_word);
9880  //unbackslash(case_word);
9881  //debug_printf_exec("CASE word2:'%s'\n", case_word);
9882  continue;
9883  }
9884  if (rword == RES_MATCH) {
9885  char **argv;
9886 
9887  debug_printf_exec("MATCH cond_code:%d\n", cond_code);
9888  if (!case_word) /* "case ... matched_word) ... WORD)": we executed selected branch, stop */
9889  break;
9890  /* all prev words didn't match, does this one match? */
9891  argv = pi->cmds->argv;
9892  while (*argv) {
9893  char *pattern;
9894  debug_printf_exec("expand_string_to_string('%s')\n", *argv);
9895  pattern = expand_string_to_string(*argv,
9896  EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS,
9897  /*unbackslash:*/ 0
9898  );
9899  /* TODO: which FNM_xxx flags to use? */
9900  cond_code = (fnmatch(pattern, case_word, /*flags:*/ 0) != 0);
9901  debug_printf_exec("fnmatch(pattern:'%s',str:'%s'):%d\n",
9902  pattern, case_word, cond_code);
9903  free(pattern);
9904  if (cond_code == 0) {
9905  /* match! we will execute this branch */
9906  free(case_word);
9907  case_word = NULL; /* make future "word)" stop */
9908  break;
9909  }
9910  argv++;
9911  }
9912  continue;
9913  }
9914  if (rword == RES_CASE_BODY) { /* inside of a case branch */
9915  debug_printf_exec("CASE_BODY cond_code:%d\n", cond_code);
9916  if (cond_code != 0)
9917  continue; /* not matched yet, skip this pipe */
9918  }
9919  if (rword == RES_ESAC) {
9920  debug_printf_exec("ESAC cond_code:%d\n", cond_code);
9921  if (case_word) {
9922  /* "case" did not match anything: still set $? (to 0) */
9923  G.last_exitcode = rcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
9924  }
9925  }
9926 #endif
9927  /* Just pressing <enter> in shell should check for jobs.
9928  * OTOH, in non-interactive shell this is useless
9929  * and only leads to extra job checks */
9930  if (pi->num_cmds == 0) {
9931  if (G_interactive_fd)
9932  goto check_jobs_and_continue;
9933  continue;
9934  }
9935 
9936  /* After analyzing all keywords and conditions, we decided
9937  * to execute this pipe. NB: have to do checkjobs(NULL)
9938  * after run_pipe to collect any background children,
9939  * even if list execution is to be stopped. */
9940  debug_printf_exec(": run_pipe with %d members\n", pi->num_cmds);
9941 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9942  G.flag_break_continue = 0;
9943 #endif
9944  rcode = r = G.o_opt[OPT_O_NOEXEC] ? 0 : run_pipe(pi);
9945  /* NB: rcode is a smalluint, r is int */
9946  if (r != -1) {
9947  /* We ran a builtin, function, or group.
9948  * rcode is already known
9949  * and we don't need to wait for anything. */
9950  debug_printf_exec(": builtin/func exitcode %d\n", rcode);
9951  G.last_exitcode = rcode;
9952  check_and_run_traps();
9953 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP && ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
9954  rcode = G.last_exitcode; /* "return" in trap can change it, read back */
9955 #endif
9956 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9957  /* Was it "break" or "continue"? */
9958  if (G.flag_break_continue) {
9959  smallint fbc = G.flag_break_continue;
9960  /* We might fall into outer *loop*,
9961  * don't want to break it too */
9962  if (loop_top) {
9963  G.depth_break_continue--;
9964  if (G.depth_break_continue == 0)
9965  G.flag_break_continue = 0;
9966  /* else: e.g. "continue 2" should *break* once, *then* continue */
9967  } /* else: "while... do... { we are here (innermost list is not a loop!) };...done" */
9968  if (G.depth_break_continue != 0 || fbc == BC_BREAK) {
9969  checkjobs(NULL, 0 /*(no pid to wait for)*/);
9970  break;
9971  }
9972  /* "continue": simulate end of loop */
9973  rword = RES_DONE;
9974  continue;
9975  }
9976 #endif
9977  if (G_flag_return_in_progress == 1) {
9978  checkjobs(NULL, 0 /*(no pid to wait for)*/);
9979  break;
9980  }
9981  } else if (pi->followup == PIPE_BG) {
9982  /* What does bash do with attempts to background builtins? */
9983  /* even bash 3.2 doesn't do that well with nested bg:
9984  * try "{ { sleep 10; echo DEEP; } & echo HERE; } &".
9985  * I'm NOT treating inner &'s as jobs */
9986 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9987  if (G.run_list_level == 1)
9988  insert_job_into_table(pi);
9989 #endif
9990  /* Last command's pid goes to $! */
9991  G.last_bg_pid = pi->cmds[pi->num_cmds - 1].pid;
