9992  G.last_bg_pid_exitcode = 0;
9993  debug_printf_exec(": cmd&: exitcode EXIT_SUCCESS\n");
9994 /* Check pi->pi_inverted? "! sleep 1 & echo $?": bash says 1. dash and ash say 0 */
9995  rcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
9996  goto check_traps;
9997  } else {
9998 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9999  if (G.run_list_level == 1 && G_interactive_fd) {
10000  /* Waits for completion, then fg's main shell */
10001  rcode = checkjobs_and_fg_shell(pi);
10002  debug_printf_exec(": checkjobs_and_fg_shell exitcode %d\n", rcode);
10003  goto check_traps;
10004  }
10005 #endif
10006  /* This one just waits for completion */
10007  rcode = checkjobs(pi, 0 /*(no pid to wait for)*/);
10008  debug_printf_exec(": checkjobs exitcode %d\n", rcode);
10009  check_traps:
10010  G.last_exitcode = rcode;
10011  check_and_run_traps();
10012 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP && ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
10013  rcode = G.last_exitcode; /* "return" in trap can change it, read back */
10014 #endif
10015  }
10016 
10017  /* Handle "set -e" */
10018  if (rcode != 0 && G.o_opt[OPT_O_ERREXIT]) {
10019  debug_printf_exec("ERREXIT:1 errexit_depth:%d\n", G.errexit_depth);
10020  if (G.errexit_depth == 0)
10021  hush_exit(rcode);
10022  }
10023  G.errexit_depth = sv_errexit_depth;
10024 
10025  /* Analyze how result affects subsequent commands */
10026 #if ENABLE_HUSH_IF
10027  if (rword == RES_IF || rword == RES_ELIF)
10028  cond_code = rcode;
10029 #endif
10030  check_jobs_and_continue:
10031  checkjobs(NULL, 0 /*(no pid to wait for)*/);
10032  dont_check_jobs_but_continue: ;
10033 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
10034  /* Beware of "while false; true; do ..."! */
10035  if (pi->next
10036  && (pi->next->res_word == RES_DO || pi->next->res_word == RES_DONE)
10037  /* check for RES_DONE is needed for "while ...; do \n done" case */
10038  ) {
10039  if (rword == RES_WHILE) {
10040  if (rcode) {
10041  /* "while false; do...done" - exitcode 0 */
10042  G.last_exitcode = rcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
10043  debug_printf_exec(": while expr is false: breaking (exitcode:EXIT_SUCCESS)\n");
10044  break;
10045  }
10046  }
10047  if (rword == RES_UNTIL) {
10048  if (!rcode) {
10049  debug_printf_exec(": until expr is true: breaking\n");
10050  break;
10051  }
10052  }
10053  }
10054 #endif
10055  } /* for (pi) */
10056 
10057 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
10058  G.run_list_level--;
10059 #endif
10060 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
10061  if (loop_top)
10062  G.depth_of_loop--;
10063  free(for_list);
10064 #endif
10065 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
10066  free(case_word);
10067 #endif
10068  debug_leave();
10069  debug_printf_exec("run_list lvl %d return %d\n", G.run_list_level + 1, rcode);
10070  return rcode;
10071 }
10072 
10073 /* Select which version we will use */
10074 static int run_and_free_list(struct pipe *pi)
10075 {
10076  int rcode = 0;
10077  debug_printf_exec("run_and_free_list entered\n");
10078  if (!G.o_opt[OPT_O_NOEXEC]) {
10079  debug_printf_exec(": run_list: 1st pipe with %d cmds\n", pi->num_cmds);
10080  rcode = run_list(pi);
10081  }
10082  /* free_pipe_list has the side effect of clearing memory.
10083  * In the long run that function can be merged with run_list,
10084  * but doing that now would hobble the debugging effort. */
10085  free_pipe_list(pi);
10086  debug_printf_exec("run_and_free_list return %d\n", rcode);
10087  return rcode;
10088 }
10089 
10090 
10091 static void install_sighandlers(unsigned mask)
10092 {
10093  sighandler_t old_handler;
10094  unsigned sig = 0;
10095  while ((mask >>= 1) != 0) {
10096  sig++;
10097  if (!(mask & 1))
10098  continue;
10099  old_handler = install_sighandler(sig, pick_sighandler(sig));
10100  /* POSIX allows shell to re-enable SIGCHLD
10101  * even if it was SIG_IGN on entry.
10102  * Therefore we skip IGN check for it:
10103  */
10104  if (sig == SIGCHLD)
10105  continue;
10106  /* Interactive bash re-enables SIGHUP which is SIG_IGNed on entry.
10107  * Try:
10108  * trap '' hup; bash; echo RET # type "kill -hup $$", see SIGHUP having effect
10109  * trap '' hup; bash -c 'kill -hup $$; echo ALIVE' # here SIGHUP is SIG_IGNed
10110  */
10111  if (sig == SIGHUP && G_interactive_fd)
10112  continue;
10113  /* Unless one of the above signals, is it SIG_IGN? */
10114  if (old_handler == SIG_IGN) {
10115  /* oops... restore back to IGN, and record this fact */
10116  install_sighandler(sig, old_handler);
10117 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
10118  if (!G_traps)
10119  G_traps = xzalloc(sizeof(G_traps[0]) * NSIG);
10120  free(G_traps[sig]);
10121  G_traps[sig] = xzalloc(1); /* == xstrdup(""); */
10122 #endif
10123  }
10124  }
10125 }
10126 
10127 /* Called a few times only (or even once if "sh -c") */
10128 static void install_special_sighandlers(void)
10129 {
10130  unsigned mask;
10131 
10132  /* Which signals are shell-special? */
10133  mask = (1 << SIGQUIT) | (1 << SIGCHLD);
10134  if (G_interactive_fd) {
10135  mask |= SPECIAL_INTERACTIVE_SIGS;
10136  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp) /* we have ctty, job control sigs work */
10137  mask |= SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS;
10138  }
10139  /* Careful, do not re-install handlers we already installed */
10140  if (G.special_sig_mask != mask) {
10141  unsigned diff = mask & ~G.special_sig_mask;
10142  G.special_sig_mask = mask;
10143  install_sighandlers(diff);
10144  }
10145 }
10146 
10147 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
10148 /* helper */
10149 /* Set handlers to restore tty pgrp and exit */
10150 static void install_fatal_sighandlers(void)
10151 {
10152  unsigned mask;
10153 
10154  /* We will restore tty pgrp on these signals */
10155  mask = 0
10156  /*+ (1 << SIGILL ) * HUSH_DEBUG*/
10157  /*+ (1 << SIGFPE ) * HUSH_DEBUG*/
10158  + (1 << SIGBUS ) * HUSH_DEBUG
10159  + (1 << SIGSEGV) * HUSH_DEBUG
10160  /*+ (1 << SIGTRAP) * HUSH_DEBUG*/
10161  + (1 << SIGABRT)
10162  /* bash 3.2 seems to handle these just like 'fatal' ones */
10163  + (1 << SIGPIPE)
10164  + (1 << SIGALRM)
10165  /* if we are interactive, SIGHUP, SIGTERM and SIGINT are special sigs.
10166  * if we aren't interactive... but in this case
10167  * we never want to restore pgrp on exit, and this fn is not called
10168  */
10169  /*+ (1 << SIGHUP )*/
10170  /*+ (1 << SIGTERM)*/
10171  /*+ (1 << SIGINT )*/
10172  ;
10173  G_fatal_sig_mask = mask;
10174 
10175  install_sighandlers(mask);
10176 }
10177 #endif
10178 
10179 static int set_mode(int state, char mode, const char *o_opt)
10180 {
10181  int idx;
10182  switch (mode) {
10183  case 'n':
10184  /* set -n has no effect in interactive shell */
10185  /* Try: while set -n; do echo $-; done */
10186  if (!G_interactive_fd)
10187  G.o_opt[OPT_O_NOEXEC] = state;
10188  break;
10189  case 'x':
10190  IF_HUSH_MODE_X(G_x_mode = state;)
10191  IF_HUSH_MODE_X(if (G.x_mode_fd <= 0) G.x_mode_fd = dup_CLOEXEC(2, 10);)
10192  break;
10193  case 'e':
10194  G.o_opt[OPT_O_ERREXIT] = state;
10195  break;
10196  case 'o':
10197  if (!o_opt) {
10198  /* "set -o" or "set +o" without parameter.
10199  * in bash, set -o produces this output:
10200  * pipefail off
10201  * and set +o:
10202  * set +o pipefail
10203  * We always use the second form.
10204  */
10205  const char *p = o_opt_strings;
10206  idx = 0;
10207  while (*p) {
10208  printf("set %co %s\n", (G.o_opt[idx] ? '-' : '+'), p);
10209  idx++;
10210  p += strlen(p) + 1;
10211  }
10212  break;
10213  }
10214  idx = index_in_strings(o_opt_strings, o_opt);
10215  if (idx >= 0) {
10216  G.o_opt[idx] = state;
10217  break;
10218  }
10219  /* fall through to error */
10220  default:
10221  return EXIT_FAILURE;
10222  }
10223  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
10224 }
10225 
10226 int hush_main(int argc, char **argv) MAIN_EXTERNALLY_VISIBLE;
10227 int hush_main(int argc, char **argv)
10228 {
10229  pid_t cached_getpid;
10230  enum {
10231  OPT_login = (1 << 0),
10232  };
10233  unsigned flags;
10234 #if !BB_MMU
10235  unsigned builtin_argc = 0;
10236 #endif
10237  char **e;
10238  struct variable *cur_var;
10239  struct variable *shell_ver;
10240 
10241  INIT_G();
10242  if (EXIT_SUCCESS != 0) /* if EXIT_SUCCESS == 0, it is already done */
10243  G.last_exitcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
10244 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
10245 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
10246  G.return_exitcode = -1;
10247 # endif
10248  G.pre_trap_exitcode = -1;
10249 #endif
10250 
10251 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
10252  G.count_SIGCHLD++; /* ensure it is != G.handled_SIGCHLD */
10253 #endif
10254 #if !BB_MMU
10255  G.argv0_for_re_execing = argv[0];
10256 #endif
10257 
10258  cached_getpid = getpid(); /* for tcsetpgrp() during init */
10259  G.root_pid = cached_getpid; /* for $PID (NOMMU can override via -$HEXPID:HEXPPID:...) */
10260  G.root_ppid = getppid(); /* for $PPID (NOMMU can override) */
10261 
10262  /* Deal with HUSH_VERSION */
10263  debug_printf_env("unsetenv '%s'\n", "HUSH_VERSION");
10264  unsetenv("HUSH_VERSION"); /* in case it exists in initial env */
10265  shell_ver = xzalloc(sizeof(*shell_ver));
10266  shell_ver->flg_export = 1;
10267  shell_ver->flg_read_only = 1;
10268  /* Code which handles ${var<op>...} needs writable values for all variables,
10269  * therefore we xstrdup: */
10270  shell_ver->varstr = xstrdup(hush_version_str);
10271 
10272  /* Create shell local variables from the values
10273  * currently living in the environment */
10274  G.top_var = shell_ver;
10275  cur_var = G.top_var;
10276  e = environ;
10277  if (e) while (*e) {
10278  char *value = strchr(*e, '=');
10279  if (value) { /* paranoia */
10280  cur_var->next = xzalloc(sizeof(*cur_var));
10281  cur_var = cur_var->next;
10282  cur_var->varstr = *e;
10283  cur_var->max_len = strlen(*e);
10284  cur_var->flg_export = 1;
10285  }
10286  e++;
10287  }
10288  /* (Re)insert HUSH_VERSION into env (AFTER we scanned the env!) */
10289  debug_printf_env("putenv '%s'\n", shell_ver->varstr);
10290  putenv(shell_ver->varstr);
10291 
10292  /* Export PWD */
10293  set_pwd_var(SETFLAG_EXPORT);
10294 
10295 #if BASH_HOSTNAME_VAR
10296  /* Set (but not export) HOSTNAME unless already set */
10297  if (!get_local_var_value("HOSTNAME")) {
10298  struct utsname uts;
10299  uname(&uts);
10300  set_local_var_from_halves("HOSTNAME", uts.nodename);
10301  }
10302 #endif
10303  /* IFS is not inherited from the parent environment */
10304  set_local_var_from_halves("IFS", defifs);
10305 
10306  if (!get_local_var_value("PATH"))
10307  set_local_var_from_halves("PATH", bb_default_root_path);
10308 
10309  /* PS1/PS2 are set later, if we determine that we are interactive */
10310 
10311  /* bash also exports SHLVL and _,
10312  * and sets (but doesn't export) the following variables:
10313  * BASH=/bin/bash
10314  * BASH_VERSINFO=([0]="3" [1]="2" [2]="0" [3]="1" [4]="release" [5]="i386-pc-linux-gnu")
10315  * BASH_VERSION='3.2.0(1)-release'
10316  * HOSTTYPE=i386
10317  * MACHTYPE=i386-pc-linux-gnu
10318  * OSTYPE=linux-gnu
10319  * PPID=<NNNNN> - we also do it elsewhere
10320  * EUID=<NNNNN>
10321  * UID=<NNNNN>
10322  * GROUPS=()
10323  * LINES=<NNN>
10324  * COLUMNS=<NNN>
10325  * BASH_ARGC=()
10326  * BASH_ARGV=()
10327  * BASH_LINENO=()
10328  * BASH_SOURCE=()
10329  * DIRSTACK=()
10330  * PIPESTATUS=([0]="0")
10331  * HISTFILE=/<xxx>/.bash_history
10332  * HISTFILESIZE=500
10333  * HISTSIZE=500
10334  * MAILCHECK=60
10335  * PATH=/usr/gnu/bin:/usr/local/bin:/bin:/usr/bin:.
10336  * SHELL=/bin/bash
10337  * SHELLOPTS=braceexpand:emacs:hashall:histexpand:history:interactive-comments:monitor
10338  * TERM=dumb
10339  * OPTERR=1
10340  * OPTIND=1
10341  * PS4='+ '
10342  */
10343 
10344 #if NUM_SCRIPTS > 0
10345  if (argc < 0) {
10346  char *script = get_script_content(-argc - 1);
10347  G.global_argv = argv;
10348  G.global_argc = string_array_len(argv);
10349  //install_special_sighandlers(); - needed?
10350  parse_and_run_string(script);
10351  goto final_return;
10352  }
10353 #endif
10354 
10355  /* Initialize some more globals to non-zero values */
10356  die_func = restore_ttypgrp_and__exit;
10357 
10358  /* Shell is non-interactive at first. We need to call
10359  * install_special_sighandlers() if we are going to execute "sh <script>",
10360  * "sh -c <cmds>" or login shell's /etc/profile and friends.
10361  * If we later decide that we are interactive, we run install_special_sighandlers()
10362  * in order to intercept (more) signals.
10363  */
10364 
10365  /* Parse options */
10366  /* http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/sh.html */
10367  flags = (argv[0] && argv[0][0] == '-') ? OPT_login : 0;
10368  while (1) {
10369  int opt = getopt(argc, argv, "+" /* stop at 1st non-option */
10370  "cexinsl"
10371 #if !BB_MMU
10372  "<:$:R:V:"
10373 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
10374  "F:"
10375 # endif
10376 #endif
10377  );
10378  if (opt <= 0)
10379  break;
10380  switch (opt) {
10381  case 'c':
10382  /* Note: -c is not an option with param!
10383  * "hush -c -l SCRIPT" is valid. "hush -cSCRIPT" is not.
10384  */
10385  G.opt_c = 1;
10386  break;
10387  case 'i':
10388  /* Well, we cannot just declare interactiveness,
10389  * we have to have some stuff (ctty, etc) */
10390  /* G_interactive_fd++; */
10391 //There are a few cases where bash -i -c 'SCRIPT'
10392 //has visible effect (differs from bash -c 'SCRIPT'):
10393 //it ignores TERM:
10394 // bash -i -c 'kill $$; echo ALIVE'
10395 // ALIVE
10396 //it resets SIG_IGNed HUP to SIG_DFL:
10397 // trap '' hup; bash -i -c 'kill -hup $$; echo ALIVE'
10398 // Hangup [the message is not printed by bash, it's the shell which started it]
10399 //is talkative about jobs and exiting:
10400 // bash -i -c 'sleep 1 & exit'
10401 // [1] 16170
10402 // exit
10403 //includes $ENV file (only if run as "sh"):
10404 // echo last >/tmp/ENV; ENV=/tmp/ENV sh -i -c 'echo HERE'
10405 // last: cannot open /var/log/wtmp: No such file or directory
10406 // HERE
10407 //(under "bash", it's the opposite: it runs $BASH_ENV file only *without* -i).
10408 //
10409 //ash -i -c 'sleep 3; sleep 3', on ^C, drops into a prompt instead of exiting
10410 //(this may be a bug, bash does not do this).
10411 //(ash -i -c 'sleep 3' won't show this, the last command gets auto-"exec"ed)
10412 //
10413 //None of the above feel like useful features people would rely on.
10414  break;
10415  case 's':
10416  G.opt_s = 1;
10417  break;
10418  case 'l':
10419  flags |= OPT_login;
10420  break;
10421 #if !BB_MMU
10422  case '<': /* "big heredoc" support */
10423  full_write1_str(optarg);
10424  _exit(0);
10425  case '$': {
10426  unsigned long long empty_trap_mask;
10427 
10428  G.root_pid = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10429  optarg++;
10430  G.root_ppid = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10431  optarg++;
10432  G.last_bg_pid = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10433  optarg++;
10434  G.last_exitcode = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10435  optarg++;
10436  builtin_argc = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10437  optarg++;
10438  empty_trap_mask = bb_strtoull(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10439  if (empty_trap_mask != 0) {
10440  IF_HUSH_TRAP(int sig;)
10441  install_special_sighandlers();
10442 # if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
10443  G_traps = xzalloc(sizeof(G_traps[0]) * NSIG);
10444  for (sig = 1; sig < NSIG; sig++) {
10445  if (empty_trap_mask & (1LL << sig)) {
10446  G_traps[sig] = xzalloc(1); /* == xstrdup(""); */
10447  install_sighandler(sig, SIG_IGN);
10448  }
10449  }
10450 # endif
10451  }
10452 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
10453  optarg++;
10454  G.depth_of_loop = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10455 # endif
10456  /* Suppress "killed by signal" message, -$ hack is used
10457  * for subshells: echo `sh -c 'kill -9 $$'`
10458  * should be silent.
10459  */
10460  IF_HUSH_JOB(G.run_list_level = 1;)
10461 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
10462  /* nommu uses re-exec trick for "... | func | ...",
10463  * should allow "return".
10464  * This accidentally allows returns in subshells.
10465  */
10466  G_flag_return_in_progress = -1;
10467 # endif
10468  break;
10469  }
10470  case 'R':
10471  case 'V':
10472  set_local_var(xstrdup(optarg), opt == 'R' ? SETFLAG_MAKE_RO : 0);
10473  break;
10474 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
10475  case 'F': {
10476  struct function *funcp = new_function(optarg);
10477  /* funcp->name is already set to optarg */
10478  /* funcp->body is set to NULL. It's a special case. */
10479  funcp->body_as_string = argv[optind];
10480  optind++;
10481  break;
10482  }
10483 # endif
10484 #endif
10485  /*case '?': invalid option encountered (set_mode('?') will fail) */
10486  /*case 'n':*/
10487  /*case 'x':*/
10488  /*case 'e':*/
10489  default:
10490  if (set_mode(1, opt, NULL) == 0) /* no error */
10491  break;
10492  bb_show_usage();
10493  }
10494  } /* option parsing loop */
10495 
10496  /* Skip options. Try "hush -l": $1 should not be "-l"! */
10497  G.global_argc = argc - (optind - 1);
10498  G.global_argv = argv + (optind - 1);
10499  G.global_argv[0] = argv[0];
10500 
10501  /* If we are login shell... */
10502  if (flags & OPT_login) {
10503  const char *hp = NULL;
10504  HFILE *input;
10505 
10506  debug_printf("sourcing /etc/profile\n");
10507  input = hfopen("/etc/profile");
10508  run_profile:
10509  if (input != NULL) {
10510  install_special_sighandlers();
10511  parse_and_run_file(input);
10512  hfclose(input);
10513  }
10514  /* bash: after sourcing /etc/profile,
10515  * tries to source (in the given order):
10516  * ~/.bash_profile, ~/.bash_login, ~/.profile,
10517  * stopping on first found. --noprofile turns this off.
10518  * bash also sources ~/.bash_logout on exit.
10519  * If called as sh, skips .bash_XXX files.
10520  */
10521  if (!hp) { /* unless we looped on the "goto" already */
10522  hp = get_local_var_value("HOME");
10523  if (hp && hp[0]) {
10524  debug_printf("sourcing ~/.profile\n");
10525  hp = concat_path_file(hp, ".profile");
10526  input = hfopen(hp);
10527  free((char*)hp);
10528  goto run_profile;
10529  }
10530  }
10531  }
10532 
10533  /* -c takes effect *after* -l */
10534  if (G.opt_c) {
10535  /* Possibilities:
10536  * sh ... -c 'script'
10537  * sh ... -c 'script' ARG0 [ARG1...]
10538  * On NOMMU, if builtin_argc != 0,
10539  * sh ... -c 'builtin' BARGV... "" ARG0 [ARG1...]
10540  * "" needs to be replaced with NULL
10541  * and BARGV vector fed to builtin function.
10542  * Note: the form without ARG0 never happens:
10543  * sh ... -c 'builtin' BARGV... ""
10544  */
10545  char *script;
10546 
10547  install_special_sighandlers();
10548 
10549  G.global_argc--;
10550  G.global_argv++;
10551 #if !BB_MMU
10552  if (builtin_argc) {
10553  /* -c 'builtin' [BARGV...] "" ARG0 [ARG1...] */
10554  const struct built_in_command *x;
10555  x = find_builtin(G.global_argv[0]);
10556  if (x) { /* paranoia */
10557  argv = G.global_argv;
10558  G.global_argc -= builtin_argc + 1; /* skip [BARGV...] "" */
10559  G.global_argv += builtin_argc + 1;
10560  G.global_argv[-1] = NULL; /* replace "" */
10561  G.last_exitcode = x->b_function(argv);
10562  }
10563  goto final_return;
10564  }
10565 #endif
10566 
10567  script = G.global_argv[0];
10568  if (!script)
10569  bb_error_msg_and_die(bb_msg_requires_arg, "-c");
10570  if (!G.global_argv[1]) {
10571  /* -c 'script' (no params): prevent empty $0 */
10572  G.global_argv[0] = argv[0];
10573  } else { /* else -c 'script' ARG0 [ARG1...]: $0 is ARG0 */
10574  G.global_argc--;
10575  G.global_argv++;
10576  }
10577  parse_and_run_string(script);
10578  goto final_return;
10579  }
10580 
10581  /* -s is: hush -s ARGV1 ARGV2 (no SCRIPT) */
10582  if (!G.opt_s && G.global_argv[1]) {
10583  HFILE *input;
10584  /*
10585  * "bash <script>" (which is never interactive (unless -i?))
10586  * sources $BASH_ENV here (without scanning $PATH).
10587  * If called as sh, does the same but with $ENV.
10588  * Also NB, per POSIX, $ENV should undergo parameter expansion.
10589  */
10590  G.global_argc--;
10591  G.global_argv++;
10592  debug_printf("running script '%s'\n", G.global_argv[0]);
10593  xfunc_error_retval = 127; /* for "hush /does/not/exist" case */
10594  input = hfopen(G.global_argv[0]);
10595  if (!input) {
10596  bb_simple_perror_msg_and_die(G.global_argv[0]);
10597  }
10598  xfunc_error_retval = 1;
10599  install_special_sighandlers();
10600  parse_and_run_file(input);
10601 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_CLEAN_UP
10602  hfclose(input);
10603 #endif
10604  goto final_return;
10605  }
10606  /* "implicit" -s: bare interactive hush shows 's' in $- */
10607  G.opt_s = 1;
10608 
10609  /* Up to here, shell was non-interactive. Now it may become one.
10610  * NB: don't forget to (re)run install_special_sighandlers() as needed.
10611  */
10612 
10613  /* A shell is interactive if the '-i' flag was given,
10614  * or if all of the following conditions are met:
10615  * no -c command
10616  * no arguments remaining or the -s flag given
10617  * standard input is a terminal
10618  * standard output is a terminal
10619  * Refer to Posix.2, the description of the 'sh' utility.
10620  */
10621 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
10622  if (isatty(STDIN_FILENO) && isatty(STDOUT_FILENO)) {
10623  G_saved_tty_pgrp = tcgetpgrp(STDIN_FILENO);
10624  debug_printf("saved_tty_pgrp:%d\n", G_saved_tty_pgrp);
10625  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp < 0)
10626  G_saved_tty_pgrp = 0;
10627 
10628  /* try to dup stdin to high fd#, >= 255 */
10629  G_interactive_fd = dup_CLOEXEC(STDIN_FILENO, 254);
10630  if (G_interactive_fd < 0) {
10631  /* try to dup to any fd */
10632  G_interactive_fd = dup(STDIN_FILENO);
10633  if (G_interactive_fd < 0) {
10634  /* give up */
10635  G_interactive_fd = 0;
10636  G_saved_tty_pgrp = 0;
10637  }
10638  }
10639  }
10640  debug_printf("interactive_fd:%d\n", G_interactive_fd);
10641  if (G_interactive_fd) {
10642  close_on_exec_on(G_interactive_fd);
10643 
10644  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp) {
10645  /* If we were run as 'hush &', sleep until we are
10646  * in the foreground (tty pgrp == our pgrp).
10647  * If we get started under a job aware app (like bash),
10648  * make sure we are now in charge so we don't fight over
10649  * who gets the foreground */
10650  while (1) {
10651  pid_t shell_pgrp = getpgrp();
10652  G_saved_tty_pgrp = tcgetpgrp(G_interactive_fd);
10653  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp == shell_pgrp)
10654  break;
10655  /* send TTIN to ourself (should stop us) */
10656  kill(- shell_pgrp, SIGTTIN);
10657  }
10658  }
10659 
10660  /* Install more signal handlers */
10661  install_special_sighandlers();
10662 
10663  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp) {
10664  /* Set other signals to restore saved_tty_pgrp */
10665  install_fatal_sighandlers();
10666  /* Put ourselves in our own process group
10667  * (bash, too, does this only if ctty is available) */
10668  bb_setpgrp(); /* is the same as setpgid(our_pid, our_pid); */
10669  /* Grab control of the terminal */
10670  tcsetpgrp(G_interactive_fd, cached_getpid);
10671  }
10672  enable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
10673 
10674 # if ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING
10675  G.line_input_state = new_line_input_t(FOR_SHELL);
10676 # if ENABLE_FEATURE_TAB_COMPLETION
10677  G.line_input_state->get_exe_name = get_builtin_name;
10678 # endif
10679 # if EDITING_HAS_sh_get_var
10680  G.line_input_state->sh_get_var = get_local_var_value;
10681 # endif
10682 # endif
10683 # if ENABLE_HUSH_SAVEHISTORY && MAX_HISTORY > 0
10684  {
10685  const char *hp = get_local_var_value("HISTFILE");
10686  if (!hp) {
10687  hp = get_local_var_value("HOME");
10688  if (hp)
10689  hp = concat_path_file(hp, ".hush_history");
10690  } else {
10691  hp = xstrdup(hp);
10692  }
10693  if (hp) {
10694  G.line_input_state->hist_file = hp;
10695  //set_local_var(xasprintf("HISTFILE=%s", ...));
10696  }
10697 # if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_HISTFILESIZE
10698  hp = get_local_var_value("HISTFILESIZE");
10699  G.line_input_state->max_history = size_from_HISTFILESIZE(hp);
10700 # endif
10701  }
10702 # endif
10703  } else {
10704  install_special_sighandlers();
10705  }
10706 #elif ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
10707  /* No job control compiled in, only prompt/line editing */
10708  if (isatty(STDIN_FILENO) && isatty(STDOUT_FILENO)) {
10709  G_interactive_fd = dup_CLOEXEC(STDIN_FILENO, 254);
10710  if (G_interactive_fd < 0) {
10711  /* try to dup to any fd */
10712  G_interactive_fd = dup_CLOEXEC(STDIN_FILENO, -1);
10713  if (G_interactive_fd < 0)
10714  /* give up */
10715  G_interactive_fd = 0;
10716  }
10717  }
10718  if (G_interactive_fd) {
10719  close_on_exec_on(G_interactive_fd);
10720  }
10721  install_special_sighandlers();
10722 #else
10723  /* We have interactiveness code disabled */
10724  install_special_sighandlers();
10725 #endif
10726  /* bash:
10727  * if interactive but not a login shell, sources ~/.bashrc
10728  * (--norc turns this off, --rcfile <file> overrides)
10729  */
10730 
10731  if (G_interactive_fd) {
10732 #if ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE && ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING_FANCY_PROMPT
10733  /* Set (but not export) PS1/2 unless already set */
10734  if (!get_local_var_value("PS1"))
10735  set_local_var_from_halves("PS1", "\\w \\$ ");
10736  if (!get_local_var_value("PS2"))
10737  set_local_var_from_halves("PS2", "> ");
10738 #endif
10739  if (!ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_EXTRA_QUIET) {
10740  /* note: ash and hush share this string */
10741  printf("\n\n%s %s\n"
10742  IF_HUSH_HELP("Enter 'help' for a list of built-in commands.\n")
10743  "\n",
10744  bb_banner,
10745  "hush - the humble shell"
10746  );
10747  }
10748  }
10749 
10750  parse_and_run_file(hfopen(NULL)); /* stdin */
10751 
10752  final_return:
10753  hush_exit(G.last_exitcode);
10754 }
10755 
10756 
10757 /*
10758  * Built-ins
10759  */
10760 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_true(char **argv UNUSED_PARAM)
10761 {
10762  return 0;
10763 }
10764 
10765 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TEST || ENABLE_HUSH_ECHO || ENABLE_HUSH_PRINTF || ENABLE_HUSH_KILL
10766 static NOINLINE int run_applet_main(char **argv, int (*applet_main_func)(int argc, char **argv))
10767 {
10768  int argc = string_array_len(argv);
10769  return applet_main_func(argc, argv);
10770 }
10771 #endif
10772 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TEST || BASH_TEST2
10773 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_test(char **argv)
10774 {
10775  return run_applet_main(argv, test_main);
10776 }
10777 #endif
10778 #if ENABLE_HUSH_ECHO
10779 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_echo(char **argv)
10780 {
10781  return run_applet_main(argv, echo_main);
10782 }
10783 #endif
10784 #if ENABLE_HUSH_PRINTF
10785 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_printf(char **argv)
10786 {
10787  return run_applet_main(argv, printf_main);
10788 }
10789 #endif
10790 
10791 #if ENABLE_HUSH_HELP
10792 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_help(char **argv UNUSED_PARAM)
10793 {
10794  const struct built_in_command *x;
10795 
10796  printf(
10797  "Built-in commands:\n"
10798  "------------------\n");
10799  for (x = bltins1; x != &bltins1[ARRAY_SIZE(bltins1)]; x++) {
10800  if (x->b_descr)
10801  printf("%-10s%s\n", x->b_cmd, x->b_descr);
10802  }
10803  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
10804 }
10805 #endif
10806 
10807 #if MAX_HISTORY && ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING
10808 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_history(char **argv UNUSED_PARAM)
10809 {
10810  show_history(G.line_input_state);
10811  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
10812 }
10813 #endif
10814 
10815 static char **skip_dash_dash(char **argv)
10816 {
10817  argv++;
10818  if (argv[0] && argv[0][0] == '-' && argv[0][1] == '-' && argv[0][2] == '\0')
10819  argv++;
10820  return argv;
10821 }
10822 
10823 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_cd(char **argv)
10824 {
10825  const char *newdir;
10826 
10827  argv = skip_dash_dash(argv);
10828  newdir = argv[0];
10829  if (newdir == NULL) {
10830  /* bash does nothing (exitcode 0) if HOME is ""; if it's unset,
10831  * bash says "bash: cd: HOME not set" and does nothing
10832  * (exitcode 1)
10833  */
10834  const char *home = get_local_var_value("HOME");
10835  newdir = home ? home : "/";
10836  }
10837  if (chdir(newdir)) {
10838  /* Mimic bash message exactly */
10839  bb_perror_msg("cd: %s", newdir);
10840  return EXIT_FAILURE;
10841  }
10842  /* Read current dir (get_cwd(1) is inside) and set PWD.
10843  * Note: do not enforce exporting. If PWD was unset or unexported,
10844  * set it again, but do not export. bash does the same.
10845  */
10846  set_pwd_var(/*flag:*/ 0);
10847  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
10848 }
10849 
10850 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_pwd(char **argv UNUSED_PARAM)
10851 {
10852  puts(get_cwd(0));
10853  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
10854 }
10855 
10856 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_eval(char **argv)
10857 {
10858  argv = skip_dash_dash(argv);
10859 
10860  if (!argv[0])
10861  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
10862 
10863  IF_HUSH_MODE_X(G.x_mode_depth++;)
10864  //bb_error_msg("%s: ++x_mode_depth=%d", __func__, G.x_mode_depth);
10865  if (!argv[1]) {
10866  /* bash:
10867  * eval "echo Hi; done" ("done" is syntax error):
10868  * "echo Hi" will not execute too.
10869  */
10870  parse_and_run_string(argv[0]);
10871  } else {
10872  /* "The eval utility shall construct a command by
10873  * concatenating arguments together, separating
10874  * each with a <space> character."
10875  */
10876  char *str, *p;
10877  unsigned len = 0;
10878  char **pp = argv;
10879  do
10880  len += strlen(*pp) + 1;
10881  while (*++pp);
10882  str = p = xmalloc(len);
10883  pp = argv;
10884  for (;;) {
10885  p = stpcpy(p, *pp);
10886  pp++;
10887  if (!*pp)
10888  break;
10889  *p++ = ' ';
10890  }
10891  parse_and_run_string(str);
10892  free(str);
10893  }
10894  IF_HUSH_MODE_X(G.x_mode_depth--;)
10895  //bb_error_msg("%s: --x_mode_depth=%d", __func__, G.x_mode_depth);
10896  return G.last_exitcode;
10897 }
10898 
10899 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_exec(char **argv)
10900 {
10901  argv = skip_dash_dash(argv);
10902  if (argv[0] == NULL)
10903  return EXIT_SUCCESS; /* bash does this */
10904 
10905  /* Careful: we can end up here after [v]fork. Do not restore
10906  * tty pgrp then, only top-level shell process does that */
10907  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp && getpid() == G.root_pid)
10908  tcsetpgrp(G_interactive_fd, G_saved_tty_pgrp);
10909 
10910  /* Saved-redirect fds, script fds and G_interactive_fd are still
10911  * open here. However, they are all CLOEXEC, and execv below
10912  * closes them. Try interactive "exec ls -l /proc/self/fd",
10913  * it should show no extra open fds in the "ls" process.
10914  * If we'd try to run builtins/NOEXECs, this would need improving.
10915  */
10916  //close_saved_fds_and_FILE_fds();
10917 
10918  /* TODO: if exec fails, bash does NOT exit! We do.
10919  * We'll need to undo trap cleanup (it's inside execvp_or_die)
10920  * and tcsetpgrp, and this is inherently racy.
10921  */
10922  execvp_or_die(argv);
10923 }
10924 
10925 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_exit(char **argv)
10926 {
10927  debug_printf_exec("%s()\n", __func__);
10928 
10929  /* interactive bash:
10930  * # trap "echo EEE" EXIT
10931  * # exit
10932  * exit
10933  * There are stopped jobs.
10934  * (if there are _stopped_ jobs, running ones don't count)
10935  * # exit
10936  * exit
10937  * EEE (then bash exits)
10938  *
10939  * TODO: we can use G.exiting = -1 as indicator "last cmd was exit"
10940  */
10941 
10942  /* note: EXIT trap is run by hush_exit */
10943  argv = skip_dash_dash(argv);
10944  if (argv[0] == NULL) {
10945 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
10946  if (G.pre_trap_exitcode >= 0) /* "exit" in trap uses $? from before the trap */
10947  hush_exit(G.pre_trap_exitcode);
10948 #endif
10949  hush_exit(G.last_exitcode);
10950  }
10951  /* mimic bash: exit 123abc == exit 255 + error msg */
10952  xfunc_error_retval = 255;
10953  /* bash: exit -2 == exit 254, no error msg */
10954  hush_exit(xatoi(argv[0]) & 0xff);
10955 }
10956 
10957 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TYPE
10958 /* http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/type.html */
10959 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_type(char **argv)
10960 {
10961  int ret = EXIT_SUCCESS;
10962 
10963  while (*++argv) {
10964  const char *type;
10965  char *path = NULL;
10966 
10967  if (0) {} /* make conditional compile easier below */
10968  /*else if (find_alias(*argv))
10969  type = "an alias";*/
10970 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
10971  else if (find_function(*argv))
10972  type = "a function";
10973 # endif
10974  else if (find_builtin(*argv))
10975  type = "a shell builtin";
10976  else if ((path = find_in_path(*argv)) != NULL)
10977  type = path;
10978  else {
10979  bb_error_msg("type: %s: not found", *argv);
10980  ret = EXIT_FAILURE;
10981  continue;
10982  }
10983 
10984  printf("%s is %s\n", *argv, type);
10985  free(path);
10986  }
10987 
10988  return ret;
10989 }
10990 #endif
10991 
10992 #if ENABLE_HUSH_READ
10993 /* Interruptibility of read builtin in bash
10994  * (tested on bash-4.2.8 by sending signals (not by ^C)):
10995  *
10996  * Empty trap makes read ignore corresponding signal, for any signal.
10997  *
10998  * SIGINT:
10999  * - terminates non-interactive shell;
11000  * - interrupts read in interactive shell;
11001  * if it has non-empty trap:
11002  * - executes trap and returns to command prompt in interactive shell;
11003  * - executes trap and returns to read in non-interactive shell;
11004  * SIGTERM:
11005  * - is ignored (does not interrupt) read in interactive shell;
11006  * - terminates non-interactive shell;
11007  * if it has non-empty trap:
11008  * - executes trap and returns to read;
11009  * SIGHUP:
11010  * - terminates shell (regardless of interactivity);
11011  * if it has non-empty trap:
11012  * - executes trap and returns to read;
11013  * SIGCHLD from children:
11014  * - does not interrupt read regardless of interactivity:
11015  * try: sleep 1 & read x; echo $x
11016  */
11017 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_read(char **argv)
11018 {
11019  const char *r;
11020  struct builtin_read_params params;
11021 
11022  memset(&params, 0, sizeof(params));
11023 
11024  /* "!": do not abort on errors.
11025  * Option string must start with "sr" to match BUILTIN_READ_xxx
11026  */
11027  params.read_flags = getopt32(argv,
11028 # if BASH_READ_D
11029  IF_NOT_HUSH_BASH_COMPAT("^")
11030  "!srn:p:t:u:d:" IF_NOT_HUSH_BASH_COMPAT("\0" "-1"/*min 1 arg*/),
11031  &params.opt_n, &params.opt_p, &params.opt_t, &params.opt_u, &params.opt_d
11032 # else
11033  IF_NOT_HUSH_BASH_COMPAT("^")
11034  "!srn:p:t:u:" IF_NOT_HUSH_BASH_COMPAT("\0" "-1"/*min 1 arg*/),
11035  &params.opt_n, &params.opt_p, &params.opt_t, &params.opt_u
11036 # endif
11037 //TODO: print "read: need variable name"
11038 //for the case of !BASH "read" with no args (now it fails silently)
11039 //(or maybe extend getopt32() to emit a message if "-1" fails)
11040  );
11041  if ((uint32_t)params.read_flags == (uint32_t)-1)
11042  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11043  argv += optind;
11044  params.argv = argv;
11045  params.setvar = set_local_var_from_halves;
11046  params.ifs = get_local_var_value("IFS"); /* can be NULL */
11047 
11048  again:
11049  r = shell_builtin_read(&params);
11050 
11051  if ((uintptr_t)r == 1 && errno == EINTR) {
11052  unsigned sig = check_and_run_traps();
11053  if (sig != SIGINT)
11054  goto again;
11055  }
11056 
11057  if ((uintptr_t)r > 1) {
11058  bb_simple_error_msg(r);
11059  r = (char*)(uintptr_t)1;
11060  }
11061 
11062  return (uintptr_t)r;
11063 }
11064 #endif
11065 
11066 #if ENABLE_HUSH_UMASK
11067 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_umask(char **argv)
11068 {
11069  int rc;
11070  mode_t mask;
11071 
11072  rc = 1;
11073  mask = umask(0);
11074  argv = skip_dash_dash(argv);
11075  if (argv[0]) {
11076  mode_t old_mask = mask;
11077 
11078  /* numeric umasks are taken as-is */
11079  /* symbolic umasks are inverted: "umask a=rx" calls umask(222) */
11080  if (!isdigit(argv[0][0]))
11081  mask ^= 0777;
11082  mask = bb_parse_mode(argv[0], mask);
11083  if (!isdigit(argv[0][0]))
11084  mask ^= 0777;
11085  if ((unsigned)mask > 0777) {
11086  mask = old_mask;
11087  /* bash messages:
11088  * bash: umask: 'q': invalid symbolic mode operator
11089  * bash: umask: 999: octal number out of range
11090  */
11091  bb_error_msg("%s: invalid mode '%s'", "umask", argv[0]);
11092  rc = 0;
11093  }
11094  } else {
11095  /* Mimic bash */
11096  printf("%04o\n", (unsigned) mask);
11097  /* fall through and restore mask which we set to 0 */
11098  }
11099  umask(mask);
11100 
11101  return !rc; /* rc != 0 - success */
11102 }
11103 #endif
11104 
11105 #if ENABLE_HUSH_EXPORT || ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
11106 static void print_escaped(const char *s)
11107 {
11108  if (*s == '\'')
11109  goto squote;
11110  do {
11111  const char *p = strchrnul(s, '\'');
11112  /* print 'xxxx', possibly just '' */
11113  printf("'%.*s'", (int)(p - s), s);
11114  if (*p == '\0')
11115  break;
11116  s = p;
11117  squote:
11118  /* s points to '; print "'''...'''" */
11119  putchar('"');
11120  do putchar('\''); while (*++s == '\'');
11121  putchar('"');
11122  } while (*s);
11123 }
11124 #endif
11125 
11126 #if ENABLE_HUSH_EXPORT || ENABLE_HUSH_LOCAL || ENABLE_HUSH_READONLY
11127 static int helper_export_local(char **argv, unsigned flags)
11128 {
11129  do {
11130  char *name = *argv;
11131  const char *name_end = endofname(name);
11132 
11133  if (*name_end == '\0') {
11134  struct variable *var, **vpp;
11135 
11136  vpp = get_ptr_to_local_var(name, name_end - name);
11137  var = vpp ? *vpp : NULL;
11138 
11139  if (flags & SETFLAG_UNEXPORT) {
11140  /* export -n NAME (without =VALUE) */
11141  if (var) {
11142  var->flg_export = 0;
11143  debug_printf_env("%s: unsetenv '%s'\n", __func__, name);
11144  unsetenv(name);
11145  } /* else: export -n NOT_EXISTING_VAR: no-op */
11146  continue;
11147  }
11148  if (flags & SETFLAG_EXPORT) {
11149  /* export NAME (without =VALUE) */
11150  if (var) {
11151  var->flg_export = 1;
11152  debug_printf_env("%s: putenv '%s'\n", __func__, var->varstr);
11153  putenv(var->varstr);
11154  continue;
11155  }
11156  }
11157  if (flags & SETFLAG_MAKE_RO) {
11158  /* readonly NAME (without =VALUE) */
11159  if (var) {
11160  var->flg_read_only = 1;
11161  continue;
11162  }
11163  }
11164 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LOCAL
11165  /* Is this "local" bltin? */
11166  if (!(flags & (SETFLAG_EXPORT|SETFLAG_UNEXPORT|SETFLAG_MAKE_RO))) {
11167  unsigned lvl = flags >> SETFLAG_VARLVL_SHIFT;
11168  if (var && var->var_nest_level == lvl) {
11169  /* "local x=abc; ...; local x" - ignore second local decl */
11170  continue;
11171  }
11172  }
11173 # endif
11174  /* Exporting non-existing variable.
11175  * bash does not put it in environment,
11176  * but remembers that it is exported,
11177  * and does put it in env when it is set later.
11178  * We just set it to "" and export.
11179  */
11180  /* Or, it's "local NAME" (without =VALUE).
11181  * bash sets the value to "".
11182  */
11183  /* Or, it's "readonly NAME" (without =VALUE).
11184  * bash remembers NAME and disallows its creation
11185  * in the future.
11186  */
11187  name = xasprintf("%s=", name);
11188  } else {
11189  if (*name_end != '=') {
11190  bb_error_msg("'%s': bad variable name", name);
11191  /* do not parse following argv[]s: */
11192  return 1;
11193  }
11194  /* (Un)exporting/making local NAME=VALUE */
11195  name = xstrdup(name);
11196  /* Testcase: export PS1='\w \$ ' */
11197  unbackslash(name);
11198  }
11199  debug_printf_env("%s: set_local_var('%s')\n", __func__, name);
11200  if (set_local_var(name, flags))
11201  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11202  } while (*++argv);
11203  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11204 }
11205 #endif
11206 
11207 #if ENABLE_HUSH_EXPORT
11208 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_export(char **argv)
11209 {
11210  unsigned opt_unexport;
11211 
11212 # if ENABLE_HUSH_EXPORT_N
11213  /* "!": do not abort on errors */
11214  opt_unexport = getopt32(argv, "!n");
11215  if (opt_unexport == (uint32_t)-1)
11216  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11217  argv += optind;
11218 # else
11219  opt_unexport = 0;
11220  argv++;
11221 # endif
11222 
11223  if (argv[0] == NULL) {
11224  char **e = environ;
11225  if (e) {
11226  while (*e) {
11227 # if 0
11228  puts(*e++);
11229 # else
11230  /* ash emits: export VAR='VAL'
11231  * bash: declare -x VAR="VAL"
11232  * we follow ash example */
11233  const char *s = *e++;
11234  const char *p = strchr(s, '=');
11235 
11236  if (!p) /* wtf? take next variable */
11237  continue;
11238  /* export var= */
11239  printf("export %.*s", (int)(p - s) + 1, s);
11240  print_escaped(p + 1);
11241  putchar('\n');
11242 # endif
11243  }
11244  /*fflush_all(); - done after each builtin anyway */
11245  }
11246  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11247  }
11248 
11249  return helper_export_local(argv, opt_unexport ? SETFLAG_UNEXPORT : SETFLAG_EXPORT);
11250 }
11251 #endif
11252 
11253 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOCAL
11254 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_local(char **argv)
11255 {
11256  if (G.func_nest_level == 0) {
11257  bb_error_msg("%s: not in a function", argv[0]);
11258  return EXIT_FAILURE; /* bash compat */
11259  }
11260  argv++;
11261  /* Since all builtins run in a nested variable level,
11262  * need to use level - 1 here. Or else the variable will be removed at once
11263  * after builtin returns.
11264  */
11265  return helper_export_local(argv, (G.var_nest_level - 1) << SETFLAG_VARLVL_SHIFT);
11266 }
11267 #endif
11268 
11269 #if ENABLE_HUSH_READONLY
11270 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_readonly(char **argv)
11271 {
11272  argv++;
11273  if (*argv == NULL) {
11274  /* bash: readonly [-p]: list all readonly VARs
11275  * (-p has no effect in bash)
11276  */
11277  struct variable *e;
11278  for (e = G.top_var; e; e = e->next) {
11279  if (e->flg_read_only) {
11280 //TODO: quote value: readonly VAR='VAL'
11281  printf("readonly %s\n", e->varstr);
11282  }
11283  }
11284  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11285  }
11286  return helper_export_local(argv, SETFLAG_MAKE_RO);
11287 }
11288 #endif
11289 
11290 #if ENABLE_HUSH_UNSET
11291 /* http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/V3_chap02.html#unset */
11292 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_unset(char **argv)
11293 {
11294  int ret;
11295  unsigned opts;
11296 
11297  /* "!": do not abort on errors */
11298  /* "+": stop at 1st non-option */
11299  opts = getopt32(argv, "!+vf");
11300  if (opts == (unsigned)-1)
11301  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11302  if (opts == 3) {
11303  bb_simple_error_msg("unset: -v and -f are exclusive");
11304  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11305  }
11306  argv += optind;
11307 
11308  ret = EXIT_SUCCESS;
11309  while (*argv) {
11310  if (!(opts & 2)) { /* not -f */
11311  if (unset_local_var(*argv)) {
11312  /* unset <nonexistent_var> doesn't fail.
11313  * Error is when one tries to unset RO var.
11314  * Message was printed by unset_local_var. */
11315  ret = EXIT_FAILURE;
11316  }
11317  }
11318 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
11319  else {
11320  unset_func(*argv);
11321  }
11322 # endif
11323  argv++;
11324  }
11325  return ret;
11326 }
11327 #endif
11328 
11329 #if ENABLE_HUSH_SET
11330 /* http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/V3_chap02.html#set
11331  * built-in 'set' handler
11332  * SUSv3 says:
11333  * set [-abCefhmnuvx] [-o option] [argument...]
11334  * set [+abCefhmnuvx] [+o option] [argument...]
11335  * set -- [argument...]
11336  * set -o
11337  * set +o
11338  * Implementations shall support the options in both their hyphen and
11339  * plus-sign forms. These options can also be specified as options to sh.
11340  * Examples:
11341  * Write out all variables and their values: set
11342  * Set $1, $2, and $3 and set "$#" to 3: set c a b
11343  * Turn on the -x and -v options: set -xv
11344  * Unset all positional parameters: set --
11345  * Set $1 to the value of x, even if it begins with '-' or '+': set -- "$x"
11346  * Set the positional parameters to the expansion of x, even if x expands
11347  * with a leading '-' or '+': set -- $x
11348  *
11349  * So far, we only support "set -- [argument...]" and some of the short names.
11350  */
11351 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_set(char **argv)
11352 {
11353  int n;
11354  char **pp, **g_argv;
11355  char *arg = *++argv;
11356 
11357  if (arg == NULL) {
11358  struct variable *e;
11359  for (e = G.top_var; e; e = e->next)
11360  puts(e->varstr);
11361  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11362  }
11363 
11364  do {
11365  if (strcmp(arg, "--") == 0) {
11366  ++argv;
11367  goto set_argv;
11368  }
11369  if (arg[0] != '+' && arg[0] != '-')
11370  break;
11371  for (n = 1; arg[n]; ++n) {
11372  if (set_mode((arg[0] == '-'), arg[n], argv[1])) {
11373  bb_error_msg("%s: %s: invalid option", "set", arg);
11374  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11375  }
11376  if (arg[n] == 'o' && argv[1])
11377  argv++;
11378  }
11379  } while ((arg = *++argv) != NULL);
11380  /* Now argv[0] is 1st argument */
11381 
11382  if (arg == NULL)
11383  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11384  set_argv:
11385 
11386  /* NB: G.global_argv[0] ($0) is never freed/changed */
11387  g_argv = G.global_argv;
11388  if (G.global_args_malloced) {
11389  pp = g_argv;
11390  while (*++pp)
11391  free(*pp);
11392  g_argv[1] = NULL;
11393  } else {
11394  G.global_args_malloced = 1;
11395  pp = xzalloc(sizeof(pp[0]) * 2);
11396  pp[0] = g_argv[0]; /* retain $0 */
11397  g_argv = pp;
11398  }
11399  /* This realloc's G.global_argv */
11400  G.global_argv = pp = add_strings_to_strings(g_argv, argv, /*dup:*/ 1);
11401 
11402  G.global_argc = 1 + string_array_len(pp + 1);
11403 
11404  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11405 }
11406 #endif
11407 
11408 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_shift(char **argv)
11409 {
11410  int n = 1;
11411  argv = skip_dash_dash(argv);
11412  if (argv[0]) {
11413  n = bb_strtou(argv[0], NULL, 10);
11414  if (errno || n < 0) {
11415  /* shared string with ash.c */
11416  bb_error_msg("Illegal number: %s", argv[0]);
11417  /*
11418  * ash aborts in this case.
11419  * bash prints error message and set $? to 1.
11420  * Interestingly, for "shift 99999" bash does not
11421  * print error message, but does set $? to 1
11422  * (and does no shifting at all).
11423  */
11424  }
11425  }
11426  if (n >= 0 && n < G.global_argc) {
11427  if (G_global_args_malloced) {
11428  int m = 1;
11429  while (m <= n)
11430  free(G.global_argv[m++]);
11431  }
11432  G.global_argc -= n;
11433  memmove(&G.global_argv[1], &G.global_argv[n+1],
11434  G.global_argc * sizeof(G.global_argv[0]));
11435  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11436  }
11437  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11438 }
11439 
11440 #if ENABLE_HUSH_GETOPTS
11441 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_getopts(char **argv)
11442 {
11443 /* http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/getopts.html
11444 
11445 TODO:
11446 If a required argument is not found, and getopts is not silent,
11447 a question mark (?) is placed in VAR, OPTARG is unset, and a
11448 diagnostic message is printed. If getopts is silent, then a
11449 colon (:) is placed in VAR and OPTARG is set to the option
11450 character found.
11451 
11452 Test that VAR is a valid variable name?
11453 
11454 "Whenever the shell is invoked, OPTIND shall be initialized to 1"
11455 */
11456  char cbuf[2];
11457  const char *cp, *optstring, *var;
11458  int c, n, exitcode, my_opterr;
11459  unsigned count;
11460 
11461  optstring = *++argv;
11462  if (!optstring || !(var = *++argv)) {
11463  bb_simple_error_msg("usage: getopts OPTSTRING VAR [ARGS]");
11464  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11465  }
11466 
11467  if (argv[1])
11468  argv[0] = G.global_argv[0]; /* for error messages in getopt() */
11469  else
11470  argv = G.global_argv;
11471  cbuf[1] = '\0';
11472 
11473  my_opterr = 0;
11474  if (optstring[0] != ':') {
11475  cp = get_local_var_value("OPTERR");
11476  /* 0 if "OPTERR=0", 1 otherwise */
11477  my_opterr = (!cp || NOT_LONE_CHAR(cp, '0'));
11478  }
11479 
11480  /* getopts stops on first non-option. Add "+" to force that */
11481  /*if (optstring[0] != '+')*/ {
11482  char *s = alloca(strlen(optstring) + 2);
11483  sprintf(s, "+%s", optstring);
11484  optstring = s;
11485  }
11486 
11487  /* Naively, now we should just
11488  * cp = get_local_var_value("OPTIND");
11489  * optind = cp ? atoi(cp) : 0;
11490  * optarg = NULL;
11491  * opterr = my_opterr;
11492  * c = getopt(string_array_len(argv), argv, optstring);
11493  * and be done? Not so fast...
11494  * Unlike normal getopt() usage in C programs, here
11495  * each successive call will (usually) have the same argv[] CONTENTS,
11496  * but not the ADDRESSES. Worse yet, it's possible that between
11497  * invocations of "getopts", there will be calls to shell builtins
11498  * which use getopt() internally. Example:
11499  * while getopts "abc" RES -a -bc -abc de; do
11500  * unset -ff func
11501  * done
11502  * This would not work correctly: getopt() call inside "unset"
11503  * modifies internal libc state which is tracking position in
11504  * multi-option strings ("-abc"). At best, it can skip options
11505  * or return the same option infinitely. With glibc implementation
11506  * of getopt(), it would use outright invalid pointers and return
11507  * garbage even _without_ "unset" mangling internal state.
11508  *
11509  * We resort to resetting getopt() state and calling it N times,
11510  * until we get Nth result (or failure).
11511  * (N == G.getopt_count is reset to 0 whenever OPTIND is [un]set).
11512  */
11513  GETOPT_RESET();
11514  count = 0;
11515  n = string_array_len(argv);
11516  do {
11517  optarg = NULL;
11518  opterr = (count < G.getopt_count) ? 0 : my_opterr;
11519  c = getopt(n, argv, optstring);
11520  if (c < 0)
11521  break;
11522  count++;
11523  } while (count <= G.getopt_count);
11524 
11525  /* Set OPTIND. Prevent resetting of the magic counter! */
11526  set_local_var_from_halves("OPTIND", utoa(optind));
11527  G.getopt_count = count; /* "next time, give me N+1'th result" */
11528  GETOPT_RESET(); /* just in case */
11529 
11530  /* Set OPTARG */
11531  /* Always set or unset, never left as-is, even on exit/error:
11532  * "If no option was found, or if the option that was found
11533  * does not have an option-argument, OPTARG shall be unset."
11534  */
11535  cp = optarg;
11536  if (c == '?') {
11537  /* If ":optstring" and unknown option is seen,
11538  * it is stored to OPTARG.
11539  */
11540  if (optstring[1] == ':') {
11541  cbuf[0] = optopt;
11542  cp = cbuf;
11543  }
11544  }
11545  if (cp)
11546  set_local_var_from_halves("OPTARG", cp);
11547  else
11548  unset_local_var("OPTARG");
11549 
11550  /* Convert -1 to "?" */
11551  exitcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
11552  if (c < 0) { /* -1: end of options */
11553  exitcode = EXIT_FAILURE;
11554  c = '?';
11555  }
11556 
11557  /* Set VAR */
11558  cbuf[0] = c;
11559  set_local_var_from_halves(var, cbuf);
11560 
11561  return exitcode;
11562 }
11563 #endif
11564 
11565 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_source(char **argv)
11566 {
11567  char *arg_path, *filename;
11568  HFILE *input;
11569  save_arg_t sv;
11570  char *args_need_save;
11571 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
11572  smallint sv_flg;
11573 #endif
11574 
11575  argv = skip_dash_dash(argv);
11576  filename = argv[0];
11577  if (!filename) {
11578  /* bash says: "bash: .: filename argument required" */
11579  return 2; /* bash compat */
11580  }
11581  arg_path = NULL;
11582  if (!strchr(filename, '/')) {
11583  arg_path = find_in_path(filename);
11584  if (arg_path)
11585  filename = arg_path;
11586  else if (!ENABLE_HUSH_BASH_SOURCE_CURDIR) {
11587  errno = ENOENT;
11588  bb_simple_perror_msg(filename);
11589  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11590  }
11591  }
11592  input = hfopen(filename);
11593  free(arg_path);
11594  if (!input) {
11595  bb_perror_msg("%s", filename);
11596  /* POSIX: non-interactive shell should abort here,
11597  * not merely fail. So far no one complained :)
11598  */
11599  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11600  }
11601 
11602 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
11603  sv_flg = G_flag_return_in_progress;
11604  /* "we are inside sourced file, ok to use return" */
11605  G_flag_return_in_progress = -1;
11606 #endif
11607  args_need_save = argv[1]; /* used as a boolean variable */
11608  if (args_need_save)
11609  save_and_replace_G_args(&sv, argv);
11610 
11611  /* "false; . ./empty_line; echo Zero:$?" should print 0 */
11612  G.last_exitcode = 0;
11613  parse_and_run_file(input);
11614  hfclose(input);
11615 
11616  if (args_need_save) /* can't use argv[1] instead: "shift" can mangle it */
11617  restore_G_args(&sv, argv);
11618 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
11619  G_flag_return_in_progress = sv_flg;
11620 #endif
11621 
11622  return G.last_exitcode;
11623 }
11624 
11625 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
11626 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_trap(char **argv)
11627 {
11628  int sig;
11629  char *new_cmd;
11630 
11631  if (!G_traps)
11632  G_traps = xzalloc(sizeof(G_traps[0]) * NSIG);
11633 
11634  argv++;
11635  if (!*argv) {
11636  int i;
11637  /* No args: print all trapped */
11638  for (i = 0; i < NSIG; ++i) {
11639  if (G_traps[i]) {
11640  printf("trap -- ");
11641  print_escaped(G_traps[i]);
11642  /* note: bash adds "SIG", but only if invoked
11643  * as "bash". If called as "sh", or if set -o posix,
11644  * then it prints short signal names.
11645  * We are printing short names: */
11646  printf(" %s\n", get_signame(i));
11647  }
11648  }
11649  /*fflush_all(); - done after each builtin anyway */
11650  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11651  }
11652 
11653  new_cmd = NULL;
11654  /* If first arg is a number: reset all specified signals */
11655  sig = bb_strtou(*argv, NULL, 10);
11656  if (errno == 0) {
11657  int ret;
11658  process_sig_list:
11659  ret = EXIT_SUCCESS;
11660  while (*argv) {
11661  sighandler_t handler;
11662 
11663  sig = get_signum(*argv++);
11664  if (sig < 0) {
11665  ret = EXIT_FAILURE;
11666  /* Mimic bash message exactly */
11667  bb_error_msg("trap: %s: invalid signal specification", argv[-1]);
11668  continue;
11669  }
11670 
11671  free(G_traps[sig]);
11672  G_traps[sig] = xstrdup(new_cmd);
11673 
11674  debug_printf("trap: setting SIG%s (%i) to '%s'\n",
11675  get_signame(sig), sig, G_traps[sig]);
11676 
11677  /* There is no signal for 0 (EXIT) */
11678  if (sig == 0)
11679  continue;
11680 
11681  if (new_cmd)
11682  handler = (new_cmd[0] ? record_pending_signo : SIG_IGN);
11683  else
11684  /* We are removing trap handler */
11685  handler = pick_sighandler(sig);
11686  install_sighandler(sig, handler);
11687  }
11688  return ret;
11689  }
11690 
11691  if (!argv[1]) { /* no second arg */
11692  bb_simple_error_msg("trap: invalid arguments");
11693  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11694  }
11695 
11696  /* First arg is "-": reset all specified to default */
11697  /* First arg is "--": skip it, the rest is "handler SIGs..." */
11698  /* Everything else: set arg as signal handler
11699  * (includes "" case, which ignores signal) */
11700  if (argv[0][0] == '-') {
11701  if (argv[0][1] == '\0') { /* "-" */
11702  /* new_cmd remains NULL: "reset these sigs" */
11703  goto reset_traps;
11704  }
11705  if (argv[0][1] == '-' && argv[0][2] == '\0') { /* "--" */
11706  argv++;
11707  }
11708  /* else: "-something", no special meaning */
11709  }
11710  new_cmd = *argv;
11711  reset_traps:
11712  argv++;
11713  goto process_sig_list;
11714 }
11715 #endif
11716 
11717 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
11718 static struct pipe *parse_jobspec(const char *str)
11719 {
11720  struct pipe *pi;
11721  unsigned jobnum;
11722 
11723  if (sscanf(str, "%%%u", &jobnum) != 1) {
11724  if (str[0] != '%'
11725  || (str[1] != '%' && str[1] != '+' && str[1] != '\0')
11726  ) {
11727  bb_error_msg("bad argument '%s'", str);
11728  return NULL;
11729  }
11730  /* It is "%%", "%+" or "%" - current job */
11731  jobnum = G.last_jobid;
11732  if (jobnum == 0) {
11733  bb_simple_error_msg("no current job");
11734  return NULL;
11735  }
11736  }
11737  for (pi = G.job_list; pi; pi = pi->next) {
11738  if (pi->jobid == jobnum) {
11739  return pi;
11740  }
11741  }
11742  bb_error_msg("%u: no such job", jobnum);
11743  return NULL;
11744 }
11745 
11746 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_jobs(char **argv UNUSED_PARAM)
11747 {
11748  struct pipe *job;
11749  const char *status_string;
11750 
11751  checkjobs(NULL, 0 /*(no pid to wait for)*/);
11752  for (job = G.job_list; job; job = job->next) {
11753  if (job->alive_cmds == job->stopped_cmds)
11754  status_string = "Stopped";
11755  else
11756  status_string = "Running";
11757 
11758  printf(JOB_STATUS_FORMAT, job->jobid, status_string, job->cmdtext);
11759  }
11760 
11761  clean_up_last_dead_job();
11762 
11763  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11764 }
11765 
11766 /* built-in 'fg' and 'bg' handler */
11767 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_fg_bg(char **argv)
11768 {
11769  int i;
11770  struct pipe *pi;
11771 
11772  if (!G_interactive_fd)
11773  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11774 
11775  /* If they gave us no args, assume they want the last backgrounded task */
11776  if (!argv[1]) {
11777  for (pi = G.job_list; pi; pi = pi->next) {
11778  if (pi->jobid == G.last_jobid) {
11779  goto found;
11780  }
11781  }
11782  bb_error_msg("%s: no current job", argv[0]);
11783  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11784  }
11785 
11786  pi = parse_jobspec(argv[1]);
11787  if (!pi)
11788  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11789  found:
11790  /* TODO: bash prints a string representation
11791  * of job being foregrounded (like "sleep 1 | cat") */
11792  if (argv[0][0] == 'f' && G_saved_tty_pgrp) {
11793  /* Put the job into the foreground. */
11794  tcsetpgrp(G_interactive_fd, pi->pgrp);
11795  }
11796 
11797  /* Restart the processes in the job */
11798  debug_printf_jobs("reviving %d procs, pgrp %d\n", pi->num_cmds, pi->pgrp);
11799  for (i = 0; i < pi->num_cmds; i++) {
11800  debug_printf_jobs("reviving pid %d\n", pi->cmds[i].pid);
11801  }
11802  pi->stopped_cmds = 0;
11803 
11804  i = kill(- pi->pgrp, SIGCONT);
11805  if (i < 0) {
11806  if (errno == ESRCH) {
11807  delete_finished_job(pi);
11808  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11809  }
11810  bb_simple_perror_msg("kill (SIGCONT)");
11811  }
11812 
11813  if (argv[0][0] == 'f') {
11814  remove_job_from_table(pi); /* FG job shouldn't be in job table */
11815  return checkjobs_and_fg_shell(pi);
11816  }
11817  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11818 }
11819 #endif
11820 
11821 #if ENABLE_HUSH_KILL
11822 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_kill(char **argv)
11823 {
11824  int ret = 0;
11825 
11826 # if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
11827  if (argv[1] && strcmp(argv[1], "-l") != 0) {
11828  int i = 1;
11829 
11830  do {
11831  struct pipe *pi;
11832  char *dst;
11833  int j, n;
11834 
11835  if (argv[i][0] != '%')
11836  continue;
11837  /*
11838  * "kill %N" - job kill
11839  * Converting to pgrp / pid kill
11840  */
11841  pi = parse_jobspec(argv[i]);
11842  if (!pi) {
11843  /* Eat bad jobspec */
11844  j = i;
11845  do {
11846  j++;
11847  argv[j - 1] = argv[j];
11848  } while (argv[j]);
11849  ret = 1;
11850  i--;
11851  continue;
11852  }
11853  /*
11854  * In jobs started under job control, we signal
11855  * entire process group by kill -PGRP_ID.
11856  * This happens, f.e., in interactive shell.
11857  *
11858  * Otherwise, we signal each child via
11859  * kill PID1 PID2 PID3.
11860  * Testcases:
11861  * sh -c 'sleep 1|sleep 1 & kill %1'
11862  * sh -c 'true|sleep 2 & sleep 1; kill %1'
11863  * sh -c 'true|sleep 1 & sleep 2; kill %1'
11864  */
11865  n = G_interactive_fd ? 1 : pi->num_cmds;
11866  dst = alloca(n * sizeof(int)*4);
11867  argv[i] = dst;
11868  if (G_interactive_fd)
11869  dst += sprintf(dst, " -%u", (int)pi->pgrp);
11870  else for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
11871  struct command *cmd = &pi->cmds[j];
11872  /* Skip exited members of the job */
11873  if (cmd->pid == 0)
11874  continue;
11875  /*
11876  * kill_main has matching code to expect
11877  * leading space. Needed to not confuse
11878  * negative pids with "kill -SIGNAL_NO" syntax
11879  */
11880  dst += sprintf(dst, " %u", (int)cmd->pid);
11881  }
11882  *dst = '\0';
11883  } while (argv[++i]);
11884  }
11885 # endif
11886 
11887  if (argv[1] || ret == 0) {
11888  ret = run_applet_main(argv, kill_main);
11889  }
11890  /* else: ret = 1, "kill %bad_jobspec" case */
11891  return ret;
11892 }
11893 #endif
11894 
11895 #if ENABLE_HUSH_WAIT
11896 /* http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/wait.html */
11897 # if !ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
11898 # define wait_for_child_or_signal(pipe,pid) wait_for_child_or_signal(pid)
11899 # endif
11900 static int wait_for_child_or_signal(struct pipe *waitfor_pipe, pid_t waitfor_pid)
11901 {
11902  int ret = 0;
11903  for (;;) {
11904  int sig;
11905  sigset_t oldset;
11906 
11907  if (!sigisemptyset(&G.pending_set))
11908  goto check_sig;
11909 
11910  /* waitpid is not interruptible by SA_RESTARTed
11911  * signals which we use. Thus, this ugly dance:
11912  */
11913 
11914  /* Make sure possible SIGCHLD is stored in kernel's
11915  * pending signal mask before we call waitpid.
11916  * Or else we may race with SIGCHLD, lose it,
11917  * and get stuck in sigsuspend...
11918  */
11919  sigfillset(&oldset); /* block all signals, remember old set */
11920  sigprocmask2(SIG_SETMASK, &oldset);
11921 
11922  if (!sigisemptyset(&G.pending_set)) {
11923  /* Crap! we raced with some signal! */
11924  goto restore;
11925  }
11926 
11927  /*errno = 0; - checkjobs does this */
11928 /* Can't pass waitfor_pipe into checkjobs(): it won't be interruptible */
11929  ret = checkjobs(NULL, waitfor_pid); /* waitpid(WNOHANG) inside */
11930  debug_printf_exec("checkjobs:%d\n", ret);
11931 # if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
11932  if (waitfor_pipe) {
11933  int rcode = job_exited_or_stopped(waitfor_pipe);
11934  debug_printf_exec("job_exited_or_stopped:%d\n", rcode);
11935  if (rcode >= 0) {
11936  ret = rcode;
11937  sigprocmask(SIG_SETMASK, &oldset, NULL);
11938  break;
11939  }
11940  }
11941 # endif
11942  /* if ECHILD, there are no children (ret is -1 or 0) */
11943  /* if ret == 0, no children changed state */
11944  /* if ret != 0, it's exitcode+1 of exited waitfor_pid child */
11945  if (errno == ECHILD || ret) {
11946  ret--;
11947  if (ret < 0) /* if ECHILD, may need to fix "ret" */
11948  ret = 0;
11949 # if ENABLE_HUSH_BASH_COMPAT
11950  if (waitfor_pid == -1 && errno == ECHILD) {
11951  /* exitcode of "wait -n" with no children is 127, not 0 */
11952  ret = 127;
11953  }
11954 # endif
11955  sigprocmask(SIG_SETMASK, &oldset, NULL);
11956  break;
11957  }
11958  /* Wait for SIGCHLD or any other signal */
11959  /* It is vitally important for sigsuspend that SIGCHLD has non-DFL handler! */
11960  /* Note: sigsuspend invokes signal handler */
11961  sigsuspend(&oldset);
11962  /* ^^^ add "sigdelset(&oldset, SIGCHLD)" before sigsuspend
11963  * to make sure SIGCHLD is not masked off?
11964  * It was reported that this:
11965  * fn() { : | return; }
11966  * shopt -s lastpipe
11967  * fn
11968  * exec hush SCRIPT
11969  * under bash 4.4.23 runs SCRIPT with SIGCHLD masked,
11970  * making "wait" commands in SCRIPT block forever.
11971  */
11972  restore:
11973  sigprocmask(SIG_SETMASK, &oldset, NULL);
11974  check_sig:
11975  /* So, did we get a signal? */
11976  sig = check_and_run_traps();
11977  if (sig /*&& sig != SIGCHLD - always true */) {
11978  /* Do this for any (non-ignored) signal, not only for ^C */
11979  ret = 128 | sig;
11980  break;
11981  }
11982  /* SIGCHLD, or no signal, or ignored one, such as SIGQUIT. Repeat */
11983  }
11984  return ret;
11985 }
11986 
11987 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_wait(char **argv)
11988 {
11989  int ret;
11990  int status;
11991 
11992  argv = skip_dash_dash(argv);
11993 # if ENABLE_HUSH_BASH_COMPAT
11994  if (argv[0] && strcmp(argv[0], "-n") == 0) {
11995  /* wait -n */
11996  /* (bash accepts "wait -n PID" too and ignores PID) */
11997  G.dead_job_exitcode = -1;
11998  return wait_for_child_or_signal(NULL, -1 /*no job, wait for one job*/);
11999  }
12000 # endif
12001  if (argv[0] == NULL) {
12002  /* Don't care about wait results */
12003  /* Note 1: must wait until there are no more children */
12004  /* Note 2: must be interruptible */
12005  /* Examples:
12006  * $ sleep 3 & sleep 6 & wait
12007  * [1] 30934 sleep 3
12008  * [2] 30935 sleep 6
12009  * [1] Done sleep 3
12010  * [2] Done sleep 6
12011  * $ sleep 3 & sleep 6 & wait
12012  * [1] 30936 sleep 3
12013  * [2] 30937 sleep 6
12014  * [1] Done sleep 3
12015  * ^C <-- after ~4 sec from keyboard
12016  * $
12017  */
12018  return wait_for_child_or_signal(NULL, 0 /*no job and no pid to wait for*/);
12019  }
12020 
12021  do {
12022  pid_t pid = bb_strtou(*argv, NULL, 10);
12023  if (errno || pid <= 0) {
12024 # if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
12025  if (argv[0][0] == '%') {
12026  struct pipe *wait_pipe;
12027  ret = 127; /* bash compat for bad jobspecs */
12028  wait_pipe = parse_jobspec(*argv);
12029  if (wait_pipe) {
12030  ret = job_exited_or_stopped(wait_pipe);
12031  if (ret < 0) {
12032  ret = wait_for_child_or_signal(wait_pipe, 0);
12033  } else {
12034  /* waiting on "last dead job" removes it */
12035  clean_up_last_dead_job();
12036  }
12037  }
12038  /* else: parse_jobspec() already emitted error msg */
12039  continue;
12040  }
12041 # endif
12042  /* mimic bash message */
12043  bb_error_msg("wait: '%s': not a pid or valid job spec", *argv);
12044  ret = EXIT_FAILURE;
12045  continue; /* bash checks all argv[] */
12046  }
12047 
12048  /* Do we have such child? */
12049  ret = waitpid(pid, &status, WNOHANG);
12050  if (ret < 0) {
12051  /* No */
12052  ret = 127;
12053  if (errno == ECHILD) {
12054  if (pid == G.last_bg_pid) {
12055  /* "wait $!" but last bg task has already exited. Try:
12056  * (sleep 1; exit 3) & sleep 2; echo $?; wait $!; echo $?
12057  * In bash it prints exitcode 0, then 3.
12058  * In dash, it is 127.
12059  */
12060  ret = G.last_bg_pid_exitcode;
12061  } else {
12062  /* Example: "wait 1". mimic bash message */
12063  bb_error_msg("wait: pid %u is not a child of this shell", (unsigned)pid);
12064  }
12065  } else {
12066  /* ??? */
12067  bb_perror_msg("wait %s", *argv);
12068  }
12069  continue; /* bash checks all argv[] */
12070  }
12071  if (ret == 0) {
12072  /* Yes, and it still runs */
12073  ret = wait_for_child_or_signal(NULL, pid);
12074  } else {
12075  /* Yes, and it just exited */
12076  process_wait_result(NULL, pid, status);
12077  ret = WEXITSTATUS(status);
12078  if (WIFSIGNALED(status))
12079  ret = 128 | WTERMSIG(status);
12080  }
12081  } while (*++argv);
12082 
12083  return ret;
12084 }
12085 #endif
12086 
12087 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS || ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
12088 static unsigned parse_numeric_argv1(char **argv, unsigned def, unsigned def_min)
12089 {
12090  if (argv[1]) {
12091  def = bb_strtou(argv[1], NULL, 10);
12092  if (errno || def < def_min || argv[2]) {
12093  bb_error_msg("%s: bad arguments", argv[0]);
12094  def = UINT_MAX;
12095  }
12096  }
12097  return def;
12098 }
12099 #endif
12100 
12101 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
12102 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_break(char **argv)
12103 {
12104  unsigned depth;
12105  if (G.depth_of_loop == 0) {
12106  bb_error_msg("%s: only meaningful in a loop", argv[0]);
12107  /* if we came from builtin_continue(), need to undo "= 1" */
12108  G.flag_break_continue = 0;
12109  return EXIT_SUCCESS; /* bash compat */
12110  }
12111  G.flag_break_continue++; /* BC_BREAK = 1, or BC_CONTINUE = 2 */
12112 
12113  G.depth_break_continue = depth = parse_numeric_argv1(argv, 1, 1);
12114  if (depth == UINT_MAX)
12115  G.flag_break_continue = BC_BREAK;
12116  if (G.depth_of_loop < depth)
12117  G.depth_break_continue = G.depth_of_loop;
12118 
12119  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
12120 }
12121 
12122 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_continue(char **argv)
12123 {
12124  G.flag_break_continue = 1; /* BC_CONTINUE = 2 = 1+1 */
12125  return builtin_break(argv);
12126 }
12127 #endif
12128 
12129 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
12130 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_return(char **argv)
12131 {
12132  int rc;
12133 
12134  if (G_flag_return_in_progress != -1) {
12135  bb_error_msg("%s: not in a function or sourced script", argv[0]);
12136  return EXIT_FAILURE; /* bash compat */
12137  }
12138 
12139  G_flag_return_in_progress = 1;
12140 
12141  /* bash:
12142  * out of range: wraps around at 256, does not error out
12143  * non-numeric param:
12144  * f() { false; return qwe; }; f; echo $?
12145  * bash: return: qwe: numeric argument required <== we do this
12146  * 255 <== we also do this
12147  */
12148  rc = parse_numeric_argv1(argv, G.last_exitcode, 0);
12149 # if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
12150  if (argv[1]) { /* "return ARG" inside a running trap sets $? */
12151  debug_printf_exec("G.return_exitcode=%d\n", rc);
12152  G.return_exitcode = rc;
12153  }
12154 # endif
12155  return rc;
12156 }
12157 #endif
12158 
12159 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TIMES
12160 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_times(char **argv UNUSED_PARAM)
12161 {
12162  static const uint8_t times_tbl[] ALIGN1 = {
12163  ' ', offsetof(struct tms, tms_utime),
12164  '\n', offsetof(struct tms, tms_stime),
12165  ' ', offsetof(struct tms, tms_cutime),
12166  '\n', offsetof(struct tms, tms_cstime),
12167  0
12168  };
12169  const uint8_t *p;
12170  unsigned clk_tck;
12171  struct tms buf;
12172 
12173  clk_tck = bb_clk_tck();
12174 
12175  times(&buf);
12176  p = times_tbl;
12177  do {
12178  unsigned sec, frac;
12179  unsigned long t;
12180  t = *(clock_t *)(((char *) &buf) + p[1]);
12181  sec = t / clk_tck;
12182  frac = t % clk_tck;
12183  printf("%um%u.%03us%c",
12184  sec / 60, sec % 60,
12185  (frac * 1000) / clk_tck,
12186  p[0]);
12187  p += 2;
12188  } while (*p);
12189 
12190  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
12191 }
12192 #endif
12193 
12194 #if ENABLE_HUSH_MEMLEAK
12195 static int FAST_FUNC builtin_memleak(char **argv UNUSED_PARAM)
12196 {
12197  void *p;
12198  unsigned long l;
12199 
12200 # ifdef M_TRIM_THRESHOLD
12201  /* Optional. Reduces probability of false positives */
12202  malloc_trim(0);
12203 # endif
12204  /* Crude attempt to find where "free memory" starts,
12205  * sans fragmentation. */
12206  p = malloc(240);
12207  l = (unsigned long)p;
12208  free(p);
12209  p = malloc(3400);
12210  if (l < (unsigned long)p) l = (unsigned long)p;
12211  free(p);
12212 
12213 
12214 # if 0 /* debug */
12215  {
12216  struct mallinfo mi = mallinfo();
12217  printf("top alloc:0x%lx malloced:%d+%d=%d\n", l,
12218  mi.arena, mi.hblkhd, mi.arena + mi.hblkhd);
12219  }
12220 # endif
12221 
12222  if (!G.memleak_value)
12223  G.memleak_value = l;
12224 
12225  l -= G.memleak_value;
12226  if ((long)l < 0)
12227  l = 0;
12228  l /= 1024;
12229  if (l > 127)
12230  l = 127;
12231 
12232  /* Exitcode is "how many kilobytes we leaked since 1st call" */
12233  return l;
12234 }
12235 #endif
